member.summary: BackBufferCopy buffers a rectangular region.

member.name: F:Godot.BackBufferCopy.COPY_MODE_VIEWPORT
member.summary: BackBufferCopy buffers the entire screen.

member.name: P:Godot.BackBufferCopy.CopyMode
member.summary: Buffer mode. See [code]COPY_MODE_*[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.BackBufferCopy.Rect
member.summary: The area covered by the BackBufferCopy. Only used if [code]copy_mode[/code] is [code]COPY_MODE_RECT[/code].

member.summary: Defines the area covered by the BackBufferCopy.

member.name: M:Godot.BackBufferCopy.GetRect
member.summary: Return the area covered by the BackBufferCopy.

member.summary: Set the copy mode of the BackBufferCopy. See [code]COPY_MODE_*[/code] constants.

member.name: M:Godot.BackBufferCopy.GetCopyMode
member.summary: Return the copy mode currently applied to the BackBufferCopy. See [code]COPY_MODE_*[/code] constants.

member.name: T:Godot.BaseButton
member.summary: BaseButton is the abstract base class for buttons, so it shouldn't be used directly (it doesn't display anything). Other types of buttons inherit from it.

member.name: F:Godot.BaseButton.DRAW_NORMAL
member.summary: The normal state (i.e. not pressed, not hovered, not toggled and enabled) of buttons.

member.name: F:Godot.BaseButton.DRAW_PRESSED
member.summary: The state of buttons are pressed.

member.name: F:Godot.BaseButton.DRAW_HOVER
member.summary: The state of buttons are hovered.

member.name: F:Godot.BaseButton.DRAW_DISABLED
member.summary: The state of buttons are disabled.

member.summary: Require just a press to consider the button clicked.

member.name: F:Godot.BaseButton.ACTION_MODE_BUTTON_RELEASE
member.summary: Require a press and a subsequent release before considering the button clicked.

member.name: P:Godot.BaseButton.Disabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the button is in disabled state and can't be clicked or toggled.

member.name: P:Godot.BaseButton.ToggleMode
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the button is in toggle mode. Makes the button flip state between pressed and unpressed each time its area is clicked.

member.name: P:Godot.BaseButton.Pressed
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the button's state is pressed. Means the button is pressed down or toggled (if toggle_mode is active).

member.summary: Determines when the button is considered clicked, one of the ACTION_MODE_* constants.

member.name: P:Godot.BaseButton.EnabledFocusMode
member.summary: Focus access mode to use when switching between enabled/disabled (see [method Control.set_focus_mode] and [member disabled]).

member.summary: [Shortcut] associated to the button.

member.name: P:Godot.BaseButton.Group
member.summary: [ButtonGroup] associated to the button.

member.name: M:Godot.BaseButton._Pressed
member.summary: Called when button is pressed.

member.name: M:Godot.BaseButton._Toggled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when button is toggled (only if toggle_mode is active).

member.summary: Set the button to pressed state (only if toggle_mode is active).

member.name: M:Godot.BaseButton.IsPressed

member.summary: Return true if mouse entered the button before it exit.

member.summary: Return the visual state used to draw the button. This is useful mainly when implementing your own draw code by either overriding _draw() or connecting to "draw" signal. The visual state of the button is defined by the DRAW_* enum.

member.name: M:Godot.BaseButton.GetEnabledFocusMode
member.summary: Returns focus access mode used when switching between enabled/disabled (see [method Control.set_focus_mode] and [method set_disabled]).

member.name: T:Godot.Camera
member.summary: Camera is a special node that displays what is visible from its current location. Cameras register themselves in the nearest [Viewport] node (when ascending the tree). Only one camera can be active per viewport. If no viewport is available ascending the tree, the Camera will register in the global viewport. In other words, a Camera just provides [i]3D[/i] display capabilities to a [Viewport], and, without one, a scene registered in that [Viewport] (or higher viewports) can't be displayed.

member.name: F:Godot.Camera.PROJECTION_PERSPECTIVE
member.summary: Perspective Projection (object's size on the screen becomes smaller when far away).

member.name: F:Godot.Camera.PROJECTION_ORTHOGONAL
member.summary: Orthogonal Projection (objects remain the same size on the screen no matter how far away they are).

member.name: F:Godot.Camera.KEEP_WIDTH
member.summary: Try to keep the aspect ratio when scaling the Camera's viewport to the screen. If not possible, preserve the viewport's width by changing the height. Height is [code]sizey[/code] for orthographic projection, [code]fovy[/code] for perspective projection.

member.name: F:Godot.Camera.KEEP_HEIGHT
member.summary: Try to keep the aspect ratio when scaling the Camera's viewport to the screen. If not possible, preserve the viewport's height by changing the width. Width is [code]sizex[/code] for orthographic projection, [code]fovx[/code] for perspective projection.

member.name: F:Godot.Camera.DOPPLER_TRACKING_DISABLED
member.summary: Disable Doppler effect simulation (default).

member.name: F:Godot.Camera.DOPPLER_TRACKING_IDLE_STEP
member.summary: Simulate Doppler effect by tracking positions of objects that are changed in [code]_process[/code]. Changes in the relative velocity of this Camera compared to those objects affect how Audio is perceived (changing the Audio's [code]pitch shift[/code]).

member.name: F:Godot.Camera.DOPPLER_TRACKING_PHYSICS_STEP
member.summary: Simulate Doppler effect by tracking positions of objects that are changed in [code]_physics_process[/code]. Changes in the relative velocity of this Camera compared to those objects affect how Audio is perceived (changing the Audio's [code]pitch shift[/code]).

member.summary: Returns how a 2D coordinate in the Viewport rectangle maps to a 3D point in worldspace.

member.name: T:Godot.Camera2D
member.summary: Camera node for 2D scenes. It forces the screen (current layer) to scroll following this node. This makes it easier (and faster) to program scrollable scenes than manually changing the position of [CanvasItem] based nodes. This node is intended to be a simple helper to get things going quickly and it may happen often that more functionality is desired to change how the camera works. To make your own custom camera node, simply inherit from [Node2D] and change the transform of the canvas by calling get_viewport().set_canvas_transform(m) in [Viewport].

member.name: P:Godot.Camera2D.Offset
member.summary: The camera's offset, useful for looking around or camera shake animations.

member.name: P:Godot.Camera2D.AnchorMode

member.name: T:Godot.CanvasItem
member.summary: Base class of anything 2D. Canvas items are laid out in a tree and children inherit and extend the transform of their parent. CanvasItem is extended by [Control], for anything GUI related, and by [Node2D] for anything 2D engine related. Any CanvasItem can draw. For this, the "update" function must be called, then NOTIFICATION_DRAW will be received on idle time to request redraw. Because of this, canvas items don't need to be redraw on every frame, improving the performance significantly. Several functions for drawing on the CanvasItem are provided (see draw_* functions). They can only be used inside the notification, signal or _draw() overrides function, though. Canvas items are draw in tree order. By default, children are on top of their parents so a root CanvasItem will be drawn behind everything (this can be changed per item though). Canvas items can also be hidden (hiding also their subtree). They provide many means for changing standard parameters such as opacity (for it and the subtree) and self opacity, blend mode. Ultimately, a transform notification can be requested, which will notify the node that its global position changed in case the parent tree changed.

member.name: F:Godot.CanvasItem.BLEND_MODE_MIX
member.summary: Mix blending mode. Colors are assumed to be independent of the alpha (opacity) value.

member.name: F:Godot.CanvasItem.BLEND_MODE_ADD
member.summary: Additive blending mode.

member.name: F:Godot.CanvasItem.BLEND_MODE_MUL
member.summary: Multiplicative blending mode.

member.name: F:Godot.CanvasItem.BLEND_MODE_PREMULT_ALPHA
member.summary: Mix blending mode. Colors are assumed to be premultiplied by the alpha (opacity) value.

member.name: T:Godot.CanvasLayer
member.summary: Canvas drawing layer. [CanvasItem] nodes that are direct or indirect children of a [code]CanvasLayer[/code] will be drawn in that layer. The layer is a numeric index that defines the draw order. The default 2D scene renders with index 0, so a [code]CanvasLayer[/code] with index -1 will be drawn below, and one with index 1 will be drawn above. This is very useful for HUDs (in layer 1+ or above), or backgrounds (in layer -1 or below).

member.name: P:Godot.CanvasLayer.Layer
member.summary: Layer index for draw order. Lower values are drawn first. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.CanvasLayer.Offset
member.summary: The layer's base offset.

member.name: P:Godot.CanvasLayer.Rotation
member.summary: The layer's rotation in degrees.

member.name: P:Godot.CanvasLayer.Scale
member.summary: The layer's scale.

member.name: M:Godot.CanvasLayer.SetLayer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the layer index, determines the draw order, a lower value will be below a higher one.

member.name: M:Godot.CanvasLayer.GetLayer
member.summary: Return the layer index, determines the draw order, a lower value will be below a higher one.

member.name: T:Godot.ClassDB
member.summary: Provides access to metadata stored for every available class.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.GetClassList
member.summary: Returns the names of all the classes available.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.GetInheritersFromClass(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the names of all the classes that directly or indirectly inherit from 'class'.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.GetParentClass(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the parent class of 'class'.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassExists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether the specified 'class' is available or not.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.IsParentClass(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether 'inherits' is an ancestor of 'class' or not.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.CanInstance(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if you can instance objects from the specified 'class', false in other case.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.Instance(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of 'class'.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassHasSignal(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return whether 'class' or its ancestry has a signal called 'signal' or not.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassGetSignal(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the 'signal' data of 'class' or its ancestry. The returned value is a [Dictionary] with the following keys: args, default_args, flags, id, name, return: (class_name, hint, hint_string, name, type, usage).

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassGetSignalList(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an array with all the signals of 'class' or its ancestry if 'no_inheritance' is false. Every element of the array is a [Dictionary] as described in [class_get_signal].

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassGetPropertyList(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an array with all the properties of 'class' or its ancestry if 'no_inheritance' is false.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassGetProperty(Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of 'property' of 'class' or its ancestry.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassSetProperty(Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets 'property' value of 'class' to 'value'.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassHasMethod(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return whether 'class' (or its ancestry if 'no_inheritance' is false) has a method called 'method' or not.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassGetMethodList(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an array with all the methods of 'class' or its ancestry if 'no_inheritance' is false. Every element of the array is a [Dictionary] with the following keys: args, default_args, flags, id, name, return: (class_name, hint, hint_string, name, type, usage).

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassGetIntegerConstantList(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an array with the names all the integer constants of 'class' or its ancestry.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassHasIntegerConstant(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return whether 'class' or its ancestry has an integer constant called 'name' or not.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.ClassGetIntegerConstant(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of the integer constant 'name' of 'class' or its ancestry. Always returns 0 when the constant could not be found.

member.name: M:Godot.ClassDB.IsClassEnabled(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether this class is enabled or not.

member.name: T:Godot.CollisionObject
member.summary: CollisionObject is the base class for physics objects. It can hold any number of collision [Shape]s. Each shape must be assigned to a [i]shape owner[/i]. The CollisionObject can have any number of shape owners. Shape owners are not nodes and do not appear in the editor, but are accessible through code using the [code]shape_owner_*[/code] methods.

member.name: M:Godot.CollisionObject.GetRid
member.summary: Returns the object's [RID].

member.name: M:Godot.CollisionObject.CreateShapeOwner(Godot.Object)

member.summary: Removes the given shape owner.

member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the shape owner and its shapes are disabled.

member.name: T:Godot.CollisionPolygon
member.summary: Allows editing a collision polygon's vertices on a selected plane. Can also set a depth perpendicular to that plane. This class is only available in the editor. It will not appear in the scene tree at runtime. Creates a [Shape] for gameplay. Properties modified during gameplay will have no effect.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionPolygon.Depth
member.summary: Length that the resulting collision extends in either direction perpendicular to its polygon.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionPolygon.Disabled
member.summary: If true, no collision will be produced.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionPolygon.Polygon
member.summary: Array of vertices which define the polygon.

member.name: T:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D
member.summary: Provides a 2D collision polygon to a [CollisionObject2D] parent. Polygon can be drawn in the editor or specified by a list of vertices.

member.name: F:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.BUILD_SOLIDS
member.summary: Collisions will include the polygon and its contained area.

member.name: F:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.BUILD_SEGMENTS
member.summary: Collisions will only include the polygon edges.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.BuildMode
member.summary: Collision build mode. Use one of the [code]BUILD_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]BUILD_SOLIDS[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.Polygon
member.summary: The polygon's list of vertices. The final point will be connected to the first.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.Disabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] no collisions will be detected.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.OneWayCollision
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] only edges that face up, relative to CollisionPolygon2D's rotation, will collide with other objects.

member.name: M:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.SetPolygon(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Set the array of points forming the polygon. When editing the point list via the editor, depending on [method get_build_mode], it has to be a list of points (for [code]build_mode==0[/code]), or a list of lines (for [code]build_mode==1[/code]). In the second case, the even elements of the array define the start point of the line, and the odd elements the end point.

member.name: M:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.GetPolygon
member.summary: Return the list of points that define the polygon.

member.name: M:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.SetBuildMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set whether the polygon is to be a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==0[/code]), or a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==1[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.CollisionPolygon2D.GetBuildMode
member.summary: Return whether the polygon is a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==0[/code]), or a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==1[/code]).

member.name: T:Godot.CollisionShape
member.summary: Editor facility for creating and editing collision shapes in 3D space. You can use this node to represent all sorts of collision shapes, for example, add this to an [Area] to give it a detection shape, or add it to a [PhysicsBody] to give create solid object. [b]IMPORTANT[/b]: this is an Editor-only helper to create shapes, use [method get_shape] to get the actual shape.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionShape.Shape
member.summary: The actual shape owned by this collision shape.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionShape.Disabled
member.summary: A disabled collision shape has no effect in the world.

member.name: M:Godot.CollisionShape.ResourceChanged(Godot.Resource)
member.summary: If this method exists within a script it will be called whenever the shape resource has been modified.

member.name: M:Godot.CollisionShape.MakeConvexFromBrothers
member.summary: Sets the collision shape's shape to the addition of all its convexed [MeshInstance] siblings geometry.

member.name: T:Godot.CollisionShape2D
member.summary: Editor facility for creating and editing collision shapes in 2D space. You can use this node to represent all sorts of collision shapes, for example, add this to an [Area2D] to give it a detection shape, or add it to a [PhysicsBody2D] to give create solid object. [b]IMPORTANT[/b]: this is an Editor-only helper to create shapes, use [method get_shape] to get the actual shape.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionShape2D.Shape
member.summary: The actual shape owned by this collision shape.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionShape2D.Disabled
member.summary: A disabled collision shape has no effect in the world.

member.name: P:Godot.CollisionShape2D.OneWayCollision
member.summary: Sets whether this collision shape should only detect collision on one side (top or bottom).

member.name: T:Godot.ColorPicker
member.summary: This is a simple color picker [Control]. It's useful for selecting a color from an RGB/RGBA colorspace.

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPicker.SetPickColor(Godot.Color)
member.summary: Select the current color.

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPicker.GetPickColor
member.summary: Gets the current color.

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPicker.SetRawMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether this color picker is using raw mode or not, see [method is_raw_mode].

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPicker.IsRawMode
member.summary: Returns whether this color picker is in raw mode or not, raw mode will allow the color R, G, B component values to go beyond 1, you have to consider that the max value for color components is 1, going beyond that value will not have effect in the color, but can be used for special operations that require it (like tinting without darkening or rendering sprites in HDR).

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPicker.SetEditAlpha(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set true if you want the color to have an alpha channel (transparency), or false if you want a solid color.

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPicker.IsEditingAlpha
member.summary: Returns whether the color has transparency or not.

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPicker.AddPreset(Godot.Color)
member.summary: Adds the current selected to color to a list of colors (presets), the presets will be displayed in the color picker and the user will be able to select them, notice that the presets list is only for this color picker.

member.name: T:Godot.ColorPickerButton
member.summary: Encapsulates a [ColorPicker] making it accesible by pressing a button, pressing the button will toggle the [ColorPicker] visibility

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPickerButton.SetPickColor(Godot.Color)
member.summary: Set new color to ColorRect. [codeblock] var cr = get_node("colorrect_node") cr.set_frame_color(Color(1, 0, 0, 1)) # Set color rect node to red [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPickerButton.SetEditAlpha(System.Boolean)
member.summary: See [method ColorPicker.set_edit_alpha]

member.name: M:Godot.ColorPickerButton.IsEditingAlpha
member.summary: See [method ColorPicker.is_edit_alpha]

member.name: T:Godot.ConcavePolygonShape
member.summary: Concave polygon shape resource, which can be set into a [PhysicsBody] or area. This shape is created by feeding a list of triangles.

member.name: M:Godot.ConcavePolygonShape.SetFaces(Godot.Vector3[])
member.summary: Set the faces (an array of triangles).

member.name: M:Godot.ConcavePolygonShape.GetFaces
member.summary: Return the faces (an array of triangles).

member.name: T:Godot.ConcavePolygonShape2D
member.summary: Concave polygon 2D shape resource for physics. It is made out of segments and is very optimal for complex polygonal concave collisions. It is really not advised to use for [RigidBody2D] nodes. A CollisionPolygon2D in convex decomposition mode (solids) or several convex objects are advised for that instead. Otherwise, a concave polygon 2D shape is better for static collisions. The main difference between a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] and a [code]ConcavePolygonShape2D[/code] is that a concave polygon assumes it is concave and uses a more complex method of collision detection, and a convex one forces itself to be convex in order to speed up collision detection.

member.name: M:Godot.ConcavePolygonShape2D.SetSegments(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Set the array of segments.

member.name: M:Godot.ConcavePolygonShape2D.GetSegments
member.summary: Return the array of segments.

member.name: T:Godot.ConeTwistJoint
member.summary: The joint can rotate the bodies across an axis defined by the local x-axes of the [Joint]. The twist axis is initiated as the x-axis of the [Joint]. Once the Bodies swing, the twist axis is calculated as the middle of the x-axes of the Joint in the local space of the two Bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.PARAM_SWING_SPAN
member.summary: Swing is rotation from side to side, around the axis perpendicular to the twist axis. The swing span defines, how much rotation will not get corrected allong the swing axis. Could be defined as looseness in the [code]ConeTwistJoint[/code]. If below 0.05, this behaviour is locked. Default value: [code]PI/4[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.PARAM_TWIST_SPAN
member.summary: Twist is the rotation around the twist axis, this value defined how far the joint can twist. Twist is locked if below 0.05.

member.name: F:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.PARAM_BIAS
member.summary: The speed with which the swing or twist will take place. The higher, the faster.

member.name: F:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.PARAM_SOFTNESS
member.summary: The ease with which the joint starts to twist. If it's too low, it takes more force to start twisting the joint.

member.name: F:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.PARAM_RELAXATION
member.summary: Defines, how fast the swing- and twist-speed-difference on both sides gets synced.

member.name: F:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.PARAM_MAX
member.summary: End flag of PARAM_* constants, used internally.

member.name: P:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.SwingSpan
member.summary: Swing is rotation from side to side, around the axis perpendicular to the twist axis. The swing span defines, how much rotation will not get corrected allong the swing axis. Could be defined as looseness in the [code]ConeTwistJoint[/code]. If below 0.05, this behaviour is locked. Default value: [code]PI/4[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.TwistSpan
member.summary: Twist is the rotation around the twist axis, this value defined how far the joint can twist. Twist is locked if below 0.05.

member.name: P:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.Bias
member.summary: The speed with which the swing or twist will take place. The higher, the faster.

member.name: P:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.Softness
member.summary: The ease with which the joint starts to twist. If it's too low, it takes more force to start twisting the joint.

member.name: P:Godot.ConeTwistJoint.Relaxation
member.summary: Defines, how fast the swing- and twist-speed-difference on both sides gets synced.

member.name: T:Godot.ConfigFile
member.summary: This helper class can be used to store [Variant] values on the filesystem using INI-style formatting. The stored values are indentified by a section and a key: [codeblock] [section] some_key=42 string_example="Hello World!" a_vector=Vector3( 1, 0, 2 ) [/codeblock] The stored data can be saved to or parsed from a file, though ConfigFile objects can also be used directly without accessing the filesystem. The following example shows how to parse an INI-style file from the system, read its contents and store new values in it: [codeblock] var config = ConfigFile.new() var err = config.load("user://settings.cfg") if err == OK: # if not, something went wrong with the file loading # Look for the display/width pair, and default to 1024 if missing var screen_width = get_value("display", "width", 1024) # Store a variable if and only if it hasn't been defined yet if not config.has_section_key("audio", "mute"): config.set_value("audio", "mute", false) # Save the changes by overwriting the previous file config.save("user://settings.cfg") [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.ConfigFile.SetValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Assigns a value to the specified key of the the specified section. If the section and/or the key do not exist, they are created. Passing a [code]null[/code] value deletes the specified key if it exists, and deletes the section if it ends up empty once the key has been removed.

member.name: M:Godot.ConfigFile.GetValue(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the current value for the specified section and key. If the section and/or the key do not exist, the method returns the value of the optional [code]default[/code] argument, or [code]null[/code] if it is omitted.

member.name: M:Godot.ConfigFile.HasSection(System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the specified section exists.

member.name: M:Godot.ConfigFile.HasSectionKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the specified section-key pair exists.

member.name: M:Godot.ConfigFile.GetSections
member.summary: Returns an array of all defined section identifiers.

member.name: M:Godot.ConfigFile.GetSectionKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array of all defined key identifiers in the specified section.

member.name: M:Godot.ConfigFile.EraseSection(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the specified section along with all the key-value pairs inside.

member.name: M:Godot.ConfigFile.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the config file specified as a parameter. The file's contents are parsed and loaded in the ConfigFile object which the method was called on. Returns one of the [code]OK[/code], [code]FAILED[/code] or [code]ERR_*[/code] constants listed in [@Global Scope]. If the load was successful, the return value is [code]OK[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.ConfigFile.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the contents of the ConfigFile object to the file specified as a parameter. The output file uses an INI-style structure. Returns one of the [code]OK[/code], [code]FAILED[/code] or [code]ERR_*[/code] constants listed in [@Global Scope]. If the load was successful, the return value is [code]OK[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.ConfirmationDialog

member.name: T:Godot.Container
member.summary: Base node for containers. A [code]Container[/code] contains other controls and automatically arranges them in a certain way. A Control can inherit this to create custom container classes.

member.name: F:Godot.Container.NOTIFICATION_SORT_CHILDREN
member.summary: Notification for when sorting the children, it must be obeyed immediately.

member.name: M:Godot.Container.QueueSort
member.summary: Queue resort of the contained children. This is called automatically anyway, but can be called upon request.

member.name: M:Godot.Container.FitChildInRect(Godot.Control,Godot.Rect2)
member.summary: Fit a child control in a given rect. This is mainly a helper for creating custom container classes.

member.name: T:Godot.Control
member.summary: Base class for all User Interface or [i]UI[/i] related nodes. [code]Control[/code] features a bounding rectangle that defines its extents, an anchor position relative to its parent and margins that represent an offset to the anchor. The margins update automatically when the node, any of its parents, or the screen size change. For more information on Godot's UI system, anchors, margins, and containers, see the related tutorials in the manual. To build flexible UIs, you'll need a mix of UI elements that inherit from [code]Control[/code] and [Container] nodes. [b]User Interface nodes and input[/b] Godot sends input events to the scene's root node first, by calling [method Node._input]. [method Node._input] forwards the event down the node tree to the nodes under the mouse cursor, or on keyboard focus. To do so, it calls [method MainLoop._input_event]. Call [method accept_event] so no other node receives the event. Once you accepted an input, it becomes handled so [method Node._unhandled_input] will not process it. Only one [code]Control[/code] node can be in keyboard focus. Only the node in focus will receive keyboard events. To get the foucs, call [method set_focus_mode]. [code]Control[/code] nodes lose focus when another node grabs it, or if you hide the node in focus. Call [method set_ignore_mouse] to tell a [code]Control[/code] node to ignore mouse or touch events. You'll need it if you place an icon on top of a button. [Theme] resources change the Control's appearance. If you change the [Theme] on a [code]Control[/code] node, it affects all of its children. To override some of the theme's parameters, call one of the [code]add_*_override[/code] methods, like [method add_font_override]. You can override the theme with the inspector.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.FOCUS_NONE
member.summary: The node cannot grab focus. Use with [member set_focus_mode].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.FOCUS_CLICK
member.summary: The node can only grab focus on mouse clicks. Use with [member set_focus_mode].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.FOCUS_ALL
member.summary: The node can grab focus on mouse click or using the arrows and the Tab keys on the keyboard. Use with [member set_focus_mode].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NOTIFICATION_RESIZED
member.summary: Sent when the node changes size. Use [member rect_size] to get the new size.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NOTIFICATION_MOUSE_ENTER
member.summary: Sent when the mouse pointer enters the node's [code]Rect[/code] area.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NOTIFICATION_MOUSE_EXIT
member.summary: Sent when the mouse pointer exits the node's [code]Rect[/code] area.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NOTIFICATION_FOCUS_ENTER
member.summary: Sent when the node grabs focus.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NOTIFICATION_FOCUS_EXIT
member.summary: Sent when the node loses focus.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NOTIFICATION_THEME_CHANGED
member.summary: Sent when the node's [member theme] changes, right before Godot redraws the [code]Control[/code]. Happens when you call one of the [code]add_*_override[/code]

member.name: F:Godot.Control.NOTIFICATION_MODAL_CLOSE
member.summary: Sent when an open modal dialog closes. See [member show_modal].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_ARROW
member.summary: Show the system's arrow mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. Use with [method set_default_cursor_shape].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_IBEAM
member.summary: Show the system's I-beam mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. The I-beam pointer has a shape similar to "I". It tells the user they can highlight or insert text.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_POINTING_HAND
member.summary: Show the system's pointing hand mouse cursor when the user hovers the node.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_CROSS
member.summary: Show the system's cross mouse cursor when the user hovers the node.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_WAIT
member.summary: Show the system's wait mouse cursor, often an hourglass, when the user hovers the node.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_BUSY
member.summary: Show the system's busy mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. Often an hourglass.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_DRAG
member.summary: Show the system's drag mouse cursor, often a closed fist or a cross symbol, when the user hovers the node. It tells the user they're currently dragging an item, like a node in the Scene dock.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_CAN_DROP
member.summary: Show the system's drop mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. It can be an open hand. It tells the user they can drop an item they're currently grabbing, like a node in the Scene dock.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_FORBIDDEN
member.summary: Show the system's forbidden mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. Often a crossed circle.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_VSIZE
member.summary: Show the system's vertical resize mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. A double headed vertical arrow. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel vertically.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_HSIZE
member.summary: Show the system's horizontal resize mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. A double headed horizontal arrow. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel horizontally.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_BDIAGSIZE
member.summary: Show the system's window resize mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. The cursor is a double headed arrow that goes from the bottom left to the top right. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_FDIAGSIZE
member.summary: Show the system's window resize mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. The cursor is a double headed arrow that goes from the top left to the bottom right, the opposite of [code]CURSOR_BDIAGSIZE[/code]. It tells the user they can resize the window or the panel both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_MOVE
member.summary: Show the system's move mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. It shows 2 double-headed arrows at a 90 degree angle. It tells the user they can move a UI element freely.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_VSPLIT
member.summary: Show the system's vertical split mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. On Windows, it's the same as [code]CURSOR_VSIZE[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_HSPLIT
member.summary: Show the system's horizontal split mouse cursor when the user hovers the node. On Windows, it's the same as [code]CURSOR_HSIZE[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.CURSOR_HELP
member.summary: Show the system's help mouse cursor when the user hovers the node, a question mark.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_TOP_LEFT
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the top-left of the parent container's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_TOP_RIGHT
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the top-right of the parent container's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_BOTTOM_LEFT
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the bottom-left of the parent container's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_BOTTOM_RIGHT
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the bottom-right of the parent container's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_CENTER_LEFT
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the left edge of the parent container's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_CENTER_TOP
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the top edge of the parent container's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_CENTER_RIGHT
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the right edge of the parent container's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_CENTER_BOTTOM
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the bottom edge of the parent container's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_CENTER
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the center of the parent container's bounds. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_LEFT_WIDE
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the left edge of the parent container. The left margin becomes relative to the left edge and the top margin relative to the top left corner of the node's parent. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_TOP_WIDE
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the top edge of the parent container. The left margin becomes relative to the top left corner, the top margin relative to the top edge, and the right margin relative to the top right corner of the node's parent. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_RIGHT_WIDE
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the right edge of the parent container. The right margin becomes relative to the right edge and the top margin relative to the top right corner of the node's parent. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_BOTTOM_WIDE
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the bottom edge of the parent container. The left margin becomes relative to the bottom left corner, the bottom margin relative to the bottom edge, and the right margin relative to the bottom right corner of the node's parent. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_VCENTER_WIDE
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to a vertical line that cuts the parent container in half. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_HCENTER_WIDE
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to a horizontal line that cuts the parent container in half. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.PRESET_WIDE
member.summary: Snap all 4 anchors to the respective corners of the parent container. Set all 4 margins to 0 after you applied this preset and the [code]Control[/code] will fit its parent container. Use with [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SIZE_FILL
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] to expand the bounds of this node to fill all the available space without pushing any other node. Use with [member size_flags_horizontal] and [member size_flags_vertical].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SIZE_EXPAND
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] to let this node take all the available space on the axis you flag. If multiple neighboring nodes are set to expand, they'll share the space based on their stretch ratio. See [member size_flags_stretch_ratio]. Use with [member size_flags_horizontal] and [member size_flags_vertical].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SIZE_EXPAND_FILL
member.summary: Sets the node's size flags to both fill and expand. See the 2 constants above for more information.

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SIZE_SHRINK_CENTER
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] to center the node in itself. It centers the [code]Control[/code] based on its bounding box, so it doesn't work with the fill or expand size flags. Use with [member size_flags_horizontal] and [member size_flags_vertical].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.SIZE_SHRINK_END
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] to align the node with its end, either the bottom or the right edge. It doesn't work with the fill or expand size flags. Use with [member size_flags_horizontal] and [member size_flags_vertical].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.ANCHOR_BEGIN
member.summary: Snaps one of the 4 anchor's sides to the origin of the node's [code]Rect[/code], in the top left. Use it with one of the [code]anchor_*[/code] member variables, like [member anchor_left]. To change all 4 anchors at once, use [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: F:Godot.Control.ANCHOR_END
member.summary: Snaps one of the 4 anchor's sides to the end of the node's [code]Rect[/code], in the bottom right. Use it with one of the [code]anchor_*[/code] member variables, like [member anchor_left]. To change all 4 anchors at once, use [method set_anchors_preset].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.AnchorLeft
member.summary: Anchors the left edge of the node to the origin, the center or the end of its parent container. It changes how the left margin updates when the node moves or changes size. Use one of the [code]ANCHOR_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]ANCHOR_BEGIN[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.AnchorTop
member.summary: Anchors the top edge of the node to the origin, the center or the end of its parent container. It changes how the top margin updates when the node moves or changes size. Use one of the [code]ANCHOR_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]ANCHOR_BEGIN[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.AnchorRight
member.summary: Anchors the right edge of the node to the origin, the center or the end of its parent container. It changes how the right margin updates when the node moves or changes size. Use one of the [code]ANCHOR_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]ANCHOR_BEGIN[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.AnchorBottom
member.summary: Anchors the bottom edge of the node to the origin, the center, or the end of its parent container. It changes how the bottom margin updates when the node moves or changes size. Use one of the [code]ANCHOR_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]ANCHOR_BEGIN[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MarginLeft
member.summary: Distance between the node's left edge and its parent container, based on [member anchor_left].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MarginTop
member.summary: Distance between the node's top edge and its parent container, based on [member anchor_top].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MarginRight
member.summary: Distance between the node's right edge and its parent container, based on [member anchor_right].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.MarginBottom
member.summary: Distance between the node's bottom edge and its parent container, based on [member anchor_bottom]. Margins are often controlled by one or multiple parent [Container] nodes. Margins update automatically when you move or resize the node.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectPosition
member.summary: The node's position, relative to its parent. It corresponds to the rectangle's top-left corner. The property is not affected by [member rect_pivot_offset].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectSize
member.summary: The size of the node's bounding rectangle, in pixels. [Container] nodes update this property automatically.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectMinSize
member.summary: The minimum size of the node's bounding rectangle. If you set it to a value greater than (0, 0), the node's bounding rectangle will always have at least this size, even if its content is smaller. If it's set to (0, 0), the node sizes automatically to fit its content, be it a texture or child nodes.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectRotation
member.summary: The node's rotation around its pivot, in degrees. See [member rect_pivot_offset] to change the pivot's position.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectScale
member.summary: The node's scale, relative to its [member rect_size]. Change this property to scale the node around its [member rect_pivot_offset].

member.name: P:Godot.Control.RectPivotOffset
member.summary: By default, the node's pivot is its top-left corner. When you change its [member rect_scale], it will scale around this pivot. Set this property to [member rect_size] / 2 to center the pivot in the node's rectangle.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.HintTooltip
member.summary: Changes the tooltip text. The tooltip appears when the user's mouse cursor stays idle over this control for a few moments.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusNeighbourLeft
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses Shift+Tab, the left arrow on the keyboard or left on a gamepad. The node must be a [code]Control[/code]. If this property is not set, Godot will give focus to the closest [code]Control[/code] to the left of this one.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusNeighbourTop
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses Shift+Tab, the top arrow on the keyboard or top on a gamepad. The node must be a [code]Control[/code]. If this property is not set, Godot will give focus to the closest [code]Control[/code] to the bottom of this one.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusNeighbourRight
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses Tab, the right arrow on the keyboard or right on a gamepad. The node must be a [code]Control[/code]. If this property is not set, Godot will give focus to the closest [code]Control[/code] to the bottom of this one.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.FocusNeighbourBottom
member.summary: Tells Godot which node it should give keyboard focus to if the user presses Tab, the down arrow on the keyboard, or down on a gamepad. The node must be a [code]Control[/code]. If this property is not set, Godot will give focus to the closest [code]Control[/code] to the bottom of this one. If the user presses Tab, Godot will give focus to the closest node to the right first, then to the bottom. If the user presses Shift+Tab, Godot will look to the left of the node, then above it.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.SizeFlagsHorizontal
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] nodes how they should resize and place the node on the X axis. Use one of the [code]SIZE_*[/code] constants to change the flags. See the constants to learn what each does.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.SizeFlagsVertical
member.summary: Tells the parent [Container] nodes how they should resize and place the node on the Y axis. Use one of the [code]SIZE_*[/code] constants to change the flags. See the constants to learn what each does.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.SizeFlagsStretchRatio
member.summary: If the node and at least one of its neighbours uses the [code]SIZE_EXPAND[/code] size flag, the parent [Container] will let it take more or less space depending on this property. If this node has a stretch ratio of 2 and its neighbour a ratio of 1, this node will take two thirds of the available space.

member.name: P:Godot.Control.Theme
member.summary: Changing this property replaces the current [Theme] resource this node and all its [code]Control[/code] children use.

member.name: M:Godot.Control._GetMinimumSize
member.summary: Returns the minimum size this Control can shrink to. The node can never be smaller than this minimum size.

member.name: M:Godot.Control._GuiInput(Godot.InputEvent)
member.summary: The node's parent forwards input events to this method. Use it to process and accept inputs on UI elements. See [method accept_event]. Replaces Godot 2's [code]_input_event[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AcceptEvent
member.summary: Marks an input event as handled. Once you accept an input event, it stops propagating, even to nodes listening to [method Node._unhandled_input] or [method Node._unhandled_key_input].

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetMinimumSize
member.summary: Return the minimum size this Control can shrink to. A control will never be displayed or resized smaller than its minimum size.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetAnchor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the anchor type (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) for a given margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetMargin(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Set a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being set depends on the anchor mode.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetBegin(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetEnd(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetPosition(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control, changing all margins if needed and without changing current anchor mode. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetSize(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Changes MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM to fit a given size. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetGlobalPosition(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the [i]window[/i] Control, and without changing current anchor mode. (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetRotation(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the rotation (in radians).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetRotationDeg(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the rotation (in degrees).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetMargin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being returned depends on the anchor mode.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetEnd
member.summary: Returns MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetPosition
member.summary: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independent of the anchor mode.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetSize
member.summary: Returns the size of the Control, computed from all margins, however the size returned will [b]never be smaller than the minimum size reported by[/b] [method get_minimum_size]. This means that even if end position of the Control rectangle is smaller than the begin position, the Control will still display and interact correctly. (see description, [method get_minimum_size], [method set_margin], [method set_anchor]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetRotation
member.summary: Return the rotation (in radians)

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetRotationDeg
member.summary: Return the rotation (in degrees)

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetGlobalPosition
member.summary: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independent of the anchor mode.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetRect
member.summary: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control. This is a helper (see [method get_position], [method get_size]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetGlobalRect
member.summary: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the [i]window[/i] Control. This is a helper (see [method get_global_position], [method get_size]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.ShowModal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Display a Control as modal. Control must be a subwindow. Modal controls capture the input signals until closed or the area outside them is accessed. When a modal control loses focus, or the ESC key is pressed, they automatically hide. Modal controls are used extensively for popup dialogs and menus.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetFocusMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the focus access mode for the control (FOCUS_NONE, FOCUS_CLICK, FOCUS_ALL). Only one Control can be focused at the same time, and it will receive keyboard signals.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetFocusMode
member.summary: Returns the focus access mode for the control (FOCUS_NONE, FOCUS_CLICK, FOCUS_ALL) (see [method set_focus_mode]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.HasFocus
member.summary: Return whether the Control is the current focused control (see [method set_focus_mode]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GrabFocus
member.summary: Steal the focus from another control and become the focused control (see [method set_focus_mode]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.ReleaseFocus
member.summary: Give up the focus, no other control will be able to receive keyboard input.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetFocusOwner
member.summary: Return which control is owning the keyboard focus, or null if no one.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetHSizeFlags(System.Int32)
member.summary: Hint for containers, set horizontal positioning flags.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetHSizeFlags
member.summary: Hint for containers, return horizontal positioning flags.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetStretchRatio(System.Single)
member.summary: Hint for containers, set the stretch ratio. This value is relative to other stretch ratio, so if this control has 2 and another has 1, this one will be twice as big.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetStretchRatio
member.summary: Hint for containers, return the stretch ratio. This value is relative to other stretch ratio, so if this control has 2 and another has 1, this one will be twice as big.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetVSizeFlags(System.Int32)
member.summary: Hint for containers, set vertical positioning flags.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetVSizeFlags
member.summary: Hint for containers, return vertical positioning flags.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetTheme(Godot.Theme)
member.summary: Overrides the whole [Theme] for this node and all its [code]Control[/code] children.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetTheme
member.summary: Return a [Theme] override, if one exists (see [method set_theme]).

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddIconOverride(System.String,Godot.Texture)
member.summary: Overrides the [code]name[/code] icon in the [theme] resource the node uses. If [code]icon[/code] is empty, Godot clears the override.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddShaderOverride(System.String,Godot.Shader)
member.summary: Overrides the [code]name[/code] shader in the [theme] resource the node uses. If [code]shader[/code] is empty, Godot clears the override.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddStyleOverride(System.String,Godot.StyleBox)
member.summary: Overrides the [code]name[/code] [Stylebox] in the [theme] resource the node uses. If [code]stylebox[/code] is empty, Godot clears the override.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddFontOverride(System.String,Godot.Font)
member.summary: Overrides the [code]name[/code] font in the [theme] resource the node uses. If [code]font[/code] is empty, Godot clears the override.

member.summary: Overrides the color in the [theme] resource the node uses.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.AddConstantOverride(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Overrides an integer constant in the [theme] resource the node uses. If the [code]constant[code] is invalid, Godot clears the override. See [member Theme.INVALID_CONSTANT] for more information.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetTooltip(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the tooltip text. The tooltip appears when the user's mouse cursor stays idle over this control for a few moments.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetTooltip(System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: Return the tooltip, which will appear when the cursor is resting over this control. <param name="atPosition">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetDefaultCursorShape(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the default cursor shape for this control. See [code]CURSOR_*[/code] for the list of available cursor shapes. Useful for Godot plugins and applications or games that use the system's mouse cursors.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetDefaultCursorShape
member.summary: Returns the default cursor shape for this control. See enum [code]CURSOR_*[/code] for the list of shapes.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetCursorShape(System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: Returns the mouse cursor shape the control displays on mouse hover, one of the [code]CURSOR_*[/code] constants. <param name="position">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetFocusNeighbour(System.Int32,Godot.NodePath)
member.summary: Force a neighbour for moving the input focus to. When pressing TAB or directional/joypad directions focus is moved to the next control in that direction. However, the neighbour to move to can be forced with this function.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetFocusNeighbour(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the forced neighbour for moving the input focus to. When pressing TAB or directional/joypad directions focus is moved to the next control in that direction. However, the neighbour to move to can be forced with this function.

member.name: M:Godot.Control.SetMouseFilter(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set when the control is ignoring mouse events (even touchpad events send mouse events). (see the MOUSE_FILTER_* constants)

member.name: M:Godot.Control.GetMouseFilter
member.summary: Return when the control is ignoring mouse events (even touchpad events send mouse events).

member.name: T:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape
member.summary: Convex polygon shape resource, which can be added to a [PhysicsBody] or area.

member.name: P:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape.Points
member.summary: The list of 3D points forming the convex polygon shape.

member.name: T:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape2D
member.summary: Convex Polygon Shape for 2D physics. A convex polygon, whatever its shape, is internally decomposed into as many convex polygons as needed to ensure all collision checks against it are always done on convex polygons (which are faster to check). The main difference between a [code]ConvexPolygonShape2D[/code] and a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] is that a concave polygon assumes it is concave and uses a more complex method of collision detection, and a convex one forces itself to be convex in order to speed up collision detection.

member.name: P:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape2D.Points
member.summary: The polygon's list of vertices. Can be in either clockwise or counterclockwise order.

member.name: M:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape2D.SetPointCloud(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Currently, this method does nothing.

member.name: M:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape2D.SetPoints(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Sets a list of points in either clockwise or counter clockwise order, forming a convex polygon.

member.name: M:Godot.ConvexPolygonShape2D.GetPoints
member.summary: Returns a list of points in either clockwise or counter clockwise order, forming a convex polygon.

member.name: T:Godot.CubeMap
member.summary: A CubeMap is a 6 sided 3D texture typically used for faking reflections. It can be used to make an object look as if it's reflecting its surroundings. This usually delivers much better performance than other reflection methods.

member.name: P:Godot.CubeMap.StorageMode
member.summary: The CubeMap's storage mode. See [code]STORAGE_*[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.CubeMap.LossyStorageQuality
member.summary: The lossy storage quality of the CubeMap if the storage mode is set to STORAGE_COMPRESS_LOSSY.

member.name: M:Godot.CubeMap.GetWidth
member.summary: Returns the CubeMap's width.

member.name: M:Godot.CubeMap.GetHeight
member.summary: Returns the CubeMap's height.

member.name: M:Godot.CubeMap.SetSide(System.Int32,Godot.Image)
member.summary: Sets an [Image] for a side of the CubeMap using one of the [code]SIDE_*[/code] constants or an integer 0-5.

member.name: M:Godot.CubeMap.GetSide(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an [Image] for a side of the CubeMap using one of the [code]SIDE_*[/code] constants or an integer 0-5.

member.name: T:Godot.CubeMesh
member.summary: Generate an axis-aligned cuboid [PrimitiveMesh].

member.name: P:Godot.CubeMesh.Size
member.summary: Size of the cuboid mesh. Defaults to (2, 2, 2).

member.name: P:Godot.CubeMesh.SubdivideWidth
member.summary: Number of extra edge loops inserted along the x-axis. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Godot.CubeMesh.SubdivideHeight
member.summary: Number of extra edge loops inserted along the y-axis. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Godot.CubeMesh.SubdivideDepth
member.summary: Number of extra edge loops inserted along the z-axis. Defaults to 0.

member.name: T:Godot.Curve2D
member.summary: This class describes a Bezier curve in 2D space. It is mainly used to give a shape to a [Path2D], but can be manually sampled for other purposes. It keeps a cache of precalculated points along the curve, to speed further calculations up.

member.name: P:Godot.Curve2D.BakeInterval
member.summary: The distance in pixels between two adjacent cached points. Changing it forces the cache to be recomputed the next time the [method get_baked_points] or [method get_baked_length] function is called. The smaller the distance, the more points in the cache and the more memory it will consume, so use with care.

member.name: P:Godot.Curve2D._Data
member.summary: The points describing the curve. Value is a [Dictionary] with the keys [code]in[/code], [code]out[/code], and [code]pos[/code]. The key pos is the position of a vertex of the curve, the key in is the vector from that position to the control point before this vertex, the key out is the vector from that position to the controlpoint after this vertex.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetPointCount
member.summary: Returns the number of points describing the curve.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.AddPoint(Godot.Vector2,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2},System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2},System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a point to a curve, at "position", with control points "in" and "out". If "at_position" is given, the point is inserted before the point number "at_position", moving that point (and every point after) after the inserted point. If "at_position" is not given, or is an illegal value (at_position <0 or at_position >= [method get_point_count]), the point will be appended at the end of the point list. <param name="@in">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param> <param name="@out">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.SetPointPosition(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position for the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetPointPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.SetPointIn(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetPointIn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.SetPointOut(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetPointOut(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.RemovePoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the point "idx" from the curve. Sends an error to the console if "idx" is out of bounds.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.ClearPoints
member.summary: Removes all points from the curve.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.Interpolate(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the position between the vertex "idx" and the vertex "idx"+1, where "t" controls if the point is the first vertex (t = 0.0), the last vertex (t = 1.0), or in between. Values of "t" outside the range (0.0 >= t <=1) give strange, but predictable results. If "idx" is out of bounds it is truncated to the first or last vertex, and "t" is ignored. If the curve has no points, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.Interpolatef(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the position at the vertex "fofs". It calls [method interpolate] using the integer part of fofs as "idx", and its fractional part as "t".

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.SetBakeInterval(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance in pixels between two adjacent cached points. Changing it forces the cache to be recomputed the next time a xxx_baked_xxx function is called. The less distance, the more points the cache will have, and the more memory it will consume, so use with care.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetBakeInterval
member.summary: Returns the distance between two adjacent cached points.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetBakedLength
member.summary: Returns the total length of the curve, based on the cached points. Given enough density (see [method set_bake_interval]), it should be approximate enough.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.InterpolateBaked(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a point within the curve at position "offset", where "offset" is measured as a pixel distance along the curve. To do that, it finds the two cached points where the "offset" lies between, then interpolates the values. This interpolation is cubic if "cubic" is set to true, or linear if set to false. Cubic interpolation tends to follow the curves better, but linear is faster (and often, precise enough).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.GetBakedPoints
member.summary: Returns the cache of points as a [PoolVector2Array].

member.name: M:Godot.Curve2D.Tessellate(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a list of points along the curve, with a curvature controlled point density. That is, the curvier parts will have more points than the straighter parts. This approximation makes straight segments between each point, then subdivides those segments until the resulting shape is similar enough. "max_stages" controls how many subdivisions a curve segment may face before it is considered approximate enough. Each subdivision splits the segment in half, so the default 5 stages may mean up to 32 subdivisions per curve segment. Increase with care! "tolerance_degrees" controls how many degrees the midpoint of a segment may deviate from the real curve, before the segment has to be subdivided.

member.name: T:Godot.Curve3D
member.summary: This class describes a Bezier curve in 3D space. It is mainly used to give a shape to a [Path], but can be manually sampled for other purposes. It keeps a cache of precalculated points along the curve, to speed further calculations up.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetPointCount
member.summary: Returns the number of points describing the curve.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.AddPoint(Godot.Vector3,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector3},System.Nullable{Godot.Vector3},System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a point to a curve, at "position", with control points "in" and "out". If "at_position" is given, the point is inserted before the point number "at_position", moving that point (and every point after) after the inserted point. If "at_position" is not given, or is an illegal value (at_position <0 or at_position >= [method get_point_count]), the point will be appended at the end of the point list. <param name="@in">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector3(0, 0, 0)</param> <param name="@out">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector3(0, 0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.SetPointPosition(System.Int32,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the position for the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetPointPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0, 0).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.SetPointTilt(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the tilt angle in radians for the point "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console. The tilt controls the rotation along the look-at axis an object traveling the path would have. In the case of a curve controlling a [PathFollow], this tilt is an offset over the natural tilt the PathFollow calculates.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetPointTilt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the tilt angle in radians for the point "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns 0.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.SetPointIn(System.Int32,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetPointIn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0, 0).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.SetPointOut(System.Int32,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.GetPointOut(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0, 0).

member.name: M:Godot.Curve3D.RemovePoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the point "idx" from the curve. Sends an error to the console if "idx" is out of bounds.

member.name: T:Godot.CylinderMesh
member.summary: Class representing a cylindrical [PrimitiveMesh].

member.name: P:Godot.CylinderMesh.TopRadius
member.summary: Top radius of the cylinder. Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:Godot.CylinderMesh.BottomRadius
member.summary: Bottom radius of the cylinder. Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:Godot.CylinderMesh.Height
member.summary: Full height of the cylinder. Defaults to 2.0.

member.name: P:Godot.CylinderMesh.RadialSegments
member.summary: Number of radial segments on the cylinder. Defaults to 64.

member.name: P:Godot.CylinderMesh.Rings
