member.name: T:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D
member.summary: Damped spring constraint for 2D physics. This resembles a spring joint that always wants to go back to a given length.

member.name: P:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.Length
member.summary: The spring joint's maximum length. The two attached bodies cannot stretch it past this value. Default value: [code]50[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.RestLength
member.summary: When the bodies attached to the spring joint move they stretch or squash it. The joint always tries to resize towards this length. Default value: [code]0[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.Stiffness
member.summary: The higher the value, the less the bodies attached to the joint will deform it. The joint applies an opposing force to the bodies, the product of the stiffness multiplied by the size difference from its resting length. Default value: [code]20[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.Damping
member.summary: The spring joint's damping ratio. A value between [code]0[/code] and [code]1[/code]. When the two bodies move into different directions the system tries to align them to the spring axis again. A high [code]damping[/code] value forces the attached bodies to align faster. Default value: [code]1[/code]

member.name: M:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.SetLength(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the maximum length of the spring joint.

member.name: M:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.GetLength
member.summary: Return the maximum length of the spring joint.

member.name: M:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.SetRestLength(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.

member.name: M:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.GetRestLength
member.summary: Return the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.

member.name: M:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.SetStiffness(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.

member.name: M:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.GetStiffness
member.summary: Return the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.

member.name: M:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.SetDamping(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).

member.name: M:Godot.DampedSpringJoint2D.GetDamping
member.summary: Return the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).

member.name: T:Godot.DirectionalLight
member.summary: A DirectionalLight is a type of [Light] node that emits light constantly in one direction (the negative z axis of the node). It is used lights with strong intensity that are located far away from the scene to model sunlight or moonlight. The worldspace location of the DirectionalLight transform (origin) is ignored, only the basis is used do determine light direction.

member.name: T:Godot.Directory
M:Godot.Directory.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Open an existing directory of the filesystem. The [i]path[/i] argument can be within the project tree ([code]res://folder[/code]), the user directory ([code]user://folder[/code]) or an absolute path of the user filesystem (e.g. [code]/tmp/folder[/code] or [code]C:\tmp\folder[/code]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.ListDirBegin(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialise the stream used to list all files and directories using the [method get_next] function, closing the current opened stream if needed. Once the stream has been processed, it should typically be closed with [method list_dir_end]. If you pass [code]skip_navigational[/code], then [code].[/code] and [code]..[/code] would be filtered out. If you pass [code]skip_hidden[/code], then hidden files would be filtered out.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetNext
member.summary: Return the next element (file or directory) in the current directory (including [code].[/code] and [code]..[/code], unless [code]skip_navigational[/code] was given to [method list_dir_begin]). The name of the file or directory is returned (and not its full path). Once the stream has been fully processed, the method returns an empty String and closes the stream automatically (i.e. [method list_dir_end] would not be mandatory in such a case).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.CurrentIsDir
member.summary: Return whether the current item processed with the last [method get_next] call is a directory ([code].[/code] and [code]..[/code] are considered directories).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.ListDirEnd
member.summary: Close the current stream opened with [method list_dir_begin] (whether it has been fully processed with [method get_next] or not does not matter).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetDriveCount
member.summary: On Windows, return the number of drives (partitions) mounted on the current filesystem. On other platforms, the method returns 0.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetDrive(System.Int32)
member.summary: On Windows, return the name of the drive (partition) passed as an argument (e.g. [code]C:[/code]). On other platforms, or if the requested drive does not existed, the method returns an empty String.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetCurrentDrive
member.summary: Returns the currently opened directory's drive index. See [method get_drive] to convert returned index to the name of the drive.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.ChangeDir(System.String)
member.summary: Change the currently opened directory to the one passed as an argument. The argument can be relative to the current directory (e.g. [code]newdir[/code] or [code]../newdir[/code]), or an absolute path (e.g. [code]/tmp/newdir[/code] or [code]res://somedir/newdir[/code]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetCurrentDir
member.summary: Return the absolute path to the currently opened directory (e.g. [code]res://folder[/code] or [code]C:\tmp\folder[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.MakeDir(System.String)
member.summary: Create a directory. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. The target directory should be placed in an already existing directory (to create the full path recursively, see [method make_dir_recursive]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.MakeDirRecursive(System.String)
member.summary: Create a target directory and all necessary intermediate directories in its path, by calling [method make_dir] recursively. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.FileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Return whether the target file exists. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.DirExists(System.String)
member.summary: Return whether the target directory exists. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.GetSpaceLeft
member.summary: On Unix desktop systems, return the available space on the current directory's disk. On other platforms, this information is not available and the method returns 0 or -1.

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.Copy(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copy the [i]from[/i] file to the [i]to[/i] destination. Both arguments should be paths to files, either relative or absolute. If the destination file exists and is not access-protected, it will be overwritten. Returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.Rename(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Rename (move) the [i]from[/i] file to the [i]to[/i] destination. Both arguments should be paths to files, either relative or absolute. If the destination file exists and is not access-protected, it will be overwritten. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or FAILED).

member.name: M:Godot.Directory.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Delete the target file or an empty directory. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. If the target directory is not empty, the operation will fail. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or FAILED).

member.name: T:Godot.DynamicFont
member.summary: DynamicFont renders vector font files (such as TTF or OTF) dynamically at runtime instead of using a prerendered texture atlas like [BitmapFont]. This trades the faster loading time of [BitmapFont]s for the ability to change font parameters like size and spacing during runtime. [DynamicFontData] is used for referencing the font file paths.

member.summary: If [code]true[/code] filtering is used.

member.name: T:Godot.Engine
member.summary: The [code]Engine[/code] class allows you to query and modify the game's run-time parameters, such as frames per second, time scale, and others.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.SetIterationsPerSecond(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the number of fixed iterations per second (for fixed process and physics).

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetIterationsPerSecond
member.summary: Returns the number of fixed iterations per second (for fixed process and physics).

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.SetTargetFps(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the target frames per second.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetTargetFps
member.summary: Returns the desired frames per second. If the hardware cannot keep up, this setting may not be respected. It defaults to 0, which indicates no limit.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.SetTimeScale(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the time scale.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetTimeScale
member.summary: Returns how fast or slow the in-game clock ticks versus the real life one. It defaults to 1.0. A value of 2.0 means the game moves twice as fast as real life, whilst a value of 0.5 means the game moves at half the regular speed.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetFramesDrawn
member.summary: Returns the total number of frames drawn.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetFramesPerSecond
member.summary: Returns the frames per second of the running game.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetMainLoop
member.summary: Returns the main loop object (see [MainLoop] and [SceneTree]).

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.GetVersionInfo
member.summary: Returns the current engine version information in a Dictionary. "major" - Holds the major version number as a String "minor" - Holds the minor version number as a String "patch" - Holds the patch version number as a String "status" - Holds the status (e.g. "beta", "rc1", "rc2", ... "stable") as a String "revision" - Holds the revision (e.g. "custom-build") as a String "string" - major + minor + patch + status + revision in a single String

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.IsInPhysicsFrame
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the game is inside the fixed process and physics phase of the game loop.

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.SetEditorHint(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the running inside the editor hint if [code]enabled[/code] is [code]true[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Engine.IsEditorHint
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the editor is running.

member.name: T:Godot.Environment
member.summary: Resource for environment nodes (like [WorldEnvironment]) that define multiple environment operations (such as background [Sky] or [Color], ambient light, fog, depth-of-field...). These parameters affect the final render of the scene. The order of these operations is: - DOF Blur - Motion Blur - Bloom - Tonemap (auto exposure) - Adjustments

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.BG_KEEP
member.summary: Keep on screen every pixel drawn in the background.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.BG_CLEAR_COLOR
member.summary: Clear the background using the project's clear color.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.BG_COLOR
member.summary: Clear the background using a custom clear color.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.BG_SKY
member.summary: Display a user-defined sky in the background.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.BG_COLOR_SKY
member.summary: Clear the background using a custom clear color and allows defining a sky for shading and reflection.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.BG_CANVAS
member.summary: Display a [CanvasLayer] in the background.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.BG_MAX
member.summary: Helper constant keeping track of the enum's size, has no direct usage in API calls.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.GLOW_BLEND_MODE_ADDITIVE
member.summary: Additive glow blending mode. Mostly used for particles, glows (bloom), lens flare, bright sources.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.GLOW_BLEND_MODE_SCREEN
member.summary: Screen glow blending mode. Increases brightness, used frequently with bloom.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.GLOW_BLEND_MODE_SOFTLIGHT
member.summary: Softlight glow blending mode. Modifies contrast, exposes shadows and highlights, vivid bloom.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.GLOW_BLEND_MODE_REPLACE
member.summary: Replace glow blending mode. Replaces all pixels' color by the glow value.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.TONE_MAPPER_LINEAR
member.summary: Linear tonemapper operator. Reads the linear data and performs an exposure adjustment.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.TONE_MAPPER_REINHARDT
member.summary: Reinhardt tonemapper operator. Performs a variation on rendered pixels' colors by this formula: color = color / (1 + color).

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.TONE_MAPPER_FILMIC
member.summary: Filmic tonemapper operator.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.TONE_MAPPER_ACES
member.summary: Academy Color Encoding System tonemapper operator.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.DOF_BLUR_QUALITY_LOW
member.summary: Low depth-of-field blur quality.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.DOF_BLUR_QUALITY_MEDIUM
member.summary: Medium depth-of-field blur quality.

member.name: F:Godot.Environment.DOF_BLUR_QUALITY_HIGH
member.summary: High depth-of-field blur quality.

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.BackgroundMode
member.summary: Defines the mode of background.

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.BackgroundSky
member.summary: [Sky] resource defined as background.

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.BackgroundSkyCustomFov
member.summary: [Sky] resource's custom field of view.

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Color displayed for clear areas of the scene (if using Custom color or Color+Sky background modes).

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.BackgroundEnergy
member.summary: Power of light emitted by the background.

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.BackgroundCanvasMaxLayer
member.summary: Maximum layer id (if using Layer background mode).

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.AmbientLightColor
member.summary: [Color] of the ambient light.

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.AmbientLightEnergy
member.summary: Energy of the ambient light. The higher the value, the stronger the light.

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.AmbientLightSkyContribution
member.summary: Defines the amount of light that the sky brings on the scene. A value of 0 means that the sky's light emission has no effect on the scene illumination, thus all ambient illumination is provided by the ambient light. On the contrary, a value of 1 means that all the light that affects the scene is provided by the sky, thus the ambient light parameter has no effect on the scene.

member.name: P:Godot.Environment.FogEnabled
member.summary: Enables the fog. Needs fog_height_enabled and/or for_depth_enabled to actually display fog.

member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the file's endianness is swapped. Use this if you're dealing with files written in big endian machines. Note that this is about the file format, not CPU type. This is always reseted to [code]false[/code] whenever you open the file.

member.name: T:Godot.FileDialog
member.summary: FileDialog is a preset dialog used to choose files and directories in the filesystem. It supports filter masks.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.MODE_OPEN_FILE
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of one, and only one file.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.MODE_OPEN_FILES
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of multiple files.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.MODE_OPEN_DIR
member.summary: The dialog functions as a folder selector, disallowing the selection of any file.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.MODE_OPEN_ANY
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of a file or a directory.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.MODE_SAVE_FILE
member.summary: The dialog will warn when a file exists.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.ACCESS_RESOURCES
member.summary: The dialog allows the selection of file and directory.

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.ACCESS_USERDATA
member.summary: The dialog allows access files under [Resource] path(res://) .

member.name: F:Godot.FileDialog.ACCESS_FILESYSTEM
member.summary: The dialog allows access files in whole file system.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.ClearFilters
member.summary: Clear all the added filters in the dialog.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.AddFilter(System.String)
member.summary: Add a custom filter. Filter format is: "mask ; description", example (C++): dialog->add_filter("*.png ; PNG Images");

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.GetCurrentDir
member.summary: Get the current working directory of the file dialog.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.GetCurrentFile
member.summary: Get the current selected file of the file dialog (empty if none).

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.GetCurrentPath
member.summary: Get the current selected path (directory and file) of the file dialog (empty if none).

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.SetCurrentDir(System.String)
member.summary: Set the current working directory of the file dialog.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.SetCurrentFile(System.String)
member.summary: Set the current selected file name of the file dialog.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.SetCurrentPath(System.String)
member.summary: Set the current selected file path of the file dialog.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.SetMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the file dialog mode from the MODE_* enum.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.GetMode
member.summary: Get the file dialog mode from the MODE_* enum.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.GetVbox
member.summary: Return the vertical box container of the dialog, custom controls can be added to it.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.SetAccess(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the file access permission of the dialog(Must be one of [ACCESS_RESOURCES], [ACCESS_USERDATA] or [ACCESS_FILESYSTEM]).

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.GetAccess
member.summary: Return the file access permission of the dialog.

member.summary: Set the dialog should show hidden files.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.IsShowingHiddenFiles
member.summary: Return true if the dialog allows show hidden files.

member.name: M:Godot.FileDialog.Invalidate
member.summary: Invalidate and update the current dialog content list.

member.name: T:Godot.Font
member.summary: Font contains a unicode compatible character set, as well as the ability to draw it with variable width, ascent, descent and kerning. For creating fonts from TTF files (or other font formats), see the editor support for fonts. TODO check wikipedia for graph of ascent/baseline/descent/height/etc.

member.name: M:Godot.Font.Draw(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2,System.String,System.Nullable{Godot.Color},System.Int32)
member.summary: Draw "string" into a canvas item using the font at a given position, with "modulate" color, and optionally clipping the width. "position" specifies the baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis. <param name="modulate">If the param is null, then the default value is new Color(1, 1, 1, 1)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Font.GetAscent
member.summary: Return the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

member.name: M:Godot.Font.GetDescent
member.summary: Return the font descent (number of pixels below the baseline).

member.name: M:Godot.Font.GetHeight
member.summary: Return the total font height (ascent plus descent) in pixels.

member.name: M:Godot.Font.GetStringSize(System.String)
member.summary: Return the size of a string, taking kerning and advance into account.

member.name: M:Godot.Font.DrawChar(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{Godot.Color})
member.summary: Draw character "char" into a canvas item using the font at a given position, with "modulate" color, and optionally kerning if "next" is passed. clipping the width. "position" specifies the baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis. The width used by the character is returned, making this function useful for drawing strings character by character. <param name="modulate">If the param is null, then the default value is new Color(1, 1, 1, 1)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Font.UpdateChanges
member.summary: After editing a font (changing size, ascent, char rects, etc.). Call this function to propagate changes to controls that might use it.

member.name: T:Godot.FuncRef
member.summary: In GDScript, functions are not [i]first-class objects[/i]. This means it is impossible to store them directly as variables, return them from another function, or pass them as arguments. However, by creating a [code]FuncRef[/code] using the [method @GDScript.funcref] function, a reference to a function in a given object can be created, passed around and called.

member.name: M:Godot.FuncRef.CallFunc(System.Object[])
member.summary: Calls the referenced function previously set by [method set_function] or [method @GDScript.funcref].

member.name: M:Godot.FuncRef.SetInstance(Godot.Object)
member.summary: The object containing the referenced function. This object must be of a type actually inheriting from [Object], not a built-in type such as [int], [Vector2] or [Dictionary].

member.name: M:Godot.FuncRef.SetFunction(System.String)
member.summary: The name of the referenced function to call on the object, without parentheses or any parameters.

member.name: T:Godot.GDFunctionState
member.summary: Calling [method @GDScript.yield] within a function will cause that function to yield and return its current state as an object of this type. The yielded function call can then be resumed later by calling [method resume] on this state object.

member.name: M:Godot.GDFunctionState.Resume(System.Object)
member.summary: Resume execution of the yielded function call. If handed an argument, return the argument from the [method @GDScript.yield] call in the yielded function call. You can pass e.g. an [Array] to hand multiple arguments. This function returns what the resumed function call returns, possibly another function state if yielded again.

member.name: M:Godot.GDFunctionState.IsValid(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check whether the function call may be resumed. This is not the case if the function state was already resumed. If [code]extended_check[/code] is enabled, it also checks if the associated script and object still exist. The extended check is done in debug mode as part of [method GDFunctionState.resume], but you can use this if you know you may be trying to resume without knowing for sure the object and/or script have survived up to that point.

member.name: T:Godot.GDScript
member.summary: A script implemented in the GDScript programming language. The script exends the functionality of all objects that instance it. [method new] creates a new instance of the script. [method Object.set_script] extends an existing object, if that object's class matches one of the script's base classes.

member.name: M:Godot.GDScript.New(System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns a new instance of the script. For example: [codeblock] var MyClass = load("myclass.gd") var instance = MyClass.new() assert(instance.get_script() == MyClass) [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.GDScript.GetAsByteCode
member.summary: Returns byte code for the script source code.

member.name: T:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint
member.summary: The first 3 dof axes are linear axes, which represent translation of Bodies, and the latter 3 dof axes represent the angular motion. Each axis can be either locked, or limited.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_LINEAR_LOWER_LIMIT
member.summary: The minimum difference between the pivot points' axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_LINEAR_UPPER_LIMIT
member.summary: The maximum difference between the pivot points' axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_LINEAR_LIMIT_SOFTNESS
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement across the axes The lower, the slower the movement.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_LINEAR_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of restitution on the axes movement The lower, the more momentum gets lost.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_LINEAR_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of damping that happens at the linear motion across the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_ANGULAR_LOWER_LIMIT
member.summary: The minimum rotation in negative direction to break loose and rotate arround the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_ANGULAR_UPPER_LIMIT
member.summary: The minimum rotation in positive direction to break loose and rotate arround the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_ANGULAR_LIMIT_SOFTNESS
member.summary: The speed of all rotations across the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_ANGULAR_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of rotational damping across the axes. The lower, the more dampening occurs.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_ANGULAR_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of rotational restitution across the axes. The lower, the more restitution occurs.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_ANGULAR_FORCE_LIMIT
member.summary: The maximum amount of force that can occur, when rotating arround the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_ANGULAR_ERP
member.summary: When rotating across the axes, this error tolerance factor defines how much the correction gets slowed down. The lower, the slower.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_ANGULAR_MOTOR_TARGET_VELOCITY
member.summary: Target speed for the motor at the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_ANGULAR_MOTOR_FORCE_LIMIT
member.summary: Maximum acceleration for the motor at the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.PARAM_MAX
member.summary: End flag of PARAM_* constants, used internally.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.FLAG_ENABLE_LINEAR_LIMIT
member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is linear motion possible within the given limits.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.FLAG_ENABLE_ANGULAR_LIMIT
member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is rotational motion possible.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.FLAG_ENABLE_MOTOR
member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is a rotational motor across these axes.

member.name: F:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.FLAG_MAX
member.summary: End flag of FLAG_* constants, used internally.

member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the linear motion across the x-axis is enabled.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__upperDistance
member.summary: The maximum difference between the pivot points' x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__lowerDistance
member.summary: The minimum difference between the pivot points' x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__softness
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement across the x-axis The lower, the slower the movement.

member.summary: The amount of restitution on the x-axis movement The lower, the more momentum gets lost.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.LinearLimitX__damping
member.summary: The amount of damping that happens at the x-motion.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularLimitX__enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] rotation across the x-axis is enabled.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularLimitX__upperAngle
member.summary: The minimum rotation in positive direction to break loose and rotate arround the x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularLimitX__lowerAngle
member.summary: The minimum rotation in negative direction to break loose and rotate arround the x-axis.

member.name: P:Godot.Generic6DOFJoint.AngularLimitX__softness
member.summary: The speed of all rotations across the x-axis.

member.name: T:Godot.GeometryInstance
member.summary: Base node for geometry based visual instances. Shares some common functionality like visibility and custom materials.

member.name: M:Godot.GeometryInstance.SetMaterialOverride(Godot.Material)
member.summary: Set the material override for the whole geometry.

member.name: M:Godot.GeometryInstance.GetMaterialOverride
member.summary: Return the material override for the whole geometry.

member.name: T:Godot.Gradient
member.summary: Given a set of colors, this node will interpolate them in order, meaning, that if you have color 1, color 2 and color3, the ramp will interpolate (generate the colors between two colors) from color 1 to color 2 and from color 2 to color 3. Initially the ramp will have 2 colors (black and white), one (black) at ramp lower offset offset 0 and the other (white) at the ramp higher offset 1.

member.name: P:Godot.Gradient.Offsets
member.summary: Gradient's offsets returned as a [PoolRealArray].

member.name: P:Godot.Gradient.Colors
member.summary: Gradient's colors returned as a [PoolColorArray].

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.AddPoint(System.Single,Godot.Color)
member.summary: Adds the specified color to the end of the ramp, with the specified offset

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.RemovePoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the color at the index [i]offset[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.SetOffset(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the offset for the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the offset of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.SetColor(System.Int32,Godot.Color)
member.summary: Sets the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.GetColor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.Interpolate(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the interpolated color specified by [i]offset[/i]

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.GetPointCount
member.summary: Returns the number of colors in the ramp

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.SetOffsets(System.Single[])
member.summary: Sets the offset for the specified amount of elements. Calling this function with a different number of elements than previously defined causes the ramp to resize its colors and offsets array to accommodate the new elements, all new colors will be black by default.

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.GetOffsets
member.summary: Returns the offsets for the colors in this ramp

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.SetColors(Godot.Color[])
member.summary: Sets the colors for the specified amount of elements. Calling this function with a different number of elements than previously defined causes the ramp to resize its colors and offsets array to accommodate the new elements.

member.name: M:Godot.Gradient.GetColors
member.summary: Returns the colors in the ramp

member.name: T:Godot.GradientTexture
member.summary: Uses a [Gradient] to fill the texture data, the gradient will be filled from left to right using colors obtained from the gradient, this means that the texture does not necessarily represent an exact copy of the gradient, but instead an interpolation of samples obtained from the gradient at fixed steps (see [method set_width]).

member.name: P:Godot.GradientTexture.Gradient
member.summary: The [Gradient] that will be used to fill the texture.

member.name: P:Godot.GradientTexture.Width
member.summary: The number of color samples that will be obtained from the [Gradient].

member.name: T:Godot.GraphEdit
member.summary: GraphEdit manages the showing of GraphNodes it contains, as well as connections and disconnections between them. Signals are sent for each of these two events. Disconnection between GraphNodes slots is disabled by default. It is greatly advised to enable low processor usage mode (see [method OS.set_low_processor_usage_mode]) when using GraphEdits.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.ConnectNode(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a connection between 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode and 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode. If the connection already exists, no connection is created.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.IsNodeConnected(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return true if the 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode is connected to the 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.DisconnectNode(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove the connection between 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode and 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode, if connection exists.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.GetConnectionList
member.summary: Return an Array containing the list of connections. A connection consists in a structure of the form {from_slot: 0, from: "GraphNode name 0", to_slot: 1, to: "GraphNode name 1" }

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.GetScrollOfs
member.summary: Return the scroll offset.

member.summary: Set the zoom value of the GraphEdit. Zoom value is between [0.01; 1.728].

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.GetZoom
member.summary: Return the current zoom value.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.SetRightDisconnects(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable the disconnection of existing connections in the visual GraphEdit by left-clicking a connection and releasing into the void.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphEdit.IsRightDisconnectsEnabled
member.summary: Return true is the disconnection of connections is enable in the visual GraphEdit. False otherwise.

member.name: T:Godot.GraphNode
member.summary: A GraphNode is a container defined by a title. It can have 1 or more input and output slots, which can be enabled (shown) or disabled (not shown) and have different (incompatible) types. Colors can also be assigned to slots. A tuple of input and output slots is defined for each GUI element included in the GraphNode. Input and output connections are left and right slots, but only enabled slots are counted as connections.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphNode.SetTitle(System.String)
member.summary: Set the title of the GraphNode.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphNode.GetTitle
member.summary: Return the title of the GraphNode.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphNode.ClearAllSlots

member.summary: Return the (integer) type of left (input) 'idx' slot.

member.name: M:Godot.GraphNode.GetSlotColorLeft(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the color set to 'idx' left (input) slot.

member.summary: Set the offset of the GraphNode.

member.name: T:Godot.GridContainer
member.summary: Grid container will arrange its children in a grid like structure, the grid columns are specified using the [method set_columns] method and the number of rows will be equal to the number of children in the container divided by the number of columns, for example: if the container has 5 children, and 2 columns, there will be 3 rows in the container. Notice that grid layout will preserve the columns and rows for every size of the container.

member.name: P:Godot.GridContainer.Columns
member.summary: The number of columns in the [code]GridContainer[/code]. If modified, [code]GridContainer[/code] reorders its children to accommodate the new layout.

member.name: M:Godot.GridContainer.SetColumns(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the numbers of columns in the container, then reorder its children to accommodate the new layout

member.name: M:Godot.GridContainer.GetColumns
member.summary: Returns the number of columns in this container

member.name: T:Godot.GrooveJoint2D
member.summary: Groove constraint for 2D physics. This is useful for making a body "slide" through a segment placed in another.

member.name: P:Godot.GrooveJoint2D.Length
member.summary: The groove's length. The groove is from the joint's origin towards [member length] along the joint's local y axis. Default value: [code]50[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.GrooveJoint2D.InitialOffset
member.summary: The body B's initial anchor position defined by the joint's origin and a local offset [member initial_offset] along the joint's y axis (along the groove). Default value: [code]25[/code]

member.name: M:Godot.GrooveJoint2D.SetLength(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the length of the groove.

member.name: M:Godot.GrooveJoint2D.GetLength

member.name: M:Godot.GrooveJoint2D.SetInitialOffset(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the initial offset of the groove on body A.

member.name: M:Godot.GrooveJoint2D.GetInitialOffset
member.summary: Set the final offset of the groove on body A.

member.name: T:Godot.HBoxContainer

member.name: T:Godot.HingeJoint
member.summary: Normaly uses the z-axis of body A as the hinge axis, another axis can be specified when adding it manually though.

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.PARAM_BIAS

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.PARAM_LIMIT_UPPER

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.PARAM_LIMIT_LOWER
member.summary: The minimum rotation. only active if [member angular_limit/enable] is [code]true[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.PARAM_LIMIT_BIAS
member.summary: The speed with which the rotation across the axis perpendicular to the hinge gets corrected.

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.PARAM_LIMIT_RELAXATION
member.summary: The lower this value, the more the rotation gets slowed down.

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.PARAM_MOTOR_TARGET_VELOCITY

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.PARAM_MOTOR_MAX_IMPULSE

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.PARAM_MAX

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.FLAG_USE_LIMIT

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.FLAG_ENABLE_MOTOR
member.summary: When activated, a motor turns the hinge.

member.name: F:Godot.HingeJoint.FLAG_MAX

member.name: P:Godot.HingeJoint.Params__bias

member.name: P:Godot.HingeJoint.AngularLimit__lower
member.summary: The minimum rotation. only active if [member angular_limit/enable] is [code]true[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.HTTPClient
member.summary: Hyper-text transfer protocol client. Supports SSL and SSL server certificate verification. Can be reused to connect to different hosts and make many requests.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.ConnectToHost(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Connect to a host. This needs to be done before any requests are sent. The host should not have http:// prepended but will strip the protocol identifier if provided. verify_host will check the SSL identity of the host if set to true.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.SetConnection(Godot.StreamPeer)
member.summary: Set connection to use, for this client.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetConnection
member.summary: Return current connection.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.RequestRaw(System.Int32,System.String,System.String[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends a raw request to the connected host. The url is what is normally behind the hostname, i.e. in [code]http://somehost.com/index.php[/code], url would be "index.php". Headers are HTTP request headers. Sends body raw, as a byte array, does not encode it in any way.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.Request(System.Int32,System.String,System.String[],System.String)
M:Godot.HTTPClient.Close
member.summary: Cloces the current connection, allows for reusal of [code]HTTPClient[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.HasResponse
member.summary: Return whether this [code]HTTPClient[/code] has a response available.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.IsResponseChunked
member.summary: Return whether this [code]HTTPClient[/code] has a response that is chunked.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetResponseCode
member.summary: Return the HTTP status code of the response.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetResponseHeaders
member.summary: Return the response headers.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetResponseHeadersAsDictionary
member.summary: Returns all response headers as dictionary where the case-sensitivity of the keys and values is kept like the server delivers it. A value is a simple String, this string can have more than one value where "; " is used as separator. Structure: ("key":"value1; value2") Example: (content-length:12), (Content-Type:application/json; charset=UTF-8)

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetResponseBodyLength
member.summary: Return the response's body length.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.ReadResponseBodyChunk
member.summary: Reads one chunk from the response.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.SetReadChunkSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the size of the buffer used and maximum bytes to read per iteration. see [method read_response_body_chunk]

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.SetBlockingMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true, execution will block until all data is read from the response.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.IsBlockingModeEnabled
member.summary: Return whether blocking mode is enabled.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.GetStatus
member.summary: Returns a STATUS_* enum constant. Need to call [method poll] in order to get status updates.

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.Poll
member.summary: This needs to be called in order to have any request processed. Check results with [method get_status]

member.name: M:Godot.HTTPClient.QueryStringFromDict(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Generates a GET/POST application/x-www-form-urlencoded style query string from a provided dictionary, e.g.: [codeblock] var fields = {"username": "user", "password": "pass"} String queryString = httpClient.query_string_from_dict(fields) returns:= "username=user&password=pass" [/codeblock]

member.name: T:Godot.HTTPRequest
member.summary: A Node with the ability to send HTTP requests. Uses a [HTTPClient] internally, supports HTTPS. Can be used to make HTTP requests or download files via HTTP.

member.summary: Request successful.

member.name: T:Godot.Image
member.summary: Native image datatype. Contains image data, which can be converted to a [Texture], and several functions to interact with it. The maximum width and height for an [code]Image[/code] is 16384 pixels.

member.name: P:Godot.Image.Data
member.summary: Holds all of the image's color data in a given format. See [code]FORMAT_*[/code] constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetWidth
member.summary: Returns the image's width.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetHeight
member.summary: Returns the image's height.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetSize
member.summary: Returns the image's size (width and height).

member.name: M:Godot.Image.HasMipmaps
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the image has generated mipmaps.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetFormat
member.summary: Returns the image's raw data.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetData
member.summary: Returns the image's raw data.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Convert(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the image's format. See [code]FORMAT_*[/code] constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetMipmapOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the offset where the image's mipmap with index [code]mipmap[/code] is stored in the [code]data[/code] dictionary.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.ResizeToPo2(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resizes the image to the nearest power of 2 for the width and height. If [code]square[/code] is [code]true[/code] then set width and height to be the same.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Resize(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resizes the image to the given [code]width[/code] and [code]height[/code]. New pixels are calculated using [code]interpolation[/code]. See [code]interpolation[/code] constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.ShrinkX2
member.summary: Shrinks the image by a factor of 2.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.ExpandX2Hq2x
member.summary: Stretches the image and enlarges it by a factor of 2. No interpolation is done.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Crop(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Crops the image to the given [code]width[/code] and [code]height[/code]. If the specified size is larger than the current size, the extra area is filled with black pixels.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.FlipX
member.summary: Flips the image horizontally.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.FlipY
member.summary: Flips the image vertically.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GenerateMipmaps
member.summary: Generates mipmaps for the image. Mipmaps are pre-calculated and lower resolution copies of the image. Mipmaps are automatically used if the image needs to be scaled down when rendered. This improves image quality and the performance of the rendering. Returns an error if the image is compressed, in a custom format or if the image's width/height is 0.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.ClearMipmaps
member.summary: Removes the image's mipmaps.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Create(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an empty image of given size and format. See [code]FORMAT_*[/code] constants. If [code]use_mipmaps[/code] is true then generate mipmaps for this image. See the [code]generate_mipmaps[/code] method.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.CreateFromData(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new image of given size and format. See [code]FORMAT_*[/code] constants. Fills the image with the given raw data. If [code]use_mipmaps[/code] is true then generate mipmaps for this image. See the [code]generate_mipmaps[/code] method.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the image has no data.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads an image from file [code]path[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.SavePng(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the image as a PNG file to [code]path[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.DetectAlpha
member.summary: Returns ALPHA_BLEND if the image has data for alpha values. Returns ALPHA_BIT if all the alpha values are below a certain threshold or the maximum value. Returns ALPHA_NONE if no data for alpha values is found.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.IsInvisible
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if all the image's pixels have an alpha value of 0. Returns [code]false[/code] if any pixel has an alpha value higher than 0.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Compress(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Compresses the image to use less memory. Can not directly access pixel data while the image is compressed. Returns error if the chosen compression mode is not available. See [code]COMPRESS_*[/code] constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Decompress
member.summary: Decompresses the image if it is compressed. Returns an error if decompress function is not available.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.IsCompressed
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the image is compressed.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.FixAlphaEdges
member.summary: Blends low-alpha pixels with nearby pixels.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.PremultiplyAlpha
member.summary: Multiplies color values with alpha values. Resulting color values for a pixel are [code](color * alpha)/256[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.SrgbToLinear
member.summary: Converts the raw data from the sRGB colorspace to a linear scale.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.NormalmapToXy
member.summary: Converts the image's data to represent coordinates on a 3D plane. This is used when the image represents a normalmap. A normalmap can add lots of detail to a 3D surface without increasing the polygon count.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.BlitRect(Godot.Image,Godot.Rect2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Copies [code]src_rect[/code] from [code]src[/code] image to this image at coordinates [code]dst[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.BlitRectMask(Godot.Image,Godot.Image,Godot.Rect2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Blits [code]src_rect[/code] area from [code]src[/code] image to this image at the coordinates given by [code]dst[/code]. [code]src[/code] pixel is copied onto [code]dst[/code] if the corresponding [code]mask[/code] pixel's alpha value is not 0. [code]src[/code] image and [code]mask[/code] image [b]must[/b] have the same size (width and height) but they can have different formats.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.BlendRect(Godot.Image,Godot.Rect2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Alpha-blends [code]src_rect[/code] from [code]src[/code] image to this image at coordinates [code]dest[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.BlendRectMask(Godot.Image,Godot.Image,Godot.Rect2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Alpha-blends [code]src_rect[/code] from [code]src[/code] image to this image using [code]mask[/code] image at coordinates [code]dst[/code]. Alpha channels are required for both [code]src[/code] and [code]mask[/code]. [code]dst[/code] pixels and [code]src[/code] pixels will blend if the corresponding mask pixel's alpha value is not 0. [code]src[/code] image and [code]mask[/code] image [b]must[/b] have the same size (width and height) but they can have different formats.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Fill(Godot.Color)
member.summary: Fills the image with a given [Color].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetUsedRect
member.summary: Returns a [Rect2] enclosing the visible portion of the image.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetRect(Godot.Rect2)
member.summary: Returns a new image that is a copy of the image's area specified with [code]rect[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.CopyFrom(Godot.Image)
member.summary: Copies [code]src[/code] image to this image.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Lock
member.summary: Locks the data and prevents changes.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.Unlock
member.summary: Unlocks the data for writing access.

member.name: M:Godot.Image.SetPixel(System.Int32,System.Int32,Godot.Color)
member.summary: Sets the [Color] of the pixel at [code](x, y)[/code] if the image is unlocked. Example: [code] var img = Image.new() img.lock() img.set_pixel(x, y, color) # Does not have an effect img.unlock() img.set_pixel(x, y, color) # Works [/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Image.GetPixel(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the color of the pixel at [code](x, y)[/code] if the image is locked. If the image is unlocked it always returns a [Color] with the value [code](0, 0, 0, 1.0)[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.Input

member.summary: Makes the mouse cursor visible if it is hidden.

member.name: F:Godot.Input.MOUSE_MODE_CAPTURED

member.summary: Add a new mapping entry (in SDL2 format) to the mapping database. Optionally update already connected devices.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.RemoveJoyMapping(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all mappings from the internal db that match the given uid.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.IsJoyKnown(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the system knows the specified device. This means that it sets all button and axis indices exactly as defined in the [code]JOY_*[/code] constants (see [@Global Scope]). Unknown joypads are not expected to match these constants, but you can still retrieve events from them.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyAxis(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the current value of the joypad axis at given index (see [code]JOY_*[/code] constants in [@Global Scope])

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the joypad at the specified device index

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyGuid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a SDL2 compatible device guid on platforms that use gamepad remapping. Returns "Default Gamepad" otherwise.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetConnectedJoypads
member.summary: Returns an [Array] containing the device IDs of all currently connected joypads.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyVibrationStrength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the strength of the joypad vibration: x is the strength of the weak motor, and y is the strength of the strong motor.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetJoyVibrationDuration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the duration of the current vibration effect in seconds.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.StartJoyVibration(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Starts to vibrate the joypad. Joypads usually come with two rumble motors, a strong and a weak one. weak_magnitude is the strength of the weak motor (between 0 and 1) and strong_magnitude is the strength of the strong motor (between 0 and 1). duration is the duration of the effect in seconds (a duration of 0 will try to play the vibration indefinitely). Note that not every hardware is compatible with long effect durations, it is recommended to restart an effect if in need to play it for more than a few seconds.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.StopJoyVibration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stops the vibration of the joypad.

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetGyroscope

member.name: M:Godot.Input.GetLastMouseSpeed

member.name: T:Godot.InstancePlaceholder
member.summary: Turning on the option [b]Load As Placeholder[/b] for an instanced scene in the editor causes it to be replaced by an InstacePlaceholder when running the game. This makes it possible to delay actually loading the scene until calling [method replace_by_instance]. This is useful to avoid loading large scenes all at once by loading parts of it selectively. The InstancePlaceholder does not have a transform. This causes any child nodes to be positioned relatively to the Viewport from point (0,0), rather than their parent as displayed in the editor. Replacing the placeholder with a scene with a transform will transform children relatively to their parent again.

member.name: M:Godot.InstancePlaceholder.ReplaceByInstance(Godot.PackedScene)
member.summary: Replace this placeholder by the scene handed as an argument, or the original scene if no argument is given. As for all resources, the scene is loaded only if it's not loaded already. By manually loading the scene beforehand, delays caused by this function can be avoided.

member.name: M:Godot.InstancePlaceholder.GetInstancePath
member.summary: Retrieve the path to the [PackedScene] resource file that is loaded by default when calling [method replace_by_instance].

member.name: T:Godot.IP

member.summary: Creates a queue item to resolve a hostname to an IPv4 or IPv6 address depending on the TYPE_* constant given as "ip_type". Returns the queue ID if successful, or RESOLVER_INVALID_ID on error.

member.name: M:Godot.IP.GetResolveItemStatus(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a queued hostname's status as a RESOLVER_STATUS_* constant, given its queue "id".

member.name: M:Godot.IP.GetResolveItemAddress(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a queued hostname's IP address, given its queue "id". Returns an empty string on error or if resolution hasn't happened yet (see [method get_resolve_item_status]).

member.name: M:Godot.IP.EraseResolveItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a given item "id" from the queue. This should be used to free a queue after it has completed to enable more queries to happen.

member.name: M:Godot.IP.GetLocalAddresses
member.summary: Returns all of the user's current IPv4 and IPv6 addresses as an array.

member.name: M:Godot.IP.ClearCache(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all of a "hostname"'s cached references. If no "hostname" is given then all cached IP addresses are removed.

member.name: T:Godot.ItemList
member.summary: This control provides a selectable list of items that may be in a single (or multiple columns) with option of text, icons, or both text and icon. Tooltips are supported and may be different for every item in the list. Selectable items in the list may be selected or deselected and multiple selection may be enabled. Selection with right mouse button may also be enabled to allow use of popup context menus. Items may also be 'activated' with a double click (or Enter key).

member.summary: Allow or disallow selection of the item at the specified index.

member.summary: When [member node_a] and [member node_b] move in different directions the [code]bias[/code] controls how fast the joint pulls them back to their original position. The lower the [code]bias[/code] the more the two bodies can pull on the joint. Default value: [code]0[/code]

member.name: T:Godot.JSON
member.summary: Helper class for parsing JSON data.

member.name: M:Godot.JSON.Print(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a Variant var to JSON text and returns the result. Useful for serializing data to store or send over the network.

member.name: M:Godot.JSON.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a JSON encoded string and returns a [JSONParseResult] containing the result.

member.name: T:Godot.JSONParseResult
member.summary: Returned by [method JSON.parse], [code]JSONParseResult[/code] contains decoded JSON or error information if JSON source not successfully parsed. You can check if JSON source was successfully parsed with [code]if json_result.error == 0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.JSONParseResult.Error
member.summary: The error type if JSON source was not successfully parsed. See [@Global Scope]ERR_* constants.

member.name: P:Godot.JSONParseResult.ErrorString
member.summary: The error message if JSON source was not successfully parsed. See [@Global Scope]ERR_* constants.

member.name: P:Godot.JSONParseResult.ErrorLine
member.summary: The line number where the error occurred if JSON source was not successfully parsed.

member.name: P:Godot.JSONParseResult.Result
member.summary: A [Variant] containing the parsed JSON. Use typeof() to check if it is what you expect. For example, if JSON source starts with braces [code]{}[/code] a [Dictionary] will be returned, if JSON source starts with array braces [code][][/code] an [Array] will be returned. [i]Be aware that the JSON specification does not define integer or float types, but only a number type. Therefore, parsing a JSON text will convert all numerical values to float types.[/i] [codeblock] p = JSON.parse('["hello", "world", "!"]') if typeof(p) == TYPE_ARRAY: print(p[0]) # prints 'hello' else: print("unexpected results") [/codeblock]

member.name: T:Godot.KinematicBody
member.summary: Kinematic bodies are special types of bodies that are meant to be user-controlled. They are not affected by physics at all (to other types of bodies, such a character or a rigid body, these are the same as a static body). They have however, two main uses: Simulated Motion: When these bodies are moved manually, either from code or from an AnimationPlayer (with process mode set to fixed), the physics will automatically compute an estimate of their linear and angular velocity. This makes them very useful for moving platforms or other AnimationPlayer-controlled objects (like a door, a bridge that opens, etc). Kinematic Characters: KinematicBody also has an API for moving objects (the [method move_and_collide] and [method move_and_slide] methods) while performing collision tests. This makes them really useful to implement characters that collide against a world, but that don't require advanced physics.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicBody.Collision__safeMargin
member.summary: If the body is at least this close to another body, this body will consider them to be colliding.

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.MoveAndCollide(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the body along the vector [code]rel_vec[/code]. The body will stop if it collides. Returns a [KinematicCollision], which contains information about the collision.

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.MoveAndSlide(Godot.Vector3,System.Nullable{Godot.Vector3},System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Moves the body along a vector. If the body collides with another, it will slide along the other body rather than stop immediately. If the other body is a [code]KinematicBody[/code] or [RigidBody], it will also be affected by the motion of the other body. You can use this to make moving or rotating platforms, or to make nodes push other nodes. [code]linear_velocity[/code] is a value in pixels per second. Unlike in for example [method move_and_collide], you should [i]not[/i] multiply it with [code]delta[/code] — this is done by the method. [code]floor_normal[/code] is the up direction, used to determine what is a wall and what is a floor or a ceiling. If set to the default value of [code]Vector2(0, 0)[/code], everything is considered a wall. This is useful for topdown games. If the body is standing on a slope and the horizontal speed (relative to the floor's speed) goes below [code]slope_stop_min_velocity[/code], the body will stop completely. This prevents the body from sliding down slopes when you include gravity in [code]linear_velocity[/code]. When set to lower values, the body will not be able to stand still on steep slopes. If the body collides, it will change direction a maximum of [code]max_bounces[/code] times before it stops. [code]floor_max_angle[/code] is the maximum angle (in radians) where a slope is still considered a floor (or a ceiling), rather than a wall. The default value equals 45 degrees. Returns the movement that remained when the body stopped. To get more detailed information about collisions that occured, use [method get_slide_collision]. <param name="floorNormal">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector3(0, 0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.TestMove(Godot.Transform,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Checks for collisions without moving the body. Virtually sets the node's position, scale and rotation to that of the given [Transform], then tries to move the body along the vector [code]rel_vec[/code]. Returns [code]true[/code] if a collision would occur.

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.IsOnFloor
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the body is on the floor. Only updates when calling [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.IsOnCeiling
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the body is on the ceiling. Only updates when calling [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.IsOnWall
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the body is on a wall. Only updates when calling [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.GetFloorVelocity
member.summary: Returns the velocity of the floor. Only updates when calling [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.GetSlideCount
member.summary: Returns the number of times the body collided and changed direction during the last call to [method move_and_slide].

member.name: M:Godot.KinematicBody.GetSlideCollision(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a [KinematicCollision], which contains information about a collision that occured during the last [method move_and_slide] call. Since the body can collide several times in a single call to [method move_and_slide], you must specify the index of the collision in the range 0 to ([method get_slide_count]()-1).

This makes them very useful for moving platforms or other AnimationPlayer-controlled objects (like a door, a bridge that opens, etc). Kinematic Characters: KinematicBody2D also has an API for moving objects (the [method move_and_collide] and [method move_and_slide] methods) while performing collision tests. member.name: T:Godot.KinematicCollision
member.summary: Contains collision data for KinematicBody collisions. When a [KinematicBody] is moved using [method KinematicBody.move_and_collide], it stops if it detects a collision with another body. If a collision is detected, a KinematicCollision object is returned. This object contains information about the collision, including the colliding object, the remaining motion, and the collision position. This information can be used to calculate a collision response.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.Position
member.summary: The point of collision.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.Normal
member.summary: The colliding body's shape's normal at the point of collision.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.Travel
member.summary: The distance the moving object traveled before collision.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.Remainder
member.summary: The moving object's remaining movement vector.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.LocalShape
member.summary: The moving object's colliding shape.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.Collider
member.summary: The colliding body.

member.summary: The colliding body's unique [RID].

member.summary: The colliding body's shape.

member.summary: The colliding shape's index. See [CollisionObject].

member.summary: The colliding object's velocity.

member.name: P:Godot.KinematicCollision.ColliderMetadata
member.summary: The colliding body's metadata. See [Object].

member.name: T:Godot.Label
member.summary: Label displays plain text on the screen. It gives you control over the horizontal and vertical alignment, and can wrap the text inside the node's bounding rectangle. It doesn't support bold, italics or other formatting. For that, use [RichTextLabel] instead.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.ALIGN_LEFT
member.summary: Align rows to the left (default).

member.name: F:Godot.Label.ALIGN_CENTER
member.summary: Align rows centered.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.ALIGN_RIGHT
member.summary: Align rows to the right (default).

member.name: F:Godot.Label.ALIGN_FILL
member.summary: Expand row whitespaces to fit the width.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.VALIGN_TOP
member.summary: Align the whole text to the top.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.VALIGN_CENTER
member.summary: Align the whole text to the center.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.VALIGN_BOTTOM
member.summary: Align the whole text to the bottom.

member.name: F:Godot.Label.VALIGN_FILL
member.summary: Align the whole text by spreading the rows.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Text
member.summary: The text to display on screen.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Align
member.summary: Controls the text's horizontal align. Supports left, center, right, and fill, or justify. Set it to one of the [code]ALIGN_*[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Valign
member.summary: Controls the text's vertical align. Supports top, center, bottom, and fill. Set it to one of the [code]VALIGN_*[/code] constants.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Autowrap
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], wraps the text inside the node's bounding rectangle. If you resize the node, it will change its height automatically to show all the text. Default: false.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.ClipText
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the Label only shows the text that fits inside its bounding rectangle. It also lets you scale the node down freely.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.Uppercase
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], all the text displays as UPPERCASE.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.PercentVisible
member.summary: Limits the count of visible characters. If you set [code]percent_visible[/code] to 50, only up to half of the text's characters will display on screen. Useful to animate the text in a dialog box.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.LinesSkipped
member.summary: The node ignores the first [code]lines_skipped[/code] lines before it starts to display text.

member.name: P:Godot.Label.MaxLinesVisible
member.summary: Limits the lines of text the node shows on screen.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetAlign(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the alignment mode to any of the ALIGN_* enumeration values.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetAlign
member.summary: Returns the alignment mode (any of the ALIGN_* enumeration values).

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetValign(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the vertical alignment mode to any of the VALIGN_* enumeration values.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetValign
member.summary: Returns the vertical alignment mode (any of the VALIGN_* enumeration values).

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Set the label text. Text can contain newlines.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetText
member.summary: Returns the label text. Text can contain newlines.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetAutowrap(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set [i]autowrap[/i] mode. When enabled, autowrap will fit text to the control width, breaking sentences when they exceed the available horizontal space. When disabled, the label minimum width becomes the width of the longest row, and the minimum height large enough to fit all rows.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.HasAutowrap
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if [i]autowrap[/i] mode (see [method set_autowrap]).

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetClipText(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cuts off the rest of the text if it is too wide.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.IsClippingText
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if text would be cut off if it is too wide.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetUppercase(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Display text in all capitals.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.IsUppercase
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if text is displayed in all capitals.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetLineHeight
member.summary: Returns the font size in pixels.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetLineCount
member.summary: Returns the amount of lines of text the Label has.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetVisibleLineCount
member.summary: Returns the number of lines shown. Useful if the [code]Label[/code] 's height cannot currently display all lines.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetTotalCharacterCount
member.summary: Returns the total length of the text.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetVisibleCharacters(System.Int32)
member.summary: Restricts the number of characters to display. Set to -1 to disable.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetVisibleCharacters
member.summary: Returns the restricted number of characters to display. Returns -1 if unrestricted.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetPercentVisible(System.Single)
member.summary: Restricts the number of characters to display (as a percentage of the total text).

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetPercentVisible
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of characters to display as a percentage of the total text.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetLinesSkipped(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the number of lines to skip before displaying. Useful for scrolling text.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetLinesSkipped
member.summary: Returns the the number of lines to skip before displaying.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.SetMaxLinesVisible(System.Int32)
member.summary: Restricts the number of lines to display. Set to -1 to disable.

member.name: M:Godot.Label.GetMaxLinesVisible
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of lines to display. Returns -1 if unrestricted.

member.name: T:Godot.LargeTexture
member.summary: A Texture capable of storing many smaller Textures with offsets. You can dynamically add pieces([Texture]) to this [code]LargeTexture[/code] using different offsets.

member.name: P:Godot.LargeTexture._Data
member.summary: Returns an [Array] with offsets and textures data of each added piece. Schema is [offsets1, texture1, offsets2, texture2, large_texture_size]. [code]offsets[/code] : [Vector2] offsets of the texture piece. [code]second[/code] : [StreamTexture] data of the texture piece. [code]last entry[/code] : [Vector2] size of the entire large texture.

member.name: M:Godot.LargeTexture.AddPiece(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Texture)
member.summary: Add another [Texture] to this [code]LargeTexture[/code], starting on offset "ofs".

member.name: M:Godot.LargeTexture.SetPieceOffset(System.Int32,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the offset of the piece with index "idx" to "ofs".

member.name: M:Godot.LargeTexture.SetPieceTexture(System.Int32,Godot.Texture)
member.summary: Sets the [Texture] of the piece with index "idx" to "ofs".

member.name: M:Godot.LargeTexture.SetSize(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the size of this [code]LargeTexture[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.LargeTexture.Clear
member.summary: Clears the [code]LargeTexture[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.LargeTexture.GetPieceCount
member.summary: Returns the number of pieces currently in this [code]LargeTexture[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.LargeTexture.GetPieceOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the offset of the piece with index "idx".

member.name: M:Godot.LargeTexture.GetPieceTexture(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the [Texture] of the piece with index "idx".

member.name: T:Godot.Light
member.summary: Light is the abstract base class for light nodes, so it shouldn't be used directly (It can't be instanced). Other types of light nodes inherit from it. Light contains the common variables and parameters used for lighting.

member.name: T:Godot.Light2D
member.summary: Casts light in a 2D environment. Light is defined by a (usually grayscale) texture, a color, an energy value, a mode (see constants), and various other parameters (range and shadows-related). Note that Light2D can be used as a mask.

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.MODE_ADD
member.summary: Adds the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it. This is the common behaviour of a light.

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.MODE_SUB
member.summary: Subtracts the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it, resulting in inversed light effect.

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.MODE_MIX
member.summary: Mix the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it by linear interpolation.

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.MODE_MASK
member.summary: The light texture of the Light2D is used as a mask, hiding or revealing parts of the screen underneath depending on the value of each pixel of the light (mask) texture.

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.SHADOW_FILTER_NONE
member.summary: No filter applies to the shadow map. See [method shadow_filter].

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.SHADOW_FILTER_PCF3
member.summary: Percentage closer filtering (3 samples) applies to the shadow map. See [method shadow_filter].

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.SHADOW_FILTER_PCF5
member.summary: Percentage closer filtering (5 samples) applies to the shadow map. See [method shadow_filter].

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.SHADOW_FILTER_PCF7
member.summary: Percentage closer filtering (7 samples) applies to the shadow map. See [method shadow_filter].

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.SHADOW_FILTER_PCF9
member.summary: Percentage closer filtering (9 samples) applies to the shadow map. See [method shadow_filter].

member.name: F:Godot.Light2D.SHADOW_FILTER_PCF13
member.summary: Percentage closer filtering (13 samples) applies to the shadow map. See [method shadow_filter].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] Light2D will emit light. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.EditorOnly
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] Light2D will only appear when editing the scene. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Texture
member.summary: [Texture] used for the Light2D's appearance.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the Light2D's [code]texture[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.TextureScale
member.summary: The [code]texture[/code]'s scale factor.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Color
member.summary: The Light2D's [Color].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Energy
member.summary: The Light2D's energy value. The larger the value, the stronger the light.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.Mode
member.summary: The Light2D's mode. See MODE_* constants for values.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeHeight
member.summary: The height of the Light2D. Used with 2D normal mapping.

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeZMin
member.summary: Minimum [code]z[/code] value of objects that are affected by the Light2D. Default value: [code]-1024[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeZMax
member.summary: Maximum [code]Z[/code] value of objects that are affected by the Light2D. Default value: [code]1024[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeLayerMin
member.summary: Minimum layer value of objects that are affected by the Light2D. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Light2D.RangeLayerMax
member.summary: Maximum layer value of objects that are affected by the Light2D. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.summary: The layer mask. Only objects with a matching mask will be affected by the Light2D.

member.name: T:Godot.MainLoop
member.summary: Main loop is the abstract main loop base class. All other main loop classes are derived from it. Upon application start, a [code]MainLoop[/code] has to be provided to OS, else the application will exit. This happens automatically (and a [SceneTree] is created), unless a main [Script] is supplied, which may or not create and return a [code]MainLoop[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.Mesh
member.summary: Mesh is a type of [Resource] that contains vertex-array based geometry, divided in [i]surfaces[/i]. Each surface contains a completely separate array and a material used to draw it. Design wise, a mesh with multiple surfaces is preferred to a single surface, because objects created in 3D editing software commonly contain multiple materials.

member.summary: Render array as points (one vertex equals one point).

member.summary: Render array as lines (every two vertices a line is created).

member.summary: Render array as line strip.

member.summary: Render array as line loop (like line strip, but closed).

member.summary: Render array as triangles (every three vertices a triangle is created).

member.summary: Render array as triangle strips.

member.name: F:Godot.Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_FAN
member.summary: Render array as triangle fans.

member.name: T:Godot.MeshInstance
member.summary: MeshInstance is a [Node] that takes a [Mesh] resource and adds it to the current scenario by creating an instance of it. This is the class most often used to get 3D geometry rendered and can be used to instance a single [Mesh] in many places. This allows to reuse geometry and save on resources. When a [Mesh] has to be instanced more than thousands of times at close proximity, consider using a [MultiMesh] in a [MultiMeshInstance] instead.

member.summary: The [Mesh] resource for the instance.

member.summary: Returns the [Material] for a surface of the [Mesh] resource.
