member.name: T:Godot.MultiMesh
member.summary: MultiMesh provides low level mesh instancing. If the amount of [Mesh] instances needed goes from hundreds to thousands (and most need to be visible at close proximity) creating such a large amount of [MeshInstance] nodes may affect performance by using too much CPU or video memory. For this case a MultiMesh becomes very useful, as it can draw thousands of instances with little API overhead. As a drawback, if the instances are too far away of each other, performance may be reduced as every single instance will always rendered (they are spatially indexed as one, for the whole object). Since instances may have any behavior, the Rect3 used for visibility must be provided by the user.

member.name: M:Godot.MultiMesh.SetMesh(Godot.Mesh)
member.summary: Set the [Mesh] resource to be drawn in multiple instances.

member.summary: Return the [Mesh] resource drawn as multiple instances.

member.summary: Return the amount of instances that is going to be drawn.

member.summary: Set the transform for a specific instance.

member.name: M:Godot.MultiMesh.GetInstanceTransform(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the transform of a specific instance.

member.name: T:Godot.NinePatchRect
member.summary: Better known as 9-slice panels, NinePatchRect produces clean panels of any size, based on a small texture. To do so, it splits the texture in a 3 by 3 grid. When you scale the node, it tiles the texture's sides horizontally or vertically, the center on both axes but it doesn't scale or tile the corners.

member.name: F:Godot.NinePatchRect.AXIS_STRETCH_MODE_STRETCH
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing. Default value for [code]axis_stretch_horizontal[/code] and [code]axis_stretch_vertical[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.NinePatchRect.AXIS_STRETCH_MODE_TILE
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing.

member.name: F:Godot.NinePatchRect.AXIS_STRETCH_MODE_TILE_FIT
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.Texture
member.summary: The node's texture resource.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.DrawCenter
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], draw the panel's center. Else, only draw the 9-slice's borders. Default value: [code]true[/code]

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.RegionRect
member.summary: Rectangular region of the texture to sample from. If you're working with an atlas, use this property to define the area the 9-slice should use. All other properties are relative to this one.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.PatchMarginLeft
member.summary: The height of the 9-slice's left column.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.PatchMarginTop
member.summary: The height of the 9-slice's top row.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.PatchMarginRight
member.summary: The height of the 9-slice's right column.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.PatchMarginBottom
member.summary: The height of the 9-slice's bottom row. A margin of 16 means the 9-slice's bottom corners and side will have a height of 16 pixels. You can set all 4 margin values individually to create panels with non-uniform borders.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.AxisStretchHorizontal
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing.

member.name: P:Godot.NinePatchRect.AxisStretchVertical
member.summary: Doesn't do anything at the time of writing.

member.name: T:Godot.Node
member.summary: Nodes are the base bricks with which Godot games are developed. They can be set as children of other nodes, resulting in a tree arrangement. A given node can contain any number of nodes as children (but there is only one scene tree root node) with the requirement that all siblings (direct children of a node) should have unique names. Any tree of nodes is called a [i]scene[/i]. Scenes can be saved to the disk and then instanced into other scenes. This allows for very high flexibility in the architecture and data model of the projects. Nodes can optionally be added to groups. This makes it easy to reach a number of nodes from the code (for example an "enemies" group) to perform grouped actions. [b]Scene tree:[/b] The [SceneTree] contains the active tree of nodes. When a node is added to the scene tree, it receives the NOTIFICATION_ENTER_TREE notification and its [method _enter_tree] callback is triggered. Children nodes are always added [i]after[/i] their parent node, i.e. the [method _enter_tree] callback of a parent node will be triggered before its child's. Once all nodes have been added in the scene tree, they receive the NOTIFICATION_READY notification and their respective [method _ready] callbacks are triggered. For groups of nodes, the [method _ready] callback is called in reverse order, from the children up to the parent nodes. It means that when adding a scene to the scene tree, the following order will be used for the callbacks: [method _enter_tree] of the parent, [method _enter_tree] of the children, [method _ready] of the children and finally [method _ready] of the parent (and that recursively for the whole scene). [b]Processing:[/b] Nodes can be set to the "process" state, so that they receive a callback on each frame requesting them to process (do something). Normal processing (callback [method _process], toggled with [method set_process]) happens as fast as possible and is dependent on the frame rate, so the processing time [i]delta[/i] is variable. Physics processing (callback [method _physics_process], toggled with [method set_physics_process]) happens a fixed amount of times per second (by default 60) and is useful to link itself to the physics. Nodes can also process input events. When set, the [method _input] function will be called for each input that the program receives. In many cases, this can be overkill (unless used for simple projects), and the [method _unhandled_input] function might be preferred; it is called when the input event was not handled by anyone else (typically, GUI [Control] nodes), ensuring that the node only receives the events that were meant for it. To keep track of the scene hierarchy (especially when instancing scenes into other scenes), an "owner" can be set for the node with [method set_owner]. This keeps track of who instanced what. This is mostly useful when writing editors and tools, though. Finally, when a node is freed with [method free] or [method queue_free], it will also free all its children. [b]Networking with nodes:[/b] After connecting to a server (or making one, see [NetworkedMultiplayerENet]) it is possible to use the built-in RPC (remote procedure call) system to easily communicate over the network. By calling [method rpc] with a method name, it will be called locally, and in all connected peers (peers = clients and the server that accepts connections), with behaviour varying depending on the network mode ([method set_network_mode]) on the receiving peer. To identify which [code]Node[/code] receives the RPC call Godot will use its [NodePath] (make sure node names are the same on all peers).

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NOTIFICATION_PHYSICS_PROCESS
member.summary: Notification received every frame when the physics process flag is set (see [method set_physics_process]).

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NOTIFICATION_PROCESS
member.summary: Notification received every frame when the process flag is set (see [method set_process]).

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NOTIFICATION_PARENTED
member.summary: Notification received when a node is set as a child of another node. Note that this doesn't mean that a node entered the Scene Tree.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.NOTIFICATION_UNPARENTED
member.summary: Notification received when a node is unparented (parent removed it from the list of children).

member.name: F:Godot.Node.RPC_MODE_REMOTE
member.summary: Call a method remotely.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.RPC_MODE_SYNC
member.summary: Call a method both remotely and locally.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.RPC_MODE_MASTER
member.summary: Call a method if the Node is Master.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.RPC_MODE_SLAVE
member.summary: Call a method if the Node is Slave.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.PAUSE_MODE_INHERIT
member.summary: Inherits pause mode from parent. For root node, it is equivalent to PAUSE_MODE_STOP.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.PAUSE_MODE_STOP
member.summary: Stop processing when SceneTree is paused.

member.name: F:Godot.Node.PAUSE_MODE_PROCESS
member.summary: Continue to process regardless of SceneTree pause state.

member.name: M:Godot.Node._EnterTree
member.summary: Called when the node enters the [SceneTree] (e.g. upon instancing, scene changing or after calling [method add_child] in a script). If the node has children, its [method _enter_tree] callback will be called first, and then that of the children. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_ENTER_TREE notification in [method Object._notification].

member.name: M:Godot.Node._ExitTree
member.summary: Called when the node leaves the [SceneTree] (e.g. upon freeing, scene changing or after calling [method remove_child] in a script). If the node has children, its [method _exit_tree] callback will be called last, after all its children have left the tree. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_EXIT_TREE notification in [method Object._notification].

member.name: M:Godot.Node._Input(Godot.InputEvent)
member.summary: Called when there is a change to input devices. Propagated through the node tree until a Node consumes it.

member.name: M:Godot.Node._PhysicsProcess(System.Single)
member.summary: Called during the physics processing step of the main loop. Physics processing means that the frame rate is synced to the physics, i.e. the [code]delta[/code] variable should be constant. It is only called if physics processing has been enabled with [method set_physics_process]. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_PHYSICS_PROCESS notification in [method Object._notification].

member.name: M:Godot.Node._Process(System.Single)
member.summary: Called during the processing step of the main loop. Processing happens at every frame and as fast as possible, so the [code]delta[/code] time since the previous frame is not constant. It is only called if processing has been enabled with [method set_process]. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_PROCESS notification in [method Object._notification].

member.name: M:Godot.Node._Ready
member.summary: Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their [method _ready] callback gets triggered first, and the node will receive the ready notification only afterwards. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_READY notification in [method Object._notification].

member.name: M:Godot.Node._UnhandledInput(Godot.InputEvent)
member.summary: Propagated to all nodes when the previous InputEvent is not consumed by any nodes.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetName(System.String)
member.summary: Set the name of the [code]Node[/code]. Name must be unique within parent, and setting an already existing name will cause for the node to be automatically renamed.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetName
member.summary: Return the name of the node. This name is unique among the siblings (other child nodes from the same parent).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.AddChild(Godot.Node,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a child [code]Node[/code]. Nodes can have as many children as they want, but every child must have a unique name. Children nodes are automatically deleted when the parent node is deleted, so deleting a whole scene is performed by deleting its topmost node. The optional boolean argument enforces creating child nodes with human-readable names, based on the name of the node being instanced instead of its type only.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RemoveChild(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Remove a child [code]Node[/code]. Node is NOT deleted and will have to be deleted manually.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetChildCount
member.summary: Return the amount of child nodes.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetChildren
member.summary: Return an array of references ([code]Node[/code]) to the child nodes.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetChild(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a child node by its index (see [method get_child_count]). This method is often used for iterating all children of a node.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.HasNode(Godot.NodePath)
member.summary: Return whether the node that a given [NodePath] points too exists.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetNode(Godot.NodePath)
member.summary: Fetch a node. The [NodePath] must be valid (or else an error will be raised) and can be either the path to child node, a relative path (from the current node to another node), or an absolute path to a node. Note: fetching absolute paths only works when the node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]). [i]Example:[/i] Assume your current node is Character and the following tree: [codeblock] /root /root/Character /root/Character/Sword /root/Character/Backpack/Dagger /root/MyGame /root/Swamp/Alligator /root/Swamp/Mosquito /root/Swamp/Goblin [/codeblock] Possible paths are: [codeblock] get_node("Sword") get_node("Backpack/Dagger") get_node("../Swamp/Alligator") get_node("/root/MyGame") [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetParent
member.summary: Return the parent node of the current node, or an empty [code]Node[/code] if the node lacks a parent.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.FindNode(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find a descendant of this node whose name matches [code]mask[/code] as in [method String.match] (i.e. case sensitive, but '*' matches zero or more characters and '?' matches any single character except '.'). Note that it does not match against the full path, just against individual node names.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsInsideTree
member.summary: Return whether this Node is inside a [SceneTree].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsAParentOf(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Return [i]true[/i] if the "node" argument is a direct or indirect child of the current node, otherwise return [i]false[/i].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsGreaterThan(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Return [i]true[/i] if "node" occurs later in the scene hierarchy than the current node, otherwise return [i]false[/i].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetPath
member.summary: Return the absolute path of the current node. This only works if the current node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetPathTo(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Return the relative path from the current node to the specified node in "node" argument. Both nodes must be in the same scene, or else the function will fail.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.AddToGroup(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a node to a group. Groups are helpers to name and organize a subset of nodes, like for example "enemies" or "collectables". A [code]Node[/code] can be in any number of groups. Nodes can be assigned a group at any time, but will not be added to it until they are inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RemoveFromGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a node from a group.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsInGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Return whether this Node is in the specified group.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.MoveChild(Godot.Node,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move a child node to a different position (order) amongst the other children. Since calls, signals, etc are performed by tree order, changing the order of children nodes may be useful.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetGroups
member.summary: Return an array listing the groups that the node is part of.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.Raise
member.summary: Move this node to the top of the array of nodes of the parent node. This is often useful on GUIs ([Control]), because their order of drawing fully depends on their order in the tree.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetOwner(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Set the node owner. A node can have any other node as owner (as long as a valid parent, grandparent, etc ascending in the tree). When saving a node (using SceneSaver) all the nodes it owns will be saved with it. This allows to create complex SceneTrees, with instancing and subinstancing.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetOwner
member.summary: Get the node owner (see [method set_owner]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RemoveAndSkip
member.summary: Remove a node and set all its children as children of the parent node (if exists). All even subscriptions that pass by the removed node will be unsubscribed.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetIndex
member.summary: Get the node index, i.e. its position among the siblings of its parent.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.PrintTree
member.summary: Print the scene to stdout. Used mainly for debugging purposes.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetFilename(System.String)
member.summary: A node can contain a filename. This filename should not be changed by the user, unless writing editors and tools. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetFilename
member.summary: Return a filename that may be contained by the node. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded (see [method set_filename]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.PropagateNotification(System.Int32)
member.summary: Notify the current node and all its children recursively by calling notification() in all of them.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.PropagateCall(System.String,System.Object[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calls the method (if present) with the arguments given in "args" on this Node and recursively on all children. If the parent_first argument is true then the method will be called on the current [code]Node[/code] first, then on all children. If it is false then the children will get called first. <param name="args">If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetPhysicsProcess(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the node's physics (alias fixed framerate) processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PHYSICS_PROCESS at a fixed (usually 60 fps, check [OS] to change that) interval (and the [method _physics_process] callback will be called if exists). It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous frame by calling [method get_physics_process_delta_time].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetPhysicsProcessDeltaTime
member.summary: Return the time elapsed since the last physics-bound frame (see [method _physics_process]). This is always a constant value in physics processing unless the frames per second is changed in [OS].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsPhysicsProcessing
member.summary: Return true if physics processing is enabled (see [method set_physics_process]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetProcessDeltaTime
member.summary: Return the time elapsed (in seconds) since the last process callback. This is almost always different each time.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetProcess(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables node processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PROCESS on every drawn frame (and the [method _process] callback will be called if exists). It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous frame by calling [method get_process_delta_time].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsProcessing
member.summary: Return whether processing is enabled in the current node (see [method set_process]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetProcessInput(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable input processing for node. This is not required for GUI controls! It hooks up the node to receive all input (see [method _input]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsProcessingInput
member.summary: Return true if the node is processing input (see [method set_process_input]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetProcessUnhandledInput(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable unhandled input processing for node. This is not required for GUI controls! It hooks up the node to receive all input that was not previously handled before (usually by a [Control]). (see [method _unhandled_input]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.IsProcessingUnhandledInput
member.summary: Return true if the node is processing unhandled input (see [method set_process_unhandled_input]).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.SetPauseMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set pause mode (PAUSE_MODE_*) of this Node.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetPauseMode
member.summary: Return the pause mode (PAUSE_MODE_*) of this Node.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.CanProcess
member.summary: Return true if the node can process, i.e. whether its pause mode allows processing while the scene tree is paused (see [method set_pause_mode]). Always returns true if the scene tree is not paused, and false if the node is not in the tree. FIXME: Why FAIL_COND?

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetPositionInParent
member.summary: Return the order in the node tree branch, i.e. if called by the first child Node, return 0.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.GetTree
member.summary: Return a [SceneTree] that this node is inside.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.Duplicate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Duplicate the node, returning a new [code]Node[/code]. You can fine-tune the behavior using the [code]flags[/code], which are based on the DUPLICATE_* constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.ReplaceBy(Godot.Node,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replace a node in a scene by a given one. Subscriptions that pass through this node will be lost.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.QueueFree
member.summary: Queues a node for deletion at the end of the current frame. When deleted, all of its children nodes will be deleted as well. This method ensures it's safe to delete the node, contrary to [method Object.free]. Use [method Object.is_queued_for_deletion] to know whether a node will be deleted at the end of the frame.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RequestReady
member.summary: Request that [code]_ready[/code] be called again.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RpcConfig(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Change the method's RPC mode (one of RPC_MODE_* constants).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RsetConfig(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Change the property's RPC mode (one of RPC_MODE_* constants).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.Rpc(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Send a remote procedure call request to all peers on the network (and locally), optionally sending additional data as arguments. Call request will be received by nodes with the same [NodePath].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RpcUnreliable(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Send a [method rpc] using an unreliable protocol.

member.summary: Send a [method rpc] to a specific peer identified by [i]peer_id[/i].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RpcUnreliableId(System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Send a [method rpc] to a specific peer identified by [i]peer_id[/i] using an unreliable protocol.

member.name: M:Godot.Node.Rset(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Remotely change property's value on other peers (and locally).

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RsetId(System.Int32,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Remotely change property's value on a specific peer identified by [i]peer_id[/i].

member.name: M:Godot.Node.RsetUnreliable(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Remotely change property's value on other peers (and locally) using an unreliable protocol.

member.summary: Remotely change property's value on a specific peer identified by [i]peer_id[/i] using an unreliable protocol.

member.name: T:Godot.Node2D
member.summary: A 2D game object, with a position, rotation and scale. All 2D physics nodes and sprites inherit from Node2D. Use Node2D as a parent node to move, scale and rotate children in a 2D project. Also gives control on the node's render order.

member.name: T:Godot.Object
member.summary: Base class for all non built-in types. Everything not a built-in type starts the inheritance chain from this class. Objects do not manage memory, if inheriting from one the object will most likely have to be deleted manually (call the [method free] function from the script or delete from C++). Some derivatives add memory management, such as [Reference] (which keeps a reference count and deletes itself automatically when no longer referenced) and [Node], which deletes the children tree when deleted. Objects export properties, which are mainly useful for storage and editing, but not really so much in programming. Properties are exported in [method _get_property_list] and handled in [method _get] and [method _set]. However, scripting languages and C++ have simpler means to export them. Objects also receive notifications ([method _notification]). Notifications are a simple way to notify the object about simple events, so they can all be handled together.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.NOTIFICATION_POSTINITIALIZE
member.summary: Called right when the object is initialized. Not available in script.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.NOTIFICATION_PREDELETE
member.summary: Called before the object is about to be deleted.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.CONNECT_DEFERRED
member.summary: Connect a signal in deferred mode. This way, signal emissions are stored in a queue, then set on idle time.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.CONNECT_PERSIST
member.summary: Persisting connections are saved when the object is serialized to file.

member.name: F:Godot.Object.CONNECT_ONESHOT
member.summary: One shot connections disconnect themselves after emission.

member.name: M:Godot.Object._Get(System.String)
member.summary: Return a property, return null if the property does not exist.

member.summary: Return the property list, array of dictionaries, dictionaries must contain: name:String, type:int (see TYPE_* enum in [@Global Scope]) and optionally: hint:int (see PROPERTY_HINT_* in [@Global Scope]), hint_string:String, usage:int (see PROPERTY_USAGE_* in [@Global Scope]).

member.summary: Set property into the object.

member.summary: Get a property from the object.

member.summary: Return the list of properties as an array of dictionaries, dictionaries contain: name:String, type:int (see TYPE_* enum in [@Global Scope]) and optionally: hint:int (see PROPERTY_HINT_* in [@Global Scope]), hint_string:String, usage:int (see PROPERTY_USAGE_* in [@Global Scope]).

member.summary: Return a metadata from the object.

member.summary: Return true if a metadata is found with the requested name.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.AddUserSignal(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Add a user signal (can be added anytime). Arguments are optional, but can be added as an array of dictionaries, each containing "name" and "type" (from [@Global Scope] TYPE_*). <param name="arguments">If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}</param>

member.summary: Return the list of signals as an array of dictionaries.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.GetIncomingConnections
member.summary: Returns an [Array] of dictionaries with information about signals that are connected to this object. Inside each [Dictionary] there are 3 fields: - "source" is a reference to signal emitter. - "signal_name" is name of connected signal. - "method_name" is a name of method to which signal is connected.

member.name: M:Godot.Object.Connect(System.String,Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Connect a signal to a method at a target (member function). Binds are optional and are passed as extra arguments to the call. Flags specify optional deferred or one shot connections, see enum CONNECT_*. A signal can only be connected once to a method, and it will throw an error if already connected. If you want to avoid this, use [method is_connected] to check. <param name="binds">If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}</param>

member.name: T:Godot.PacketPeer
member.summary: PacketPeer is an abstraction and base class for packet-based protocols (such as UDP). It provides an API for sending and receiving packets both as raw data or variables. This makes it easy to transfer data over a protocol, without having to encode data as low level bytes or having to worry about network ordering.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.GetVar
member.summary: Get a Variant.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.PutVar(System.Object)
member.summary: Send a Variant as a packet.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.GetPacket
member.summary: Get a raw packet.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.PutPacket(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send a raw packet.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.GetPacketError
member.summary: Return the error state of the last packet received (via [method get_packet] and [method get_var]).

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeer.GetAvailablePacketCount
member.summary: Return the number of packets currently available in the ring-buffer.

member.name: T:Godot.PacketPeerStream
member.summary: PacketStreamPeer provides a wrapper for working using packets over a stream. This allows for using packet based code with StreamPeers. PacketPeerStream implements a custom protocol over the StreamPeer, so the user should not read or write to the wrapped StreamPeer directly.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerStream.SetStreamPeer(Godot.Reference)
member.summary: Set the [StreamPeer] object to be wrapped.

member.name: T:Godot.PacketPeerUDP
member.summary: UDP packet peer. Can be used to send raw UDP packets as well as [Variant]s.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.Listen(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Make this [code]PacketPeerUDP[/code] listen on the "port" binding to "bind_address" with a buffer size "recv_buf_size". If "bind_address" is set as "*" (default), the peer will listen on all available addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6). If "bind_address" is set as "0.0.0.0" (for IPv4) or "::" (for IPv6), the peer will listen on all available addresses matching that IP type. If "bind_address" is set to any valid address (e.g. "192.168.1.101", "::1", etc), the peer will only listen on the interface with that addresses (or fail if no interface with the given address exists).

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.Close
member.summary: Close the UDP socket the [code]PacketPeerUDP[/code] is currently listening on.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.Wait
member.summary: Wait for a packet to arrive on the listening port, see [method listen].

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.IsListening
member.summary: Return whether this [code]PacketPeerUDP[/code] is listening.

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.GetPacketIp
member.summary: Return the IP of the remote peer that sent the last packet(that was received with [method get_packet] or [method get_var]).

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.GetPacketPort
member.summary: Return the port of the remote peer that sent the last packet(that was received with [method get_packet] or [method get_var]).

member.name: M:Godot.PacketPeerUDP.SetDestAddress(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the destination address and port for sending packets and variables, a hostname will be resolved using if valid.

member.name: T:Godot.Panel
member.summary: Panel is a [Control] that displays an opaque background. It's commonly used as a parent and container for other types of [Control] nodes.

member.name: T:Godot.PanelContainer
member.summary: Panel container type. This container fits controls inside of the delimited area of a stylebox. It's useful for giving controls an outline.

member.name: T:Godot.ParallaxBackground
member.summary: A ParallaxBackground uses one or more [ParallaxLayer] child nodes to create a parallax effect. Each [ParallaxLayer] can move at a different speed using [member ParallaxLayer.motion_offset]. This creates an illusion of depth in a 2D game. If not used with a [Camera2D], you must manually calculate the [member scroll_offset].

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollOffset
member.summary: The ParallaxBackground's scroll value. Calculated automatically when using a [Camera2D], but can be used to manually manage scrolling when no camera is present.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollBaseOffset
member.summary: Base position offset of all [ParallaxLayer] children.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollBaseScale
member.summary: Base motion scale of all [ParallaxLayer] children.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollLimitBegin
member.summary: Top left limits for scrolling to begin. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will stop scrolling. Must be lower than [member scroll_limit_end] to work.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollLimitEnd
member.summary: Right bottom limits for scrolling to end. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will stop scrolling. Must be higher than [member scroll_limit_begin] to work.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxBackground.ScrollIgnoreCameraZoom
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] elements in [ParallaxLayer] child aren't affected by the zoom level of the camera.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.SetScrollBaseOffset(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the base offset in pixels of all children [ParallaxLayer] nodes.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.GetScrollBaseOffset
member.summary: Return the base offset.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.SetScrollBaseScale(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the base motion scale of all children [ParallaxLayer] nodes.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.GetScrollBaseScale
member.summary: Return the base motion scale.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.SetLimitBegin(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the left and top limits in pixels for scrolling to begin. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will not continue to scroll. If an axis is greater than or equal to the corresponding axis of limit_end, then it will not limit scrolling for that axis.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.GetLimitBegin
member.summary: Return the beginning limit.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.SetLimitEnd(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the right and bottom limits in pixels for scrolling to end. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will not continue to scroll. If an axis is less than or equal to the corresponding axis of limit_begin, then it will not limit scrolling for that axis.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.GetLimitEnd
member.summary: Return the ending limit.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.SetIgnoreCameraZoom(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set to true for all child [ParallaxLayer] nodes to not be affected by the zoom level of the camera.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxBackground.IsIgnoreCameraZoom
member.summary: Return ignoring camera zoom.

member.name: T:Godot.ParallaxLayer
member.summary: A ParallaxLayer must be the child of a [ParallaxBackground] node. Each ParallaxLayer can be set to move at different speeds relative to the camera movement or the [member ParallaxBackground.scroll_offset] value. This node's children will be affected by its scroll offset.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxLayer.MotionScale
member.summary: Multiplies the ParallaxLayer's motion. If an axis is set to [code]0[/code] it will not scroll.

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxLayer.MotionOffset
member.summary: The ParallaxLayer's offset relative to the parent ParallaxBackground's [member ParallaxBackground.scroll_offset].

member.name: P:Godot.ParallaxLayer.MotionMirroring
member.summary: The ParallaxLayer's [Texture] mirroring. Useful for creating an infinite scrolling background. If an axis is set to [code]0[/code] the [Texture] will not be mirrored. Default value: [code](0, 0)[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxLayer.SetMotionScale(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the motion scale of the ParallaxLayer. If an axis is set to 0 then it will not move at all, it will stick with the camera.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxLayer.GetMotionScale
member.summary: Return the motion scale of the ParallaxLayer.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxLayer.SetMirroring(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the mirroring of the ParallaxLayer. If an axis is set to 0 then that axis will have no mirroring.

member.name: M:Godot.ParallaxLayer.GetMirroring
member.summary: Return the mirroring of the ParallaxLayer.

member.name: T:Godot.Particles
member.summary: 3D particle node used to create a variety of particle systems and effects. [code]Particles[/code] features an emitter that generates some number of particles at a given rate. Use the [code]process_material[/code] property to add a [ParticlesMaterial] to configure particle appearance and behavior. Alternatively, you can add a [ShaderMaterial] which will be applied to all particles.

member.name: F:Godot.Particles.DRAW_ORDER_INDEX
member.summary: Particles are drawn in the order emitted.

member.name: F:Godot.Particles.DRAW_ORDER_LIFETIME
member.summary: Particles are drawn in order of remaining lifetime.

member.name: F:Godot.Particles.DRAW_ORDER_VIEW_DEPTH
member.summary: Particles are drawn in order of depth.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Emitting
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] particles are being emitted. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Amount
member.summary: Number of particles to emit.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Lifetime
member.summary: Amount of time each particle will exist. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.OneShot
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] only [code]amount[/code] particles will be emitted. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.SpeedScale
member.summary: Speed scaling ratio. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Explosiveness
member.summary: Time ratio between each emission. If [code]0[/code] particles are emitted continuously. If [code]1[/code] all particles are emitted simultaneously. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.Randomness
member.summary: Emission randomness ratio. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.LocalCoords
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] particles use the parent node's coordinate space. If [code]false[/code] they use global coordinates. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.DrawOrder
member.summary: Particle draw order. Uses [code]DRAW_ORDER_*[/code] values. Default value: [code]DRAW_ORDER_INDEX[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles.ProcessMaterial
member.summary: [Material] for processing particles. Can be a [ParticlesMaterial] or a [ShaderMaterial].

member.name: T:Godot.Particles2D
member.summary: 2D particle node used to create a variety of particle systems and effects. [code]Particles2D[/code] features an emitter that generates some number of particles at a given rate. Use the [code]process_material[/code] property to add a [ParticlesMaterial] to configure particle appearance and behavior. Alternatively, you can add a [ShaderMaterial] which will be applied to all particles.

member.name: F:Godot.Particles2D.DRAW_ORDER_INDEX
member.summary: Particles are drawn in the order emitted.

member.summary: If [code]true[/code] particles are being emitted. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.summary: Number of particles emitted in one emission cycle.

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.Lifetime
member.summary: Amount of time each particle will exist. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.summary: If [code]true[/code] only one emission cycle occurs. If set [code]true[/code] during a cycle, emission will stop at the cycle's end. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.summary: How rapidly particles in an emission cycle are emitted. If greater than [code]0[/code], there will be a gap in emissions before the next cycle begins. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.summary: Emission lifetime randomness ratio. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.LocalCoords
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] particles use the parent node's coordinate space. If [code]false[/code] they use global coordinates. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.DrawOrder
member.summary: Particle draw order. Uses [code]DRAW_ORDER_*[/code] values. Default value: [code]DRAW_ORDER_INDEX[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Particles2D.ProcessMaterial
member.summary: [Material] for processing particles. Can be a [ParticlesMaterial] or a [ShaderMaterial].

member.summary: ParticlesMaterial defines particle properties and behavior. It is used in the [code]process_material[/code] of [Particles] and [Particles2D] emitter nodes. Some of this material's properties are applied to each particle when emitted, while others can have a [CurveTexture] applied to vary values over the lifetime of the particle.

member.summary: Sets the [Curve3D].

member.summary: Returns the [Curve3D] contained.

member.summary: Can have [PathFollow2D] child-nodes moving along the [Curve2D]. See [PathFollow2D] for more information on this usage.

member.summary: A [Curve2D] describing the path.

member.summary: Sets the [Curve2D].

member.summary: Returns the [Curve2D] contained.

member.name: T:Godot.PathFollow
member.summary: This node takes its parent [Path], and returns the coordinates of a point within it, given a distance from the first vertex. It is useful for making other nodes follow a path, without coding the movement pattern. For that, the nodes must be descendants of this node. Then, when setting an offset in this node, the descendant nodes will move accordingly.

member.name: F:Godot.PathFollow.ROTATION_NONE
member.summary: Forbids the PathFollow to rotate.

member.name: F:Godot.PathFollow.ROTATION_Y
member.summary: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in the Y axis only.

member.name: F:Godot.PathFollow.ROTATION_XY
member.summary: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in both the X, and Y axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PathFollow.ROTATION_XYZ
member.summary: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in any axis.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.SetOffset(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the first vertex, measured in 3D units along the path. This sets this node's position to a point within the path.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.GetOffset
member.summary: Returns the distance along the path in 3D units.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.SetHOffset(System.Single)
member.summary: Moves this node in the X axis. As this node's position will be set every time its offset is set, this allows many PathFollow to share the same curve (and thus the same movement pattern), yet not return the same position for a given path offset. A similar effect may be achieved moving the this node's descendants.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.GetHOffset
member.summary: Returns the X displacement this node has from its parent [Path].

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.SetVOffset(System.Single)
member.summary: Moves this node in the Y axis, for the same reasons of [method set_h_offset].

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.GetVOffset
member.summary: Returns the Y displacement this node has from its parent [Path].

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.SetUnitOffset(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the first vertex, considering 0.0 as the first vertex and 1.0 as the last. This is just another way of expressing the offset within the path, as the offset supplied is multiplied internally by the path's length.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.GetUnitOffset
member.summary: Returns the distance along the path as a number in the range 0.0 (for the first vertex) to 1.0 (for the last).

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.SetRotationMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows or forbids rotation on one or more axes, per the constants below.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.GetRotationMode
member.summary: Returns the rotation mode. The constants below list which axes are allowed to rotate for each mode.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.SetCubicInterpolation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The points along the [Curve3D] of the [Path] are precomputed before use, for faster calculations. The point at the requested offset is then calculated interpolating between two adjacent cached points. This may present a problem if the curve makes sharp turns, as the cached points may not follow the curve closely enough. There are two answers to this problem: Either increase the number of cached points and increase memory consumption, or make a cubic interpolation between two points at the cost of (slightly) slower calculations. This method controls whether the position between two cached points is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.GetCubicInterpolation
member.summary: This method returns whether the position between two cached points (see [method set_cubic_interpolation]) is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.SetLoop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set, any offset outside the path's length (whether set by [method set_offset] or [method set_unit_offset] will wrap around, instead of stopping at the ends. Set it for cyclic paths.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow.HasLoop
member.summary: Returns whether this node wraps its offsets around, or truncates them to the path ends.

member.name: T:Godot.PathFollow2D
member.summary: This node takes its parent [Path2D], and returns the coordinates of a point within it, given a distance from the first vertex. It is useful for making other nodes follow a path, without coding the movement pattern. For that, the nodes must be descendants of this node. Then, when setting an offset in this node, the descendant nodes will move accordingly.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.SetOffset(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the first vertex, measured in pixels along the path. This sets this node's position to a point within the path.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.GetOffset
member.summary: Returns the distance along the path in pixels.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.SetHOffset(System.Single)
member.summary: Moves this node horizontally. As this node's position will be set every time its offset is set, this allows many PathFollow2D to share the same curve (and thus the same movement pattern), yet not return the same position for a given path offset. A similar effect may be achieved moving this node's descendants.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.GetHOffset
member.summary: Returns the horizontal displacement this node has from its parent [Path2D].

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.SetVOffset(System.Single)
member.summary: Moves the PathFollow2D vertically, for the same reasons of [method set_h_offset].

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.GetVOffset
member.summary: Returns the vertical displacement this node has from its parent [Path2D].

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.SetUnitOffset(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the first vertex, considering 0.0 as the first vertex and 1.0 as the last. This is just another way of expressing the offset within the path, as the offset supplied is multiplied internally by the path's length.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.GetUnitOffset
member.summary: Returns the distance along the path as a number in the range 0.0 (for the first vertex) to 1.0 (for the last).

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.SetRotate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set, this node rotates to follow the path, making its descendants rotate.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.IsRotating
member.summary: Returns whether this node rotates to follow the path.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.SetCubicInterpolation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The points along the [Curve2D] of the [Path2D] are precomputed before use, for faster calculations. The point at the requested offset is then calculated interpolating between two adjacent cached points. This may present a problem if the curve makes sharp turns, as the cached points may not follow the curve closely enough. There are two answers to this problem: Either increase the number of cached points and increase memory consumption, or make a cubic interpolation between two points at the cost of (slightly) slower calculations. This method controls whether the position between two cached points is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.GetCubicInterpolation
member.summary: This method returns whether the position between two cached points (see [method set_cubic_interpolation]) is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.SetLoop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set, any offset outside the path's length (whether set by [method set_offset] or [method set_unit_offset] will wrap around, instead of stopping at the ends. Set it for cyclic paths.

member.name: M:Godot.PathFollow2D.HasLoop
member.summary: Returns whether this node wraps its offsets around, or truncates them to the path ends.

member.name: T:Godot.Performance
member.summary: This class provides access to a number of different monitors related to performance, such as memory usage, draw calls, and FPS. These are the same as the values displayed in the [i]Monitor[/i] tab in the editor's [i]Debugger[/i] panel. By using the [method get_monitor] method of this class, you can access this data from your code. Note that a few of these monitors are only available in debug mode and will always return 0 when used in a release build. Many of these monitors are not updated in real-time, so there may be a short delay between changes.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.TIME_FPS
member.summary: Frames per second.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.TIME_PROCESS
member.summary: Time it took to complete one frame.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.TIME_PHYSICS_PROCESS
member.summary: Time it took to complete one physics frame.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.MEMORY_STATIC
member.summary: Static memory currently used, in bytes. Not available in release builds.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.MEMORY_DYNAMIC
member.summary: Dynamic memory currently used, in bytes. Not available in release builds.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.MEMORY_STATIC_MAX
member.summary: Available static memory. Not available in release builds.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.MEMORY_DYNAMIC_MAX
member.summary: Available dynamic memory. Not available in release builds.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.MEMORY_MESSAGE_BUFFER_MAX
member.summary: Largest amount of memory the message queue buffer has used, in bytes. The message queue is used for deferred functions calls and notifications.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.OBJECT_COUNT
member.summary: Number of objects currently instanced (including nodes).

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.OBJECT_RESOURCE_COUNT
member.summary: Number of resources currently used.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.OBJECT_NODE_COUNT
member.summary: Number of nodes currently instanced. This also includes the root node, as well as any nodes not in the scene tree.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.RENDER_OBJECTS_IN_FRAME
member.summary: 3D objects drawn per frame.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.RENDER_VERTICES_IN_FRAME
member.summary: Vertices drawn per frame. 3D only.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.RENDER_MATERIAL_CHANGES_IN_FRAME
member.summary: Material changes per frame. 3D only

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.RENDER_SHADER_CHANGES_IN_FRAME
member.summary: Shader changes per frame. 3D only.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.RENDER_SURFACE_CHANGES_IN_FRAME
member.summary: Render surface changes per frame. 3D only.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.RENDER_DRAW_CALLS_IN_FRAME
member.summary: Draw calls per frame. 3D only.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.RENDER_VIDEO_MEM_USED
member.summary: Video memory used. Includes both texture and vertex memory.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.RENDER_TEXTURE_MEM_USED
member.summary: Texture memory used.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.RENDER_VERTEX_MEM_USED
member.summary: Vertex memory used.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.PHYSICS_2D_ACTIVE_OBJECTS
member.summary: Number of active [RigidBody2D] nodes in the game.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.PHYSICS_2D_COLLISION_PAIRS
member.summary: Number of collision pairs in the 2D physics engine.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.PHYSICS_2D_ISLAND_COUNT
member.summary: Number of islands in the 2D physics engine.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.PHYSICS_3D_ACTIVE_OBJECTS
member.summary: Number of active [RigidBody] and [VehicleBody] nodes in the game.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.PHYSICS_3D_COLLISION_PAIRS
member.summary: Number of collision pairs in the 3D physics engine.

member.name: F:Godot.Performance.PHYSICS_3D_ISLAND_COUNT
member.summary: Number of islands in the 3D physics engine.

member.name: M:Godot.Performance.GetMonitor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value of one of the available monitors. You should provide one of this class's constants as the argument, like this: [codeblock] print(Performance.get_monitor(Performance.TIME_FPS)) # Prints the FPS to the console [/codeblock]

member.name: T:Godot.PHashTranslation
member.summary: Optimized translation. Uses real-time compressed translations, which results in very small dictionaries.

member.name: T:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState
member.summary: Direct access object to a physics body in the [Physics2DServer]. This object is passed via the direct state callback of rigid/character bodies, and is intended for changing the direct state of that body.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetTotalGravity
member.summary: Return the total gravity vector being currently applied to this body.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetTotalLinearDamp
member.summary: Return the rate at which the body stops moving, if there are not any other forces moving it.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetTotalAngularDamp
member.summary: Return the rate at which the body stops rotating, if there are not any other forces moving it.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetInverseMass
member.summary: Return the inverse of the mass of the body.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetInverseInertia
member.summary: Return the inverse of the inertia of the body.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.SetLinearVelocity(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Change the linear velocity of the body.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetLinearVelocity

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.SetAngularVelocity(System.Single)
member.summary: Change the angular velocity of the body.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetAngularVelocity

member.summary: Set the sleeping state of the body, only affects character/rigid bodies.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.IsSleeping
member.summary: Return true if this body is currently sleeping (not active).

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetContactCount
member.summary: Return the amount of contacts this body has with other bodies. Note that by default this returns 0 unless bodies are configured to log contacts.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState.GetContactLocalPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the local position (of this body) of the contact point.

member.summary: Call the built-in force integration code.

member.summary: Return the current state of space, useful for queries.

member.name: T:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState
member.summary: Direct access object to a space in the [Physics2DServer]. It's used mainly to do queries against objects and areas residing in a given space.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY
member.summary: Check for collisions with static bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY
member.summary: Check for collisions with kinematic bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_RIGID_BODY
member.summary: Check for collisions with rigid bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_CHARACTER_BODY
member.summary: Check for collisions with rigid bodies in character mode.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_COLLISION
member.summary: Check for collisions with any kind of bodies (but not areas).

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_AREA
member.summary: Check for collisions with areas.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.IntersectPoint(Godot.Vector2,System.Int32,System.Object[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check whether a point is inside any shape. The shapes the point is inside of are returned in an array containing dictionaries with the following fields: shape: Shape index within the object the point is in. metadata: Metadata of the shape the point is in. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object the point is in. collider: Object the point is inside of. rid: [RID] of the object the point is in. Additionally, the method can take an array of objects or [RID]s that are to be excluded from collisions, a bitmask representing the physics layers to check in, and another bitmask for the types of objects to check (see TYPE_MASK_* constants). <param name="exclude">If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.IntersectRay(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2,System.Object[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Intersect a ray in a given space. The returned object is a dictionary with the following fields: position: Place where ray is stopped. normal: Normal of the object at the point where the ray was stopped. shape: Shape index within the object against which the ray was stopped. metadata: Metadata of the shape against which the ray was stopped. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object against which the ray was stopped. collider: Object against which the ray was stopped. rid: [RID] of the object against which the ray was stopped. If the ray did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary (dir.empty()==true) is returned instead. Additionally, the method can take an array of objects or [RID]s that are to be excluded from collisions, a bitmask representing the physics layers to check in, and another bitmask for the types of objects to check (see TYPE_MASK_* constants). <param name="exclude">If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.IntersectShape(Godot.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. The intersected shapes are returned in an array containing dictionaries with the following fields: shape: Shape index within the object the shape intersected. metadata: Metadata of the shape intersected by the shape given through the [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters]. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object the shape intersected. collider: Object the shape intersected. rid: [RID] of the object the shape intersected. The number of intersections can be limited with the second parameter, to reduce the processing time.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.CastMotion(Godot.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters)
member.summary: Check whether the shape can travel to a point. If it can, the method will return an array with two floats: The first is the distance the shape can move in that direction without colliding, and the second is the distance at which it will collide. If the shape can not move, the array will be empty.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.CollideShape(Godot.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters,System.Int32)
member.summary: Check the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. The resulting array contains a list of points where the shape intersects another. Like with [method intersect_shape], the number of returned results can be limited to save processing time.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DDirectSpaceState.GetRestInfo(Godot.Physics2DShapeQueryParameters)
member.summary: Check the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. If it collides with more than a shape, the nearest one is selected. The returned object is a dictionary containing the following fields: pointo: Place where the shapes intersect. normal: Normal of the object at the point where the shapes intersect. shape: Shape index within the object against which the shape intersected. metadata: Metadata of the shape against which the shape intersected. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object against which the shape intersected. collider: Object against which the shape intersected. rid: [RID] of the object against which the shape intersected. linear_velocity: The movement vector of the object the shape intersected, if it was a body. If it was an area, it is (0,0). If the shape did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary (dir.empty()==true) is returned instead.

member.name: T:Godot.Physics2DServer
member.summary: Physics 2D Server is the server responsible for all 2D physics. It can create many kinds of physics objects, but does not insert them on the node tree.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_CONTACT_RECYCLE_RADIUS
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a pair of bodies has to move before their collision status has to be recalculated.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_CONTACT_MAX_SEPARATION
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can be from another before they are considered separated.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_MAX_ALLOWED_PENETRATION
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can penetrate another shape before it is considered a collision.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_LINEAR_VELOCITY_SLEEP_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Constant to set/get the threshold linear velocity of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after the time given.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_ANGULAR_VELOCITY_SLEEP_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Constant to set/get the threshold angular velocity of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after the time given.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_TIME_TO_SLEEP
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum time of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after this time.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SPACE_PARAM_CONSTRAINT_DEFAULT_BIAS
member.summary: Constant to set/get the default solver bias for all physics constraints. A solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound", after violating a constraint, to avoid leaving them in that state because of numerical imprecision.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_LINE
member.summary: This is the constant for creating line shapes. A line shape is an infinite line with an origin point, and a normal. Thus, it can be used for front/behind checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_SEGMENT
member.summary: This is the constant for creating segment shapes. A segment shape is a line from a point A to a point B. It can be checked for intersections.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CIRCLE
member.summary: This is the constant for creating circle shapes. A circle shape only has a radius. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_RECTANGLE
member.summary: This is the constant for creating rectangle shapes. A rectangle shape is defined by a width and a height. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CAPSULE
member.summary: This is the constant for creating capsule shapes. A capsule shape is defined by a radius and a length. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CONVEX_POLYGON
member.summary: This is the constant for creating convex polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks. Unlike the method [method CollisionPolygon2D.set_polygon], polygons modified with [method shape_set_data] do not verify that the points supplied form is a convex polygon.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CONCAVE_POLYGON
member.summary: This is the constant for creating concave polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections checks, but not for inside/outside checks.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.SHAPE_CUSTOM
member.summary: This constant is used internally by the engine. Any attempt to create this kind of shape results in an error.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity strength in an area.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_VECTOR
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity vector/center in an area.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_IS_POINT
member.summary: Constant to set/get whether the gravity vector of an area is a direction, or a center point.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE
member.summary: Constant to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity of an area. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_POINT_ATTENUATION
member.summary: This constant was used to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity. It has been superseded by AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_LINEAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get the linear dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_ANGULAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get the angular dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_PARAM_PRIORITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get the priority (order of processing) of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED
member.summary: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BODY_MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Constant for static bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BODY_MODE_KINEMATIC
member.summary: Constant for kinematic bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BODY_MODE_RIGID

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.BODY_MODE_CHARACTER

member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's linear dampening factor.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.JOINT_GROOVE
member.summary: Constant to create groove joints.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.JOINT_DAMPED_SPRING
member.summary: Constant to create damped spring joints.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.DAMPED_STRING_REST_LENGTH
member.summary: Set the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.DAMPED_STRING_STIFFNESS
member.summary: Set the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.DAMPED_STRING_DAMPING
member.summary: Set the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.CCD_MODE_DISABLED
member.summary: Disables continuous collision detection. This is the fastest way to detect body collisions, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.CCD_MODE_CAST_RAY
member.summary: Enables continuous collision detection by raycasting. It is faster than shapecasting, but less precise.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.CCD_MODE_CAST_SHAPE
member.summary: Enables continuous collision detection by shapecasting. It is the slowest CCD method, and the most precise.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_BODY_ADDED
member.summary: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object enters one of its shapes.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.AREA_BODY_REMOVED
member.summary: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object exits one of its shapes.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.INFO_ACTIVE_OBJECTS
member.summary: Constant to get the number of objects that are not sleeping.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.INFO_COLLISION_PAIRS
member.summary: Constant to get the number of possible collisions.

member.name: F:Godot.Physics2DServer.INFO_ISLAND_COUNT
member.summary: Constant to get the number of space regions where a collision could occur.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeCreate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a shape of type SHAPE_*. Does not assign it to a body or an area. To do so, you must use [method area_set_shape] or [method body_set_shape].

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeSetData(Godot.RID,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the shape data that defines its shape and size. The data to be passed depends on the kind of shape created [method shape_get_type].

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeGetType(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the type of shape (see SHAPE_* constants).

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.ShapeGetData(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the shape data.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceCreate
member.summary: Creates a space. A space is a collection of parameters for the physics engine that can be assigned to an area or a body. It can be assigned to an area with [method area_set_space], or to a body with [method body_set_space].

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceSetActive(Godot.RID,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Marks a space as active. It will not have an effect, unless it is assigned to an area or body.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceIsActive(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns whether the space is active.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceSetParam(Godot.RID,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the value for a space parameter. A list of available parameters is on the SPACE_PARAM_* constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceGetParam(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value of a space parameter.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.SpaceGetDirectState(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the state of a space, a [Physics2DDirectSpaceState]. This object can be used to make collision/intersection queries.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaCreate
member.summary: Creates an [Area2D].

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSetSpace(Godot.RID,Godot.RID)
member.summary: Assigns a space to the area.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaGetSpace(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the space assigned to the area.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSetSpaceOverrideMode(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the space override mode for the area. The modes are described in the constants AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_*.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaGetSpaceOverrideMode(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the space override mode for the area.

member.summary: Adds a shape to the area, along with a transform matrix. Shapes are usually referenced by their index, so you should track which shape has a given index. <param name="transform">If the param is null, then the default value is Transform2D.Identity</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSetShape(Godot.RID,System.Int32,Godot.RID)
member.summary: Substitutes a given area shape by another. The old shape is selected by its index, the new one by its [RID].

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSetShapeTransform(Godot.RID,System.Int32,Godot.Transform2D)
member.summary: Sets the transform matrix for an area shape.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSetShapeDisabled(Godot.RID,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disables a given shape in this area if [code]disable is true[/code]

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaGetShapeCount(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the number of shapes assigned to an area.

member.summary: Returns the [RID] of the nth shape of an area.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaGetShapeTransform(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the transform matrix of a shape within an area.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaRemoveShape(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a shape from an area. It does not delete the shape, so it can be reassigned later.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaClearShapes(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Removes all shapes from an area. It does not delete the shapes, so they can be reassigned later.

member.summary: Assigns the area to one or many physics layers.

member.summary: Sets which physics layers the area will monitor.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSetParam(Godot.RID,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the value for an area parameter. A list of available parameters is on the AREA_PARAM_* constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSetTransform(Godot.RID,Godot.Transform2D)
member.summary: Sets the transform matrix for an area.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaGetParam(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an area parameter value. A list of available parameters is on the AREA_PARAM_* constants.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaGetTransform(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the transform matrix for an area.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaAttachObjectInstanceId(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Assigns the area to a descendant of [Object], so it can exist in the node tree.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaGetObjectInstanceId(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Gets the instance ID of the object the area is assigned to.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.AreaSetMonitorCallback(Godot.RID,Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the function to call when any body/area enters or exits the area. This callback will be called for any object interacting with the area, and takes five parameters: 1: AREA_BODY_ADDED or AREA_BODY_REMOVED, depending on whether the object entered or exited the area. 2: [RID] of the object that entered/exited the area. 3: Instance ID of the object that entered/exited the area. 4: The shape index of the object that entered/exited the area. 5: The shape index of the area where the object entered/exited.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyCreate(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a physics body. The first parameter can be any value from constants BODY_MODE*, for the type of body created. Additionally, the body can be created in sleeping state to save processing time.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyGetSpace(Godot.RID)

member.summary: Sets a body state (see BODY_STATE* constants).

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyApplyImpulse(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Adds a positioned impulse to the applied force and torque. Both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyAddForce(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Adds a positioned force to the applied force and torque. As with [method body_apply_impulse], both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates. A force differs from an impulse in that, while the two are forces, the impulse clears itself after being applied.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodySetAxisVelocity(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyAddCollisionException(Godot.RID,Godot.RID)
member.summary: Adds a body to the list of bodies exempt from collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyRemoveCollisionException(Godot.RID,Godot.RID)
member.summary: Removes a body from the list of bodies exempt from collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodySetMaxContactsReported(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyGetMaxContactsReported(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method body_set_max_contacts_reported].

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodySetOmitForceIntegration(Godot.RID,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether a body uses a callback function to calculate its own physics (see [method body_set_force_integration_callback]).

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyIsOmittingForceIntegration(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns whether a body uses a callback function to calculate its own physics (see [method body_set_force_integration_callback]).

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodySetForceIntegrationCallback(Godot.RID,Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the function used to calculate physics for an object, if that object allows it (see [method body_set_omit_force integration]).

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyTestMotion(Godot.RID,Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Vector2,System.Single,Godot.Physics2DTestMotionResult)
member.summary: Returns whether a body can move from a given point in a given direction. Apart from the boolean return value, a [Physics2DTestMotionResult] can be passed to return additional information in.

member.name: M:Godot.Physics2DServer.BodyGetDirectState(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the [Physics2DDirectBodyState] of the body.

member.summary: Destroys any of the objects created by Physics2DServer. If the [RID] passed is not one of the objects that can be created by Physics2DServer, an error will be sent to the console.
