member.name: T:Godot.PhysicsBody
member.summary: PhysicsBody is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All *Body types inherit from it.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsBody.CollisionLayer
member.summary: The physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers work like a tagging system, and are not visual. A collidable can use these layers to select with which objects it can collide, using the collision_mask property. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsBody.CollisionMask
member.summary: The physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody.AddCollisionExceptionWith(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Adds a body to the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody.RemoveCollisionExceptionWith(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Removes a body from the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

member.name: T:Godot.PhysicsBody2D
member.summary: PhysicsBody2D is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All *Body2D types inherit from it.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.Layers
member.summary: Both collision_layer and collision_mask. Returns collision_layer when accessed. Updates collision_layers and collision_mask when modified.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.CollisionLayer
member.summary: The physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers work like a tagging system, and are not visual. A collidable can use these layers to select with which objects it can collide, using the collision_mask property. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

member.name: P:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.CollisionMask
member.summary: The physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.SetCollisionLayer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers are not visual, but more of a tagging system instead. A collidable can use these layers/tags to select with which objects it can collide, using [method set_collision_mask]. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.GetCollisionLayer
member.summary: Return the physics layer this area is in.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.SetCollisionMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.GetCollisionMask
member.summary: Return the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.SetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set/clear individual bits on the collision mask. This makes selecting the areas scanned easier.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.GetCollisionMaskBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.SetCollisionLayerBit(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set/clear individual bits on the layer mask. This makes getting a body in/out of only one layer easier.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.GetCollisionLayerBit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.AddCollisionExceptionWith(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Adds a body to the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsBody2D.RemoveCollisionExceptionWith(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Removes a body from the list of bodies that this body can't collide with.

member.name: T:Godot.PhysicsServer
member.summary: Everything related to physics in 3D.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.JOINT_PIN
member.summary: The [Joint] is a [PinJoint].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.JOINT_HINGE
member.summary: The [Joint] is a [HingeJoint].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.JOINT_SLIDER
member.summary: The [Joint] is a [SliderJoint].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.JOINT_CONE_TWIST
member.summary: The [Joint] is a [ConeTwistJoint].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.JOINT_6DOF
member.summary: The [Joint] is a [Generic6DOFJoint].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.PIN_JOINT_BIAS
member.summary: The strength with which the pinned objects try to stay in positional relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.PIN_JOINT_DAMPING
member.summary: The strength with which the pinned objects try to stay in velocity relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.PIN_JOINT_IMPULSE_CLAMP
member.summary: If above 0, this value is the maximum value for an impulse that this Joint puts on it's ends.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.HINGE_JOINT_BIAS
member.summary: The speed with wich the two bodies get pulled together when they move in different directions.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.HINGE_JOINT_LIMIT_UPPER
member.summary: The maximum rotation across the Hinge.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.HINGE_JOINT_LIMIT_LOWER
member.summary: The minimum rotation across the Hinge.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.HINGE_JOINT_LIMIT_BIAS
member.summary: The speed with which the rotation across the axis perpendicular to the hinge gets corrected.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.HINGE_JOINT_LIMIT_RELAXATION
member.summary: The lower this value, the more the rotation gets slowed down.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.HINGE_JOINT_MOTOR_TARGET_VELOCITY
member.summary: Target speed for the motor.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.HINGE_JOINT_MOTOR_MAX_IMPULSE
member.summary: Maximum acceleration for the motor.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.HINGE_JOINT_FLAG_USE_LIMIT
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the Hinge has a maximum and a minimum rotation.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.HINGE_JOINT_FLAG_ENABLE_MOTOR
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] a motor turns the Hinge

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_LIMIT_UPPER
member.summary: The maximum difference between the pivot points on their x-axis before damping happens.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_LIMIT_LOWER
member.summary: The minimum difference between the pivot points on their x-axis before damping happens.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_LIMIT_SOFTNESS
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement accross the slider axis once the limits get surpassed. The lower, the slower the movement.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_LIMIT_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of restitution once the limits are surpassed. The lower, the more velocityenergy gets lost.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_LIMIT_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of damping once the slider limits are surpassed.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_MOTION_SOFTNESS
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement accross the slider axis as long as the slider is in the limits. The lower, the slower the movement.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_MOTION_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of restitution inside the slider limits.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_MOTION_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of damping inside the slider limits.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_ORTHOGONAL_SOFTNESS
member.summary: A factor applied to the movement accross axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_ORTHOGONAL_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of restitution when movement is accross axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_LINEAR_ORTHOGONAL_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of damping when movement is accross axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_LIMIT_UPPER
member.summary: The upper limit of rotation in the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_LIMIT_LOWER
member.summary: The lower limit of rotation in the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_LIMIT_SOFTNESS
member.summary: A factor applied to the all rotation once the limit is surpassed.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_LIMIT_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of restitution of the rotation when the limit is surpassed.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_LIMIT_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of damping of the rotation when the limit is surpassed.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_MOTION_SOFTNESS
member.summary: A factor that gets applied to the all rotation in the limits.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_MOTION_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of restitution of the rotation in the limits.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_MOTION_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of damping of the rotation in the limits.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_ORTHOGONAL_SOFTNESS
member.summary: A factor that gets applied to the all rotation across axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_ORTHOGONAL_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of restitution of the rotation across axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_ANGULAR_ORTHOGONAL_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of damping of the rotation across axes orthogonal to the slider.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SLIDER_JOINT_MAX
member.summary: End flag of SLIDER_JOINT_* constants, used internally.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.CONE_TWIST_JOINT_SWING_SPAN
member.summary: Swing is rotation from side to side, around the axis perpendicular to the twist axis. The swing span defines, how much rotation will not get corrected allong the swing axis. Could be defined as looseness in the [ConeTwistJoint]. If below 0.05, this behaviour is locked. Default value: [code]PI/4[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.CONE_TWIST_JOINT_TWIST_SPAN
member.summary: Twist is the rotation around the twist axis, this value defined how far the joint can twist. Twist is locked if below 0.05.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.CONE_TWIST_JOINT_BIAS
member.summary: The speed with which the swing or twist will take place. The higher, the faster.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.CONE_TWIST_JOINT_SOFTNESS
member.summary: The ease with which the Joint twists, if it's too low, it takes more force to twist the joint.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.CONE_TWIST_JOINT_RELAXATION
member.summary: Defines, how fast the swing- and twist-speed-difference on both sides gets synced.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_LINEAR_LOWER_LIMIT
member.summary: The minimum difference between the pivot points' axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_LINEAR_UPPER_LIMIT
member.summary: The maximum difference between the pivot points' axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_LINEAR_LIMIT_SOFTNESS
member.summary: A factor that gets applied to the movement accross the axes. The lower, the slower the movement.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_LINEAR_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of restitution on the axes movement. The lower, the more velocity-energy gets lost.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_LINEAR_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of damping that happens at the linear motion across the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_ANGULAR_LOWER_LIMIT
member.summary: The minimum rotation in negative direction to break loose and rotate arround the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_ANGULAR_UPPER_LIMIT
member.summary: The minimum rotation in positive direction to break loose and rotate arround the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_ANGULAR_LIMIT_SOFTNESS
member.summary: A factor that gets multiplied onto all rotations accross the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_ANGULAR_DAMPING
member.summary: The amount of rotational damping accross the axes. The lower, the more dampening occurs.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_ANGULAR_RESTITUTION
member.summary: The amount of rotational restitution accross the axes. The lower, the more restitution occurs.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_ANGULAR_FORCE_LIMIT
member.summary: The maximum amount of force that can occur, when rotating arround the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_ANGULAR_ERP
member.summary: When correcting the crossing of limits in rotation accross the axes, this error tolerance factor defines how much the correction gets slowed down. The lower, the slower.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_ANGULAR_MOTOR_TARGET_VELOCITY
member.summary: Target speed for the motor at the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_ANGULAR_MOTOR_FORCE_LIMIT
member.summary: Maximum acceleration for the motor at the axes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_FLAG_ENABLE_LINEAR_LIMIT
member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is linear motion possible within the given limits.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_FLAG_ENABLE_ANGULAR_LIMIT
member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is rotational motion possible.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.G6DOF_JOINT_FLAG_ENABLE_MOTOR
member.summary: If [code]set[/code] there is a rotational motor across these axes.

member.summary: The [Shape] is a [PlaneShape].

member.summary: The [Shape] is a [RayShape].

member.summary: The [Shape] is a [SphereShape].

member.summary: The [Shape] is a [BoxShape].

member.summary: The [Shape] is a [CapsuleShape].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SHAPE_CONVEX_POLYGON
member.summary: The [Shape] is a [ConvexPolygonShape].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SHAPE_CONCAVE_POLYGON
member.summary: The [Shape] is a [ConcavePolygonShape].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SHAPE_HEIGHTMAP
member.summary: The [Shape] is a [HeightMapShape].

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SHAPE_CUSTOM
member.summary: This constant is used internally by the engine. Any attempt to create this kind of shape results in an error.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity strength in an area.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_VECTOR
member.summary: Constant to set/get gravity vector/center in an area.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_IS_POINT
member.summary: Constant to set/get whether the gravity vector of an area is a direction, or a center point.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE
member.summary: Constant to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity of an area. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_POINT_ATTENUATION
member.summary: This constant was used to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity. It has been superseded by AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_PARAM_LINEAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get the linear dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_PARAM_ANGULAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get the angular dampening factor of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_PARAM_PRIORITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get the priority (order of processing) of an area.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED
member.summary: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE
member.summary: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE
member.summary: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Constant for static bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_MODE_KINEMATIC
member.summary: Constant for kinematic bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_MODE_RIGID
member.summary: Constant for rigid bodies.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_MODE_CHARACTER
member.summary: Constant for rigid bodies in character mode. In this mode, a body can not rotate, and only its linear velocity is affected by physics.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_PARAM_BOUNCE
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's bounce factor.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_PARAM_FRICTION
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's friction.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_PARAM_MASS
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's mass.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_PARAM_GRAVITY_SCALE
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's gravity multiplier.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_PARAM_LINEAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's linear dampening factor.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_PARAM_ANGULAR_DAMP
member.summary: Constant to set/get a body's angular dampening factor.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_PARAM_MAX
member.summary: This is the last ID for body parameters. Any attempt to set this property is ignored. Any attempt to get it returns 0.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_STATE_TRANSFORM
member.summary: Constant to set/get the current transform matrix of the body.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_STATE_LINEAR_VELOCITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get the current linear velocity of the body.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_STATE_ANGULAR_VELOCITY
member.summary: Constant to set/get the current angular velocity of the body.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_STATE_SLEEPING
member.summary: Constant to sleep/wake up a body, or to get whether it is sleeping.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_STATE_CAN_SLEEP
member.summary: Constant to set/get whether the body can sleep.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_BODY_ADDED
member.summary: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object enters one of its shapes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.AREA_BODY_REMOVED
member.summary: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object exits one of its shapes.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.INFO_ACTIVE_OBJECTS
member.summary: Constant to get the number of objects that are not sleeping.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.INFO_COLLISION_PAIRS
member.summary: Constant to get the number of possible collisions.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.INFO_ISLAND_COUNT
member.summary: Constant to get the number of space regions where a collision could occur.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SPACE_PARAM_CONTACT_RECYCLE_RADIUS
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a pair of bodies has to move before their collision status has to be recalculated.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SPACE_PARAM_CONTACT_MAX_SEPARATION
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can be from another before they are considered separated.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_MAX_ALLOWED_PENETRATION
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can penetrate another shape before it is considered a collision.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_LINEAR_VELOCITY_SLEEP_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Constant to set/get the threshold linear velocity of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after the time given.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_ANGULAR_VELOCITY_SLEEP_THRESHOLD
member.summary: Constant to set/get the threshold angular velocity of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after the time given.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SPACE_PARAM_BODY_TIME_TO_SLEEP
member.summary: Constant to set/get the maximum time of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after this time.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.SPACE_PARAM_CONSTRAINT_DEFAULT_BIAS
member.summary: Constant to set/get the default solver bias for all physics constraints. A solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound", after violating a constraint, to avoid leaving them in that state because of numerical imprecision.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_AXIS_LOCK_DISABLED
member.summary: The [Body] can rotate and move freely.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_AXIS_LOCK_X
member.summary: The [Body] cannot move across x axis can only rotate across x axis.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_AXIS_LOCK_Y
member.summary: The [Body] cannot move across y axis can only rotate across y axis.

member.name: F:Godot.PhysicsServer.BODY_AXIS_LOCK_Z
member.summary: The [Body] cannot move across z axis can only rotate across z axis.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.ShapeCreate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a shape of type SHAPE_*. Does not assign it to a body or an area. To do so, you must use [method area_set_shape] or [method body_set_shape].

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.ShapeSetData(Godot.RID,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the shape data that defines its shape and size. The data to be passed depends on the kind of shape created [method shape_get_type].

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.ShapeGetType(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the type of shape (see SHAPE_* constants).

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.ShapeGetData(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the shape data.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceCreate
member.summary: Creates a space. A space is a collection of parameters for the physics engine that can be assigned to an area or a body. It can be assigned to an area with [method area_set_space], or to a body with [method body_set_space].

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceSetActive(Godot.RID,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Marks a space as active. It will not have an effect, unless it is assigned to an area or body.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceIsActive(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns whether the space is active.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceSetParam(Godot.RID,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the value for a space parameter. A list of available parameters is on the SPACE_PARAM_* constants.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceGetParam(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value of a space parameter.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.SpaceGetDirectState(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the state of a space, a [PhysicsDirectSpaceState]. This object can be used to make collision/intersection queries.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaCreate
member.summary: Creates an [Area].

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetSpace(Godot.RID,Godot.RID)
member.summary: Assigns a space to the area.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaGetSpace(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the space assigned to the area.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetSpaceOverrideMode(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the space override mode for the area. The modes are described in the constants AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_*.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaGetSpaceOverrideMode(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the space override mode for the area.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaAddShape(Godot.RID,Godot.RID,System.Nullable{Godot.Transform})
member.summary: Adds a shape to the area, along with a transform matrix. Shapes are usually referenced by their index, so you should track which shape has a given index. <param name="transform">If the param is null, then the default value is new Transform()</param>

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetShape(Godot.RID,System.Int32,Godot.RID)
member.summary: Substitutes a given area shape by another. The old shape is selected by its index, the new one by its [RID].

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetShapeTransform(Godot.RID,System.Int32,Godot.Transform)
member.summary: Sets the transform matrix for an area shape.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaGetShapeCount(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the number of shapes assigned to an area.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaGetShape(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the [RID] of the nth shape of an area.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaGetShapeTransform(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the transform matrix of a shape within an area.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaRemoveShape(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a shape from an area. It does not delete the shape, so it can be reassigned later.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaClearShapes(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Removes all shapes from an area. It does not delete the shapes, so they can be reassigned later.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetCollisionLayer(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Assigns the area to one or many physics layers.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetCollisionMask(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets which physics layers the area will monitor.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetParam(Godot.RID,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the value for an area parameter. A list of available parameters is on the AREA_PARAM_* constants.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetTransform(Godot.RID,Godot.Transform)
member.summary: Sets the transform matrix for an area.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaGetParam(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an area parameter value. A list of available parameters is on the AREA_PARAM_* constants.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaGetTransform(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the transform matrix for an area.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaAttachObjectInstanceId(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Assigns the area to a descendant of [Object], so it can exist in the node tree.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaGetObjectInstanceId(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Gets the instance ID of the object the area is assigned to.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetMonitorCallback(Godot.RID,Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the function to call when any body/area enters or exits the area. This callback will be called for any object interacting with the area, and takes five parameters: 1: AREA_BODY_ADDED or AREA_BODY_REMOVED, depending on whether the object entered or exited the area. 2: [RID] of the object that entered/exited the area. 3: Instance ID of the object that entered/exited the area. 4: The shape index of the object that entered/exited the area. 5: The shape index of the area where the object entered/exited.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaSetRayPickable(Godot.RID,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets object pickable with rays.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.AreaIsRayPickable(Godot.RID)
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] area collides with rays.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyCreate(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a physics body. The first parameter can be any value from constants BODY_MODE*, for the type of body created. Additionally, the body can be created in sleeping state to save processing time.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetSpace(Godot.RID,Godot.RID)
member.summary: Assigns a space to the body (see [method create_space]).

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyGetSpace(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the [RID] of the space assigned to a body.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetMode(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the body mode, from one of the constants BODY_MODE*.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyGetMode(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the body mode.

member.summary: Sets the physics layer or layers a body belongs to.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyGetCollisionLayer(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the physics layer or layers a body belongs to.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetCollisionMask(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the physics layer or layers a body can collide with.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyGetCollisionMask(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the physics layer or layers a body can collide with. -

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetShape(Godot.RID,System.Int32,Godot.RID)

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetShapeTransform(Godot.RID,System.Int32,Godot.Transform)
member.summary: Sets the transform matrix for a body shape.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyGetShapeCount(Godot.RID)

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetEnableContinuousCollisionDetection(Godot.RID,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the continuous collision detection mode is enabled. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyIsContinuousCollisionDetectionEnabled(Godot.RID)
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the continuous collision detection mode is enabled.

member.summary: Sets a body parameter. A list of available parameters is on the BODY_PARAM_* constants.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyGetParam(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value of a body parameter. A list of available parameters is on the BODY_PARAM_* constants.

member.summary: Sets a body state (see BODY_STATE* constants).

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyGetState(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a body state.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyApplyTorqueImpulse(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Gives the body a push to rotate it.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetAxisVelocity(Godot.RID,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetAxisLock(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Locks velocity along one axis to 0 and only allows rotation along this axis, can also be set to disabled which disables this functionality.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyGetAxisLock(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Gets the information, which Axis is locked if any. The can be any calue from the constants BODY_AXIS_LOCK*

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyAddCollisionException(Godot.RID,Godot.RID)
member.summary: Adds a body to the list of bodies exempt from collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyRemoveCollisionException(Godot.RID,Godot.RID)
member.summary: Removes a body from the list of bodies exempt from collisions. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetMaxContactsReported(Godot.RID,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyGetMaxContactsReported(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method body_set_max_contacts_reported].

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodyIsOmittingForceIntegration(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Returns whether a body uses a callback function to calculate its own physics (see [method body_set_force_integration_callback]).

member.name: M:Godot.PhysicsServer.BodySetForceIntegrationCallback(Godot.RID,Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the function used to calculate physics for an object, if that object allows it (see [method body_set_omit_force integration]).

member.name: T:Godot.PinJoint
member.summary: Pin Joint for 3D Rigid Bodies. It pins 2 bodies (rigid or static) together.

member.name: F:Godot.PinJoint.PARAM_BIAS
member.summary: The force with wich the pinned objects stay in positional relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.

member.name: F:Godot.PinJoint.PARAM_DAMPING
member.summary: The force with wich the pinned objects stay in velocity relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.

member.name: F:Godot.PinJoint.PARAM_IMPULSE_CLAMP
member.summary: If above 0, this value is the maximum value for an impulse that this Joint produces.

member.name: P:Godot.PinJoint.Params__bias
member.summary: The force with wich the pinned objects stay in positional relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.

member.name: P:Godot.PinJoint.Params__damping
member.summary: The force with wich the pinned objects stay in velocity relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.

member.name: P:Godot.PinJoint.Params__impulseClamp
member.summary: If above 0, this value is the maximum value for an impulse that this Joint produces.

member.name: T:Godot.PinJoint2D
member.summary: Pin Joint for 2D Rigid Bodies. It pins 2 bodies (rigid or static) together, or a single body to a fixed position in space.

member.name: P:Godot.PinJoint2D.Softness
member.summary: The higher this value, the more the bond to the pinned partner can flex.

member.name: T:Godot.PlaneMesh
member.summary: Class representing a planar [PrimitiveMesh]. This flat mesh does not have a thickness.

member.name: P:Godot.PlaneMesh.Size
member.summary: Size of the generated plane. Defaults to (2.0, 2.0).

member.name: P:Godot.PlaneMesh.SubdivideWidth
member.summary: Number of subdivision along the x-axis. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Godot.PlaneMesh.SubdivideDepth
member.summary: Number of subdivision along the z-axis. Defaults to 0.

member.name: T:Godot.Polygon2D
member.summary: A Polygon2D is defined by a set of points. Each point is connected to the next, with the final point being connected to the first, resulting in a closed polygon. Polygon2Ds can be filled with color (solid or gradient) or filled with a given texture.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Polygon
member.summary: The polygon's list of vertices. The final point will be connected to the first.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Uv
member.summary: Texture coordinates for each vertex of the polygon. There should be one [code]uv[/code] per polygon vertex. If there are fewer, undefined vertices will use [code](0, 0)[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Color
member.summary: The polygon's fill color. If [code]texture[/code] is defined, it will be multiplied by this color. It will also be the default color for vertices not set in [code]vertex_colors[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.VertexColors
member.summary: Color for each vertex. Colors are interpolated between vertices, resulting in smooth gradients. There should be one per polygon vertex. If there are fewer, undefined vertices will use [code]color[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Offset
member.summary: The offset applied to each vertex.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Antialiased
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] polygon edges will be anti-aliased. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.Texture
member.summary: The polygon's fill texture. Use [code]uv[/code] to set texture coordinates.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.TextureOffset
member.summary: Amount to offset the polygon's [code]texture[/code]. If [code](0, 0)[/code] the texture's origin (its top-left corner) will be placed at the polygon's [code]position[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.TextureScale
member.summary: Amount to multiply the [code]uv[/code] coordinates when using a [code]texture[/code]. Larger values make the texture smaller, and vice versa.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.TextureRotation
member.summary: The texture's rotation in degrees.

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.InvertEnable
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] polygon will be inverted, containing the area outside the defined points and extending to the [code]invert_border[/code]. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Polygon2D.InvertBorder
member.summary: Added padding applied to the bounding box when using [code]invert[/code]. Setting this value too small may result in a "Bad Polygon" error. Default value: [code]100[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetPolygon(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Define the set of vertices that will represent the polygon.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetPolygon
member.summary: Return the set of vertices that defines this polygon.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetUv(Godot.Vector2[])
member.summary: Set the texture coordinates for every vertex of the polygon. There should be one uv vertex for every vertex in the polygon. If there are less, the undefined ones will be assumed to be (0,0). Extra uv vertices are ignored.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetUv
member.summary: Return the texture coordinates associated with every vertex of the polygon.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetColor(Godot.Color)
member.summary: Set the polygon fill color. If the polygon has a texture defined, the defined texture will be multiplied by the polygon fill color. This, also, is the default color for those vertices that are not defined by [method get_vertex_colors].

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetColor
member.summary: Return the polygon fill color.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetVertexColors(Godot.Color[])
member.summary: Set the color for each vertex of the polygon. There should be one color for every vertex in the polygon. If there are less, the undefined ones will be assumed to be [method get_color]. Extra color entries are ignored. Colors are interpolated between vertices, resulting in smooth gradients when they differ.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetVertexColors
member.summary: Return the list of vertex colors.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetTexture
member.summary: Return the polygon texture

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetTextureOffset(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the offset of the polygon texture. Initially the texture will appear anchored to the polygon position, the offset is used to move the texture location away from that point (notice that the texture origin is set to its top left corner, so when offset is 0,0 the top left corner of the texture is at the polygon position), for example setting the offset to 10, 10 will move the texture 10 units to the left and 10 units to the top.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetTextureOffset
member.summary: Return the polygon texture offset.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetTextureRotation(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the amount of rotation of the polygon texture, [code]texture_rotation[/code] is specified in radians and clockwise rotation.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetTextureRotation
member.summary: Return the rotation in radians of the texture polygon.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetTextureScale(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the value that will multiply the uv coordinates ([method get_uv]) when applying the texture. Larger values make the texture smaller, and vice versa.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetTextureScale
member.summary: Return the uv coordinate multiplier.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetInvert(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the polygon as the defined polygon bounding box minus the defined polygon (the defined polygon will appear as a hole on the square that contains the defined polygon).

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetInvert
member.summary: Return whether this polygon is inverted or not.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetInvertBorder(System.Single)
member.summary: Add extra padding around the bounding box, making it bigger. Too small a value can make the polygon triangulate strangely, due to numerical imprecision.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetInvertBorder
member.summary: Return the added padding around the bounding box.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.SetOffset(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the an offset that will be added to the vertices' position. E.g. if the offset is set to (10,10) then all the polygon points will move 10 units to the right and 10 units to the bottom.

member.name: M:Godot.Polygon2D.GetOffset
member.summary: Return the offset for the polygon vertices.

member.name: T:Godot.Popup
member.summary: Popup is a base [Control] used to show dialogs and popups. It's a subwindow and modal by default (see [Control]) and has helpers for custom popup behavior.

member.name: F:Godot.Popup.NOTIFICATION_POST_POPUP
member.summary: Notification sent right after the popup is shown.

member.name: F:Godot.Popup.NOTIFICATION_POPUP_HIDE
member.summary: Notification sent right after the popup is hidden.

member.name: M:Godot.Popup.PopupCentered(System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, at the current size, or at a size determined by "size". <param name="size">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Popup.PopupCenteredRatio(System.Single)
member.summary: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, scaled at a ratio of size of the screen.

member.name: M:Godot.Popup.PopupCenteredMinsize(System.Nullable{Godot.Vector2})
member.summary: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, ensuring the size is never smaller than [code]minsize[/code]. <param name="minsize">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2(0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Popup.Popup_(System.Nullable{Godot.Rect2})
member.summary: Popup (show the control in modal form). <param name="bounds">If the param is null, then the default value is new Rect2(0, 0, 0, 0)</param>

member.name: M:Godot.Popup.SetExclusive(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make the popup hide other popups when shown on the screen.

member.name: M:Godot.Popup.IsExclusive
member.summary: Returns whether the popup will hide other popups when shown on the screen.

member.name: T:Godot.PopupDialog
member.summary: PopupDialog is a base class for popup dialogs, along with [WindowDialog].

member.name: T:Godot.PopupMenu
member.summary: PopupMenu is the typical Control that displays a list of options. They are popular in toolbars or context menus.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.AddIconItem(Godot.Texture,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a new item with text "label" and icon "texture". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator keybinding. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.AddItem(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a new item with text "label". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator keybinding. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.AddIconCheckItem(Godot.Texture,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a new checkable item with text "label" and icon "texture". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.AddCheckItem(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a new checkable item with text "label". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.AddSubmenuItem(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an item with a submenu. The submenu is the name of a child PopupMenu node that would be shown when the item is clicked. An id can optionally be provided, but if is isn't provided, one will be created from the index.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.SetItemText(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Set the text of the item at index "idx".

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.SetItemChecked(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the checkstate status of the item at index "idx".

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.SetItemId(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the id of the item at index "idx".

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.SetItemAccelerator(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the accelerator of the item at index "idx". Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is focused.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.SetItemMetadata(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the metadata of an item, which might be of any type. You can later get it with [method get_item_metadata], which provides a simple way of assigning context data to items.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.SetItemDisabled(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether the item at index "idx" is disabled or not. When it is disabled it can't be selected, or its action invoked.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.SetItemSubmenu(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the submenu of the item at index "idx". The submenu is the name of a child PopupMenu node that would be shown when the item is clicked.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.SetItemAsSeparator(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Mark the item at index "idx" as a seperator, which means that it would be displayed as a mere line.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.SetItemAsCheckable(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether the item at index "idx" has a checkbox. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.GetItemText(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the text of the item at index "idx".

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.GetItemIcon(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the icon of the item at index "idx".

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.IsItemChecked(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the checkstate status of the item at index "idx".

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.GetItemId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the id of the item at index "idx".

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.GetItemIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Find and return the index of the item containing a given id.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.GetItemAccelerator(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the accelerator of the item at index "idx". Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is focused.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.GetItemMetadata(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the metadata of an item, which might be of any type. You can set it with [method set_item_metadata], which provides a simple way of assigning context data to items.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.IsItemDisabled(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return whether the item at index "idx" is disabled. When it is disabled it can't be selected, or its action invoked.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.GetItemSubmenu(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the submenu name of the item at index "idx".

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.IsItemSeparator(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return whether the item is a seperator. If it is, it would be displayed as a line.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.IsItemCheckable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return whether the item at index "idx" has a checkbox. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.GetItemCount
member.summary: Return the amount of items.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.RemoveItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the item at index "idx" from the menu. Note that the indexes of items after the removed item are going to be shifted by one.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.AddSeparator
member.summary: Add a separator between items. Separators also occupy an index.

member.name: M:Godot.PopupMenu.Clear
member.summary: Clear the popup menu, in effect removing all items.

member.name: T:Godot.ProjectSettings
member.summary: Contains global variables accessible from everywhere. Use the normal [Object] API, such as "ProjectSettings.get(variable)", "ProjectSettings.set(variable,value)" or "ProjectSettings.has(variable)" to access them. Variables stored in project.godot are also loaded into ProjectSettings, making this object very useful for reading custom game configuration options.

member.name: M:Godot.ProjectSettings.HasSetting(System.String)
member.summary: Return true if a configuration value is present.

member.name: M:Godot.ProjectSettings.SetOrder(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the order of a configuration value (influences when saved to the config file).

member.name: M:Godot.ProjectSettings.GetOrder(System.String)
member.summary: Return the order of a configuration value (influences when saved to the config file).

member.name: M:Godot.ProjectSettings.AddPropertyInfo(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Add a custom property info to a property. The dictionary must contain: name:[String](the name of the property) and type:[int](see TYPE_* in [@Global Scope]), and optionally hint:[int](see PROPERTY_HINT_* in [@Global Scope]), hint_string:[String]. Example: [codeblock] ProjectSettings.set("category/property_name", 0) var property_info = { "name": "category/property_name", "type": TYPE_INT, "hint": PROPERTY_HINT_ENUM, "hint_string": "one,two,three" } ProjectSettings.add_property_info(property_info) [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.ProjectSettings.Clear(System.String)
member.summary: Clear the whole configuration (not recommended, may break things).

member.name: M:Godot.ProjectSettings.LocalizePath(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a path to a localized path (res:// path).

member.name: M:Godot.ProjectSettings.GlobalizePath(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a localized path (res://) to a full native OS path.

member.name: T:Godot.Range
member.summary: Range is a base class for [Control] nodes that change a floating point [i]value[/i] between a [i]minimum[/i] and a [i]maximum[/i], using [i]step[/i] and [i]page[/i], for example a [ScrollBar].

member.name: P:Godot.Range.MinValue
member.summary: Minimum value. Range is clamped if [code]value[/code] is less than [code]min_value[/code]. Default value: 0.

member.name: P:Godot.Range.MaxValue
member.summary: Maximum value. Range is clamped if [code]value[/code] is greater than [code]max_value[/code]. Default value: 100.

member.name: P:Godot.Range.Step
member.summary: If greater than 0, [code]value[/code] will always be rounded to a multiple of [code]step[/code]. If [code]rounded[/code] is also [code]true[/code], [code]value[/code] will first be rounded to a multiple of [code]step[/code] then rounded to the nearest integer.

member.name: P:Godot.Range.Page
member.summary: Page size. Used mainly for [ScrollBar]. ScrollBar's length is its size multiplied by [code]page[/code] over the difference between [code]min_value[/code] and [code]max_value[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.Range.Value
member.summary: Range's current value.

member.name: P:Godot.Range.ExpEdit
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] and [code]min_value[/code] is greater than 0, [code]value[/code] will be represented exponentially rather than linearly.

member.name: P:Godot.Range.Rounded
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], [code]value[/code] will always be rounded to the nearest integer.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.GetMin
member.summary: Return the minimum value.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.GetMax
member.summary: Return the maximum value.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.GetStep
member.summary: Return the stepping, if step is 0, stepping is disabled.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.GetPage
member.summary: Return the page size, if page is 0, paging is disabled.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.GetAsRatio
member.summary: Return value mapped to 0 to 1 range.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.SetMin(System.Single)
member.summary: Set minimum value, clamped range value to it if it's less.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.SetStep(System.Single)
member.summary: Set step value. If step is 0, stepping will be disabled.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.SetPage(System.Single)
member.summary: Set page size. Page is mainly used for scrollbars or anything that controls text scrolling.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.SetAsRatio(System.Single)
member.summary: Set value mapped to 0 to 1 (unit) range, it will then be converted to the actual value within min and max.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.Share(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Binds two Ranges together along with any Ranges previously grouped with either of them. When any of Range's member variables change, it will share the new value with all other Ranges in its group.

member.name: M:Godot.Range.Unshare
member.summary: Stop Range from sharing its member variables with any other Range.

member.name: T:Godot.RayCast
member.summary: A RayCast represents a line from its origin to its destination position, [code]cast_to[/code]. It is used to query the 3D space in order to find the closest object along the path of the ray. RayCast can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], by setting proper filtering with collision layers, or by filtering object types with type masks. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions. RayCast calculates intersection every physics frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between physics frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.Enabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], collisions will be reported. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.CastTo
member.summary: The ray's destination point, relative to the RayCast's [code]position[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.CollisionMask
member.summary: The ray's collision mask. Only objects in at least one collision layer enabled in the mask will be detected.

member.name: P:Godot.RayCast.TypeMask
member.summary: Object types to detect using a logical sum (OR operation) of type constants defined in [Physics2DDirectSpaceState]. Example: [codeblock] RayCast.type_mask = Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY | Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.SetEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables the RayCast2D. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.IsEnabled
member.summary: Returns whether the ray is enabled or not.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.SetCastTo(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the ray destination point, so that the ray will test from the ray's origin to [code]local_point[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetCastTo
member.summary: Return the destination point of this ray object.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.IsColliding
member.summary: Return whether the closest object the ray is pointing to is colliding with the vector (considering the vector length).

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.ForceRaycastUpdate
member.summary: Updates the collision information for the ray. Use this method to update the collision information immediately instead of waiting for the next [code]_physics_process[/code] call, for example if the ray or its parent has changed state. Note: [code]enabled == true[/code] is not required for this to work.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetCollider
M:Godot.RayCast.GetColliderShape
M:Godot.RayCast.GetCollisionPoint
member.summary: Returns the collision point at which the ray intersects the closest object. Note: this point is in the [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetCollisionNormal
member.summary: Returns the normal of the intersecting object's shape at the collision point.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.AddExceptionRid(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified [RID].

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.AddException(Godot.Object)
member.summary: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified node.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.RemoveExceptionRid(Godot.RID)
member.summary: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified [RID].

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.RemoveException(Godot.Object)
member.summary: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified node.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.ClearExceptions
member.summary: Removes all collision exceptions for this ray.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.SetCollisionMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the mask to filter objects. Only objects in at least one collision layer enabled in the mask will be detected.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetCollisionMask
member.summary: Returns the collision mask for this ray.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.SetTypeMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the types of objects to detect. For [code]mask[/code] use a logic sum (OR operation) of constants defined in [PhysicsDirectSpaceState], eg. [code]PhysicsDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY | PhysicsDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY[/code] to detect only those two types.

member.name: M:Godot.RayCast.GetTypeMask
member.summary: Returns the type mask (types of objects to detect) for this ray. The value is a sum (bitwise OR'd) of constants available for [PhysicsDirectSpaceState].

member.name: T:Godot.RayCast2D
member.summary: A RayCast represents a line from its origin to its destination position, [code]cast_to[/code]. It is used to query the 2D space in order to find the closest object along the path of the ray. RayCast2D can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], by setting proper filtering with collision layers, or by filtering object types with type masks. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions. RayCast2D calculates intersection every physics frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between physics frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

member.name: M:Godot.Reference.Unreference

member.name: T:Godot.ReferenceRect

member.name: T:Godot.RegEx
member.summary: Class for finding text patterns in a string using regular expressions. It can not perform replacements. Regular expressions are a way to define patterns of text to be searched. Details on writing patterns are too long to explain here but the Internet is full of tutorials and detailed explanations. Once created, the RegEx object needs to be compiled with the search pattern before it can be used. The search pattern must be escaped first for gdscript before it is escaped for the expression. For example: [code]var exp = RegEx.new()[/code] [code]exp.compile("\\d+")[/code] would be read by RegEx as [code]\d+[/code] Similarly: [code]exp.compile("\"(?:\\\\.|[^\"])*\"")[/code] would be read as [code]"(?:\\.|[^"])*"[/code] Currently supported features: * Capturing [code]()[/code] and non-capturing [code](?:)[/code] groups * Named capturing groups [code](?P<name>)[/code] * Any character [code].[/code] * Shorthand character classes [code]\w \W \s \S \d \D[/code] * User-defined character classes such as [code][A-Za-z][/code] * Simple quantifiers [code]?[/code], [code]*[/code] and [code]+[/code] * Range quantifiers [code]{x,y}[/code] * Lazy (non-greedy) quantifiers [code]*?[/code] * Beginning [code]^[/code] and end [code]$[/code] anchors * Alternation [code]|[/code] * Backreferences [code]\1[/code], [code]\g{1}[/code], and [code]\g<name>[/code] * POSIX character classes [code][[:alnum:]][/code] * Lookahead [code](?=)[/code], [code](?!)[/code] and lookbehind [code](?<=)[/code], [code](?<!)[/code] * ASCII [code]\xFF[/code] and Unicode [code]\uFFFF[/code] code points (in a style similar to Python) * Word boundaries [code]\b[/code], [code]\B[/code]

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.Clear
member.summary: This method resets the state of the object, as it was freshly created. Namely, it unassigns the regular expression of this object.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.Compile(System.String)
member.summary: Compiles and assign the search pattern to use.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.Search(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the text for the compiled pattern. Returns a [RegExMatch] container of the first matching result if found, otherwise null. The region to search within can be specified without modifying where the start and end anchor would be.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.Sub(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the text for the compiled pattern and replaces it with the specified string. Escapes and backreferences such as [code]\1[/code] and [code]\g<name>[/code] expanded and resolved. By default only the first instance is replaced but it can be changed for all instances (global replacement). The region to search within can be specified without modifying where the start and end anchor would be.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.IsValid
member.summary: Returns whether this object has a valid search pattern assigned.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.GetPattern
member.summary: Returns the search pattern used to compile the code.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.GetGroupCount
member.summary: Returns the number of numeric capturing groups.

member.name: M:Godot.RegEx.GetNames
member.summary: Returns an array of names of named capturing groups.

member.name: T:Godot.RegExMatch
member.summary: Contains the results of a regex search. [method RegEx.search] returns an instance of [code]RegExMatch[/code] if it finds the search pattern in the [source] string.

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetSubject
member.summary: Returns the [source] string used with the search pattern to find this matching result.

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetGroupCount
member.summary: Returns the number of numeric capturing groups.

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetNames
member.summary: Returns an array of names of named capturing groups.

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetStrings
member.summary: Returns an [Array] of the matches in the [source] string.

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetString(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the result of the match in the [source] string. An integer can be specified for numeric groups or a string for named groups. Returns -1 if that group wasn't found or doesn't exist. Defaults to 0 (whole pattern). <param name="name">If the param is null, then the default value is 0</param>

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetStart(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the starting position of the match in the [source] string. An integer can be specified for numeric groups or a string for named groups. Returns -1 if that group wasn't found or doesn't exist. Defaults to 0 (whole pattern). <param name="name">If the param is null, then the default value is 0</param>

member.name: M:Godot.RegExMatch.GetEnd(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the end position of the match in the [source] string. An integer can be specified for numeric groups or a string for named groups. Returns -1 if that group wasn't found or doesn't exist. Defaults to 0 (whole pattern). <param name="name">If the param is null, then the default value is 0</param>

member.name: T:Godot.RemoteTransform
member.summary: RemoteTransform mirrors the [Transform] of another [Spatial] derived Node (called the remote node) in the scene. It can be set to track another Node's position, rotation and/or scale and update its own accordingly, using either global or local coordinates.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.RemotePath
member.summary: The remote node's [NodePath].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.UseGlobalCoordinates
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] global coordinates are used. If [code]false[/code] local coordinates are used. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.UpdatePosition
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the remote node's position is mirrored.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.UpdateRotation
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the remote node's rotation is mirrored.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform.UpdateScale
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the remote node's scale is mirrored.

member.name: T:Godot.RemoteTransform2D
member.summary: RemoteTransform2D mirrors the [Transform2D] of another [CanvasItem] derived Node (called the remote node) in the scene. It can be set to track another Node's position, rotation and/or and update its own accordingly, using either global or local coordinates.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.RemotePath
member.summary: The remote node's [NodePath].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.UseGlobalCoordinates
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] global coordinates are used. If [code]false[/code] local coordinates are used. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.UpdatePosition
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the remote node's position is mirrored.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.UpdateRotation
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the remote node's rotation is mirrored.

member.name: P:Godot.RemoteTransform2D.UpdateScale
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the remote node's scale is mirrored.

member.name: T:Godot.Resource
member.summary: Resource is the base class for all resource types. Resources are primarily data containers. They are reference counted and freed when no longer in use. They are also loaded only once from disk, and further attempts to load the resource will return the same reference (all this in contrast to a [Node], which is not reference counted and can be instanced from disk as many times as desired). Resources can be saved externally on disk or bundled into another object, such as a [Node] or another resource.

member.name: M:Godot.Resource.SetPath(System.String)
member.summary: Set the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else. Fails if another [code]Resource[/code] already has path "path".

member.name: M:Godot.Resource.TakeOverPath(System.String)
member.summary: Set the path of the resource. Differs from set_path(), if another [code]Resource[/code] exists with "path" it over-takes it, instead of failing.

member.name: M:Godot.Resource.GetPath
member.summary: Return the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else.

member.name: M:Godot.Resource.SetName(System.String)
member.summary: Set the name of the resources, any name is valid (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

member.name: M:Godot.Resource.GetName
member.summary: Return the name of the resources, any name is valid (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

member.name: M:Godot.Resource.GetRid
member.summary: Return the RID of the resource (or an empty RID). Many resources (such as [Texture], [Mesh], etc) are high level abstractions of resources stored in a server, so this function will return the original RID.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader
member.summary: Interactive Resource Loader. This object is returned by ResourceLoader when performing an interactive load. It allows to load with high granularity, so this is mainly useful for displaying load bars/percentages.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader.GetResource
member.summary: Return the loaded resource (only if loaded). Otherwise, returns null.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader.Poll
member.summary: Poll the load. If OK is returned, this means poll will have to be called again. If ERR_FILE_EOF is returned, them the load has finished and the resource can be obtained by calling [method get_resource].

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader.GetStage
member.summary: Return the load stage. The total amount of stages can be queried with [method get_stage_count]

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceInteractiveLoader.GetStageCount
member.summary: Return the total amount of stages (calls to [method poll]) needed to completely load this resource.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourceLoader
member.summary: Resource Loader. This is a static object accessible as [code]ResourceLoader[/code]. GDScript has a simplified load() function, though.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceLoader.LoadInteractive(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Load a resource interactively, the returned object allows to load with high granularity.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceLoader.GetRecognizedExtensionsForType(System.String)
member.summary: Return the list of recognized extensions for a resource type.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceLoader.SetAbortOnMissingResources(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change the behavior on missing sub-resources. Default is to abort load.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourcePreloader
member.summary: Resource Preloader Node. This node is used to preload sub-resources inside a scene, so when the scene is loaded all the resources are ready to use and be retrieved from here.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.RemoveResource(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a resource from the preloader by text id.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.RenameResource(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Rename a resource inside the preloader, from a text-id to a new text-id.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.HasResource(System.String)
member.summary: Return true if the preloader has a given resource.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.GetResource(System.String)
member.summary: Return the resource given a text-id.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourcePreloader.GetResourceList
member.summary: Return the list of resources inside the preloader.

member.name: T:Godot.ResourceSaver
member.summary: Resource Saving Interface. This interface is used for saving resources to disk.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceSaver.Save(System.String,Godot.Resource,System.Int32)
member.summary: Save a resource to disk, to a given path.

member.name: M:Godot.ResourceSaver.GetRecognizedExtensions(Godot.Resource)
member.summary: Return the list of extensions available for saving a resource of a given type.

member.name: T:Godot.RichTextLabel
member.summary: Label that displays rich text. Rich text can contain custom text, fonts, images and some basic formatting. It also adapts itself to given width/heights.

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.BbcodeEnabled
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the label uses BBCode formatting. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.BbcodeText

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.VisibleCharacters
member.summary: The restricted number of characters to display in the label.

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.PercentVisible
member.summary: The text's visibility, as a [float] between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: P:Godot.RichTextLabel.OverrideSelectedFontColor
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the label uses the custom font color. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.GetText

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.Newline
member.summary: Adds a newline to the end of the rich text.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.Clear
member.summary: Clears the label's text.

member.name: M:Godot.RichTextLabel.IsScrollActive
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if active scrolling is enabled.
