member.name: T:Godot.RigidBody
member.summary: This is the node that implements full 3D physics. This means that you do not control a RigidBody directly. Instead you can apply forces to it (gravity, impulses, etc.), and the physics simulation will calculate the resulting movement, collision, bouncing, rotating, etc. This node can use custom force integration, for writing complex physics motion behavior per node. This node can shift state between regular Rigid body, Kinematic, Character or Static. Character mode forbids this node from being rotated. As a warning, don't change RigidBody's position every frame or very often. Sporadic changes work fine, but physics runs at a different granularity (fixed hz) than usual rendering (process callback) and maybe even in a separate thread, so changing this from a process loop will yield strange behavior.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody.MODE_RIGID
member.summary: Rigid body. This is the "natural" state of a rigid body. It is affected by forces, and can move, rotate, and be affected by user code.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody.MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Static mode. The body behaves like a [StaticBody], and can only move by user code.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody.MODE_CHARACTER
member.summary: Character body. This behaves like a rigid body, but can not rotate.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody.MODE_KINEMATIC
member.summary: Kinematic body. The body behaves like a [KinematicBody], and can only move by user code.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Mode
member.summary: The body mode from the MODE_* enum. Modes include: MODE_STATIC, MODE_KINEMATIC, MODE_RIGID, and MODE_CHARACTER.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Mass
member.summary: RigidBody's mass.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Weight
member.summary: RigidBody's weight based on its mass and the global 3D gravity. Global values are set in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 3d".

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Friction
member.summary: The body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (max friction).

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Bounce
member.summary: RigidBody's bounciness.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.GravityScale
member.summary: This is multiplied by the global 3D gravity setting found in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 3d" to produce RigidBody's gravity. E.g. a value of 1 will be normal gravity, 2 will apply double gravity, and 0.5 will apply half gravity to this object.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.CustomIntegrator
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] internal force integration will be disabled (like gravity or air friction) for this body. Other than collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function, if defined.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.ContinuousCd
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] continuous collision detection is used. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided. Continuous collision detection is more precise, and misses less impacts by small, fast-moving objects. Not using continuous collision detection is faster to compute, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.ContactsReported
member.summary: The maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.ContactMonitor
member.summary: If true, the RigidBody will emit signals when it collides with another RigidBody.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.Sleeping
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] RigidBody is sleeping and will not calculate forces until woken up by a collision or the [code]apply_impulse[/code] method.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.CanSleep
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the RigidBody will not calculate forces and will act as a static body while there is no movement. It will wake up when forces are applied through other collisions or when the [code]apply_impulse[/code] method is used.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AxisLock
member.summary: Locks the rotational forces to a particular axis, preventing rotations on other axes.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.LinearVelocity
member.summary: RigidBody's linear velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may run in another thread and runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop for precise control of the body state.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.LinearDamp
member.summary: RigidBody's linear damp. Default value: -1, cannot be less than -1. If this value is different from -1, any linear damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AngularVelocity
member.summary: RigidBody's rotational velocity.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody.AngularDamp
member.summary: Damps RigidBody's rotational forces.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody._IntegrateForces(Godot.PhysicsDirectBodyState)
member.summary: Called during physics processing, allowing you to read and safely modify the simulation state for the object. By default it works in addition to the usual physics behavior, but [method set_use_custom_integrator] allows you to disable the default behavior and do fully custom force integration for a body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the body mode, from the MODE_* enum. This allows to change to a static body or a character body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetMode
member.summary: Return the current body mode, see [method set_mode].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetMass(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body mass.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetMass
member.summary: Return the current body mass.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetWeight(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body weight given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetWeight
member.summary: Return the current body weight, given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetFriction(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (max friction).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetFriction
member.summary: Return the current body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (max friction).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetBounce(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (no bounciness) to 1 (max bounciness).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetBounce
member.summary: Return the current body bounciness.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetLinearVelocity(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Set the body linear velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetLinearVelocity
member.summary: Return the current body linear velocity.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetAngularVelocity(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Set the body angular velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetAngularVelocity
member.summary: Return the current body angular velocity.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetGravityScale(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the gravity factor. This factor multiplies gravity intensity just for this body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetGravityScale
member.summary: Return the current body gravity scale.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetLinearDamp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the linear damp for this body. Default of -1, cannot be less than -1. If this value is different from -1, any linear damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetLinearDamp
member.summary: Return the current body linear damp. Default is -1.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetAngularDamp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the angular damp for this body. Default of -1, cannot be less than -1. If this value is different from -1, any angular damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetAngularDamp
member.summary: Return the current body angular damp. Default is -1.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetMaxContactsReported(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetMaxContactsReported
member.summary: Return the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method set_max_contacts_reported].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetUseCustomIntegrator(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pass true to disable the internal force integration (like gravity or air friction) for this body. Other than collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function, if defined.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.IsUsingCustomIntegrator
member.summary: Return whether the body is using a custom integrator.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetContactMonitor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable contact monitoring. This allows the body to emit signals when it collides with another.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.IsContactMonitorEnabled
member.summary: Return whether contact monitoring is enabled.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetUseContinuousCollisionDetection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the continuous collision detection mode from the enum CCD_MODE_*. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided. The first is more precise, and misses less impacts by small, fast-moving objects. The second is faster to compute, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.IsUsingContinuousCollisionDetection
member.summary: Return whether this body is using continuous collision detection.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetAxisVelocity(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Set an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.ApplyImpulse(Godot.Vector3,Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Apply a positioned impulse (which will be affected by the body mass and shape). This is the equivalent of hitting a billiard ball with a cue: a force that is applied once, and only once. Both the impulse and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetSleeping(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether a body is sleeping or not. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.IsSleeping
member.summary: Return whether the body is sleeping.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetCanSleep(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the body ability to fall asleep when not moving. This saves an enormous amount of processor time when there are plenty of rigid bodies (non static) in a scene. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] / [method set_applied_force] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.IsAbleToSleep
member.summary: Return whether the body has the ability to fall asleep when not moving. See [method set_can_sleep].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.SetAxisLock(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the axis lock of the body, from the AXIS_LOCK_* enum. Axis lock stops the body from moving along the specified axis(X/Y/Z) and rotating along the other two axes.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetAxisLock
member.summary: Return the current axis lock of the body. One of AXIS_LOCK_* enum.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody.GetCollidingBodies
member.summary: Return a list of the bodies colliding with this one. By default, number of max contacts reported is at 0 , see [method set_max_contacts_reported] to increase it.

member.name: T:Godot.RigidBody2D
member.summary: This node implements simulated 2D physics. You do not control a RigidBody2D directly. Instead you apply forces to it (gravity, impulses, etc.) and the physics simulation calculates the resulting movement based on its mass, friction, and other physical properties. A RigidBody2D has 4 behavior modes (see [member mode]): - [b]Rigid[/b]: The body behaves as a physical object. It collides with other bodies and responds to forces applied to it. This is the default mode. - [b]Static[/b]: The body behaves like a [StaticBody2D] and does not move. - [b]Character[/b]: Similar to [code]Rigid[/code] mode, but the body can not rotate. - [b]Kinematic[/b]: The body behaves like a [KinematicBody2D], and must be moved by code. [b]Note:[/b] You should not change a RigidBody2D's [code]position[/code] or [code]linear_velocity[/code] every frame or even very often. If you need to directly affect the body's state, use [method _integrate_forces], which allows you to directly access the physics state. If you need to override the default physics behavior, you can write a custom force integration. See [member custom_integrator].

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.MODE_RIGID
member.summary: Rigid mode. The body behaves as a physical object. It collides with other bodies and responds to forces applied to it. This is the default mode.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.MODE_STATIC
member.summary: Static mode. The body behaves like a [StaticBody2D] and does not move.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.MODE_CHARACTER
member.summary: Character mode. Similar to [code]MODE_RIGID[/code], but the body can not rotate.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.MODE_KINEMATIC
member.summary: Kinematic mode. The body behaves like a [KinematicBody2D], and must be moved by code.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.CCD_MODE_DISABLED
member.summary: Continuous collision detection disabled. This is the fastest way to detect body collisions, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.CCD_MODE_CAST_RAY
member.summary: Continuous collision detection enabled using raycasting. This is faster than shapecasting but less precise.

member.name: F:Godot.RigidBody2D.CCD_MODE_CAST_SHAPE
member.summary: Continuous collision detection enabled using shapecasting. This is the slowest CCD method and the most precise.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Mode
member.summary: The body's mode. See [code]MODE_*[/code] constants. Default value: [code]MODE_RIGID[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Mass
member.summary: The body's mass. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Weight
member.summary: The body's weight based on its mass and the "Default Gravity" value in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 2d".

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Friction
member.summary: The body's friction. Values range from [code]0[/code] (frictionless) to [code]1[/code] (maximum friction). Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Bounce
member.summary: The body's bounciness. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.GravityScale
member.summary: Multiplies the gravity applied to the body. The body's gravity is calculated from the "Default Gravity" value in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 2d" and/or any additional gravity vector applied by [Area2D]s. Default value: [code]1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.CustomIntegrator
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] internal force integration is disabled for this body. Aside from collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.ContinuousCd
member.summary: Continuous collision detection mode. Default value: [code]CCD_MODE_DISABLED[/code]. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide instead of moving it and correcting its movement after collision. Continuous collision detection is slower, but more precise and misses fewer collisions with small, fast-moving objects. Raycasting and shapecasting methods are available. See [code]CCD_MODE_[/code] constants for details.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.ContactsReported
member.summary: The maximum number of contacts to report. Default value: [code]0[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.ContactMonitor
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the body will emit signals when it collides with another RigidBody2D. See also [member contacts_reported]. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.Sleeping
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the body is sleeping and will not calculate forces until woken up by a collision or by using [method apply_impulse] or [method add_force].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.CanSleep
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the body will not calculate forces and will act as a static body if there is no movement. The body will wake up when other forces are applied via collisions or by using [method apply_impulse] or [method add_force]. Default value: [code]true[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.LinearVelocity
member.summary: The body's linear velocity.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.LinearDamp
member.summary: Damps the body's [member linear_velocity]. If [code]-1[/code] the body will use the "Default Linear Damp" in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 2d". Default value: [code]-1[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.AngularVelocity
member.summary: The body's rotational velocity.

member.name: P:Godot.RigidBody2D.AngularDamp
member.summary: Damps the body's [member angular_velocity]. If [code]-1[/code] the body will use the "Default Angular Damp" in "Project > Project Settings > Physics > 2d". Default value: [code]-1[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D._IntegrateForces(Godot.Physics2DDirectBodyState)
member.summary: Allows you to read and safely modify the simulation state for the object. Use this instead of [Node._physics_process] if you need to directly change the body's [code]position[/code] or other physics properties. By default it works in addition to the usual physics behavior, but [member custom_integrator] allows you to disable the default behavior and write custom force integration for a body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the body mode, from the MODE_* enum. This allows to change to a static body or a character body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetMode
member.summary: Return the current body mode, see [method set_mode].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetMass(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body mass.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetMass
member.summary: Return the body mass.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetInertia
member.summary: Returns the body's moment of inertia, which is computed automatically from the body's mass and assigned [Shape2D]s during the physics frame. Note that it will not yet have a value in the [code]_ready()[/code] function.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetInertia(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body's moment of inertia. This is like mass, but for rotation: it determines how much torque it takes to rotate the body. The moment of inertia is usually computed automatically from the mass and the shapes, but this function allows you to set a custom value. Set 0 (or negative) inertia to return to automatically computing it.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetWeight(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body weight given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8). Not really useful for 2D since most measures for this node are in pixels.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetWeight
member.summary: Return the body weight given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetFriction(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (full friction).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetFriction
member.summary: Return the body friction.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetBounce(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (no bounce) to 1 (full bounce).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetBounce
member.summary: Return the body bounciness.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetGravityScale(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the gravity factor. This factor multiplies gravity intensity just for this body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetGravityScale
member.summary: Return the gravity factor.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetLinearDamp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the linear damp for this body. If this value is different from -1, any linear damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetLinearDamp
member.summary: Return the linear damp for this body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetAngularDamp(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the angular damp for this body. If this value is different from -1, any angular damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetAngularDamp
member.summary: Return the angular damp for this body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetLinearVelocity(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the body linear velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetLinearVelocity
member.summary: Returns the body's linear velocity. This changes when a physics frame has passed, not during a normal update. See [method set_linear_velocity].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetAngularVelocity(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body angular velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetAngularVelocity
member.summary: Return the body angular velocity. This changes by physics granularity. See [method set_angular_velocity].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetMaxContactsReported(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetMaxContactsReported
member.summary: Return the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method set_max_contacts_reported].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetUseCustomIntegrator(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pass true to disable the internal force integration (like gravity or air friction) for this body. Other than collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function, if defined.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.IsUsingCustomIntegrator
member.summary: Return true if the body is not doing any built-in force integration.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetContactMonitor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable contact monitoring. This allows the body to emit signals when it collides with another.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.IsContactMonitorEnabled
member.summary: Return whether contact monitoring is enabled.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetContinuousCollisionDetectionMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the continuous collision detection mode from the enum CCD_MODE_*. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided. The first is more precise, and misses less impacts by small, fast-moving objects. The second is faster to compute, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetContinuousCollisionDetectionMode
member.summary: Return whether this body is using continuous collision detection.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetAxisVelocity(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the body's velocity on the given axis. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.ApplyImpulse(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a positioned impulse to the body (which will be affected by the body mass and shape). This is the equivalent of hitting a billiard ball with a cue: a force that is applied instantaneously. Both the impulse and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetAppliedForce(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Sets the applied force vector. This is the equivalent of firing a rocket: the force is applied constantly.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetAppliedForce
member.summary: Returns the body's total applied force.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetAppliedTorque(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the applied torque.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetAppliedTorque
member.summary: Returns the body's total applied torque.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.AddForce(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Adds a positioned force to the body. Both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetSleeping(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether a body is sleeping or not. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] / [method set_applied_force] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.IsSleeping
member.summary: Return whether the body is sleeping.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.SetCanSleep(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the body ability to fall asleep when not moving. This saves an enormous amount of processor time when there are plenty of rigid bodies (non static) in a scene. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] / [method set_applied_force] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.IsAbleToSleep
member.summary: Return true if the body has the ability to fall asleep when not moving. See [method set_can_sleep].

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.TestMotion(Godot.Vector2,System.Single,Godot.Physics2DTestMotionResult)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if a collision would result from moving in the given vector. [code]margin[/code] increases the size of the shapes involved in the collision detection, and [code]result[/code] is an object of type [Physics2DTestMotionResult], which contains additional information about the collision (should there be one).

member.name: M:Godot.RigidBody2D.GetCollidingBodies
member.summary: Returns a list of the bodies colliding with this one. Use [member contacts_reported] to set the maximum number reported. You must also set [member contact_monitor] to [code]true[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.SceneTree.SetNetworkPeer(Godot.NetworkedMultiplayerPeer)
member.summary: Set the peer object to handle the RPC system (effectively enabling networking). Depending on the peer itself, the SceneTree will become a network server (check with [method is_network_server()]) and will set root node's network mode to master (see NETWORK_MODE_* constants in [Node]), or it will become a regular peer with root node set to slave. All child nodes are set to inherit the network mode by default. Handling of networking-related events (connection, disconnection, new clients) is done by connecting to SceneTree's signals.

member.name: M:Godot.SceneTree.IsNetworkServer
member.summary: Returns true if this SceneTree's [NetworkedMultiplayerPeer] is in server mode (listening for connections).

member.name: M:Godot.SceneTree.HasNetworkPeer
member.summary: Returns true if there is a [NetworkedMultiplayerPeer] set (with [method SceneTree.set_network_peer]).

member.name: T:Godot.Script
member.summary: A class stored as a resource. The script exends the functionality of all objects that instance it. The 'new' method of a script subclass creates a new instance. [method Object.set_script] extends an existing object, if that object's class matches one of the script's base classes.

member.name: M:Godot.Script.CanInstance
member.summary: Returns true if the script can be instanced.

member.name: M:Godot.Script.InstanceHas(Godot.Object)
member.summary: Returns true if 'base_object' is an instance of this script.

member.name: M:Godot.Script.HasSourceCode
member.summary: Returns true if the script contains non-empty source code.

member.name: M:Godot.Script.GetSourceCode
member.summary: Returns the script source code, or an empty string if source code is not available.

member.name: M:Godot.Script.SetSourceCode(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the script source code. Does not reload the class implementation.

member.name: M:Godot.Script.Reload(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reloads the script's class implementation. Returns an error code.

member.name: M:Godot.Script.HasScriptSignal(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the script, or a base class, defines a signal with the given name.

member.name: M:Godot.Script.IsTool
member.summary: Returns true if the script is a tool script. A tool script can run in the editor.

member.name: T:Godot.ScrollBar
member.summary: Scrollbars are a [Range] based [Control], that display a draggable area (the size of the page). Horizontal ([HScrollBar]) and Vertical ([VScrollBar]) versions are available.

member.name: T:Godot.ScrollContainer
member.summary: A ScrollContainer node with a [Control] child and scrollbar child ([HScrollbar], [VScrollBar], or both) will only draw the Control within the ScrollContainer area. Scrollbars will automatically be drawn at the right (for vertical) or bottom (for horizontal) and will enable dragging to move the viewable Control (and its children) within the ScrollContainer. Scrollbars will also automatically resize the grabber based on the minimum_size of the Control relative to the ScrollContainer. Works great with a [Panel] control. You can set EXPAND on children size flags, so they will upscale to ScrollContainer size if ScrollContainer size is bigger (scroll is invisible for chosen dimension).

member.name: M:Godot.ScrollContainer.SetEnableHScroll(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set allows horizontal scroll.

member.name: M:Godot.ScrollContainer.IsHScrollEnabled
member.summary: Return true if horizontal scroll is allowed.

member.name: M:Godot.ScrollContainer.SetEnableVScroll(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set allows vertical scroll.

member.name: M:Godot.ScrollContainer.IsVScrollEnabled
member.summary: Return true if vertical scroll is allowed.

member.name: M:Godot.ScrollContainer.SetHScroll(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set horizontal scroll value.

member.name: M:Godot.ScrollContainer.GetHScroll
member.summary: Return current horizontal scroll value.

member.name: M:Godot.ScrollContainer.SetVScroll(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set vertical scroll value.

member.name: M:Godot.ScrollContainer.GetVScroll
member.summary: Return current vertical scroll value.

member.name: T:Godot.SegmentShape2D
member.summary: Segment shape for 2D collisions. Consists of two points, [code]a[/code] and [code]b[/code].

member.summary: The segment's first point position.

member.name: P:Godot.SegmentShape2D.B
member.summary: The segment's second point position.

member.name: M:Godot.SegmentShape2D.SetA(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the first point's position.

member.name: M:Godot.SegmentShape2D.GetA
member.summary: Return the first point's position.

member.name: M:Godot.SegmentShape2D.SetB(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set the second point's position.

member.name: M:Godot.SegmentShape2D.GetB
member.summary: Return the second point's position.

member.name: T:Godot.Semaphore
member.summary: A synchronization Semaphore. Element used in multi-threadding. Initialized to zero on creation.

member.name: M:Godot.Semaphore.Wait
member.summary: Tries to wait for the [code]Semaphore[/code], if its value is zero, blocks until non-zero.

member.name: M:Godot.Semaphore.Post
member.summary: Lowers the [code]Semaphore[/code], allowing one more thread in.

member.name: T:Godot.Separator
member.summary: Separator is a [Control] used for separating other controls. It's purely a visual decoration. Horizontal ([HSeparator]) and Vertical ([VSeparator]) versions are available.

member.name: T:Godot.Shader
member.summary: To be changed, ignore.

member.name: T:Godot.Shape
member.summary: Base class for all 3D shape resources. All 3D shapes that inherit from this can be set into a [PhysicsBody] or [Area].

member.name: T:Godot.Shape2D
member.summary: Base class for all 2D Shapes. All 2D shape types inherit from this.

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.SetCustomSolverBias(System.Single)
member.summary: Use a custom solver bias. No need to change this unless you really know what you are doing. The solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound" off each other, when colliding, to avoid them getting into each other because of numerical imprecision.

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.GetCustomSolverBias
member.summary: Return the custom solver bias.

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.Collide(Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Shape2D,Godot.Transform2D)
member.summary: Return whether this shape is colliding with another. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), and the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.CollideWithMotion(Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Shape2D,Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Return whether this shape would collide with another, if a given movement was applied. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the movement to test on this shape ([code]local_motion[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]), and the movement to test onto the other object ([code]shape_motion[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.CollideAndGetContacts(Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Shape2D,Godot.Transform2D)
member.summary: Return a list of the points where this shape touches another. If there are no collisions, the list is empty. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), and the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]).

member.name: M:Godot.Shape2D.CollideWithMotionAndGetContacts(Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Vector2,Godot.Shape2D,Godot.Transform2D,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Return a list of the points where this shape would touch another, if a given movement was applied. If there are no collisions, the list is empty. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the movement to test on this shape ([code]local_motion[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]), and the movement to test onto the other object ([code]shape_motion[/code]).

member.name: T:Godot.Skeleton
member.summary: Skeleton provides a hierarchical interface for managing bones, including pose, rest and animation (see [Animation]). Skeleton will support rag doll dynamics in the future.

member.name: M:Godot.Skeleton.AddBone(System.String)
member.summary: Add a bone, with name "name". [method get_bone_count] will become the bone index.

member.name: M:Godot.Skeleton.FindBone(System.String)
member.summary: Return the bone index that matches "name" as its name.

member.summary: Return the name of the bone at index "index"

member.summary: Return the bone index which is the parent of the bone at "bone_idx". If -1, then bone has no parent. Note that the parent bone returned will always be less than "bone_idx".

member.summary: Set the bone index "parent_idx" as the parent of the bone at "bone_idx". If -1, then bone has no parent. Note: "parent_idx" must be less than "bone_idx".

member.summary: Deprecated soon.

member.summary: The maximum difference between the pivot points on their x-axis before damping happens.

member.summary: The minimum difference between the pivot points on their x-axis before damping happens.

member.name: T:Godot.Spatial
member.summary: Most basic 3D game object, with a 3D [Transform] and visibility settings. All other 3D game objects inherit from Spatial. Use Spatial as a parent node to move, scale, rotate and show/hide children in a 3D project.

member.name: F:Godot.Spatial.NOTIFICATION_TRANSFORM_CHANGED
member.summary: Spatial nodes receives this notification when their global transform changes. This means that either the current or a parent node changed its transform. In order for NOTIFICATION_TRANSFORM_CHANGED to work user first needs to ask for it, with set_notify_transform(true).

member.name: F:Godot.Spatial.NOTIFICATION_ENTER_WORLD
member.summary: Spatial nodes receives this notification when they are registered to new [World] resource.

member.name: F:Godot.Spatial.NOTIFICATION_EXIT_WORLD
member.summary: Spatial nodes receives this notification when they are unregistered from current [World] resource.

member.name: F:Godot.Spatial.NOTIFICATION_VISIBILITY_CHANGED

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.SetIdentity

member.name: M:Godot.Spatial.ToGlobal(Godot.Vector3)

member.name: T:Godot.SpotLight
member.summary: A SpotLight light is a type of [Light] node that emits lights in a specific direction, in the shape of a cone. member.name: T:Godot.StaticBody
member.summary: Static body for 3D Physics. A static body is a simple body that is not intended to move. They don't consume any CPU resources in contrast to a [RigidBody3D] so they are great for scenario collision. A static body can also be animated by using simulated motion mode. This is useful for implementing functionalities such as moving platforms. When this mode is active the body can be animated and automatically computes linear and angular velocity to apply in that frame and to influence other bodies. Alternatively, a constant linear or angular velocity can be set for the static body, so even if it doesn't move, it affects other bodies as if it was moving (this is useful for simulating conveyor belts or conveyor wheels).

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody.Friction
member.summary: The body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (full friction).

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody.Bounce
member.summary: The body bounciness.

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody.ConstantLinearVelocity
member.summary: The constant linear velocity for the body. This does not move the body, but affects other bodies that touch it, as if it was in a state of movement.

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody.ConstantAngularVelocity
member.summary: The constant angular velocity for the body. This does not rotate the body, but affects other bodies that touch it, as if it was in a state of rotation.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody.SetConstantLinearVelocity(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Set a constant linear velocity for the body. This does not move the body, but affects other bodies touching it, as if it was moving.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody.SetConstantAngularVelocity(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Set a constant angular velocity for the body. This does not rotate the body, but affects other bodies touching it, as if it was rotating.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody.GetConstantLinearVelocity
member.summary: Return the constant linear velocity for the body.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody.GetConstantAngularVelocity
member.summary: Return the constant angular velocity for the body.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody.SetFriction(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (full friction).

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody.GetFriction
member.summary: Return the body friction.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody.SetBounce(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (not bouncy) to 1 (bouncy).

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody.GetBounce
member.summary: Return the body bounciness.

member.name: T:Godot.StaticBody2D
member.summary: Static body for 2D Physics. A StaticBody2D is a body that is not intended to move. It is ideal for implementing objects in the environment, such as walls or platforms. Additionally, a constant linear or angular velocity can be set for the static body, which will affect colliding bodies as if it were moving (for example, a conveyor belt).

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody2D.ConstantLinearVelocity
member.summary: Constant linear velocity for the body. This does not move the body, but affects colliding bodies, as if it were moving.

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody2D.ConstantAngularVelocity
member.summary: Constant angular velocity for the body. This does not rotate the body, but affects colliding bodies, as if it were rotating.

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody2D.Friction
member.summary: The body's friction. Values range from [code]0[/code] (no friction) to [code]1[/code] (full friction).

member.name: P:Godot.StaticBody2D.Bounce
member.summary: The body's bounciness. Values range from [code]0[/code] (no bounce) to [code]1[/code] (full bounciness).

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody2D.SetConstantLinearVelocity(Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: Set a constant linear velocity for the body. This does not move the body, but affects other bodies touching it, as if it was moving.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody2D.SetConstantAngularVelocity(System.Single)
member.summary: Set a constant angular velocity for the body. This does not rotate the body, but affects other bodies touching it, as if it was rotating.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody2D.GetConstantLinearVelocity
member.summary: Return the constant linear velocity for the body.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody2D.GetConstantAngularVelocity
member.summary: Return the constant angular velocity for the body.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody2D.SetFriction(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (full friction).

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody2D.GetFriction
member.summary: Return the body friction.

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody2D.SetBounce(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (not bouncy) to 1 (bouncy).

member.name: M:Godot.StaticBody2D.GetBounce
member.summary: Return the body bounciness.

member.name: T:Godot.StreamPeer
member.summary: StreamPeer is an abstraction and base class for stream-based protocols (such as TCP or Unix Sockets). It provides an API for sending and receiving data through streams as raw data or strings.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.PutData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send a chunk of data through the connection, blocking if necessary until the data is done sending. This function returns an Error code.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.PutPartialData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send a chunk of data through the connection, if all the data could not be sent at once, only part of it will. This function returns two values, an Error code and an integer, describing how much data was actually sent.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.GetData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a chunk data with the received bytes. The amount of bytes to be received can be requested in the "bytes" argument. If not enough bytes are available, the function will block until the desired amount is received. This function returns two values, an Error code and a data array.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.GetPartialData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return a chunk data with the received bytes. The amount of bytes to be received can be requested in the "bytes" argument. If not enough bytes are available, the function will return how many were actually received. This function returns two values, an Error code, and a data array.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.GetAvailableBytes
member.summary: Return the amount of bytes this [code]StreamPeer[/code] has available.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.SetBigEndian(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set this [code]StreamPeer[/code] to use big-endian format. Default is false.

member.name: M:Godot.StreamPeer.IsBigEndianEnabled
member.summary: Return whether this [code]StreamPeer[/code] is using big-endian format.

member.summary: Put a signed byte into the stream.

member.summary: Put a signed 64 bit value into the stream.

member.summary: Put a single-precision float into the stream.

member.name: T:Godot.StyleBox
member.summary: StyleBox is [Resource] that provides an abstract base class for drawing stylized boxes for the UI. StyleBoxes are used for drawing the styles of buttons, line edit backgrounds, tree backgrounds, etc. and also for testing a transparency mask for pointer signals. If mask test fails on a StyleBox assigned as mask to a control, clicks and motion signals will go through it to the one below.

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.TestMask(Godot.Vector2,Godot.Rect2)
member.summary: Test a position in a rectangle, return whether it passes the mask test.

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.SetDefaultMargin(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the default offset "offset" of the margin "margin" (see MARGIN_* enum) for a StyleBox, Controls that draw styleboxes with context inside need to know the margin, so the border of the stylebox is not occluded.

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.GetDefaultMargin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the default offset of the margin "margin" (see MARGIN_* enum) of a StyleBox, Controls that draw styleboxes with context inside need to know the margin, so the border of the stylebox is not occluded.

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.GetMargin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the offset of margin "margin" (see MARGIN_* enum).

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.GetMinimumSize
member.summary: Return the minimum size that this stylebox can be shrunk to.

member.name: M:Godot.StyleBox.GetOffset
member.summary: Return the "offset" of a stylebox, this is a helper function, like writing [code]Vector2(style.get_margin(MARGIN_LEFT), style.get_margin(MARGIN_TOP))[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.StyleBoxEmpty
member.summary: Empty stylebox (really does not display anything).

member.name: T:Godot.StyleBoxFlat
member.summary: This stylebox can be used to achieve all kinds of looks without the need of a texture. Those properties are customizable: - Color - Border width (individual width for each border) - Rounded corners (individual radius for each corner) - Shadow About corner radius: Setting corner radius to high values is allowed. As soon as corners would overlap the stylebox will switch to a relative system. Example: [codeblock] height = 30 corner_radius_top_left = 50 corner_radius_bottom_left = 100 [/codeblock] The relative system now would take the 1:2 ratio of the two left corners to calculate the actual corner width. Both corners added will [b]never[/b] be more than the height. Result: [codeblock] corner_radius_top_left: 10 corner_radius_bottom_left: 20 [/codeblock]

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BgColor
member.summary: The background color of the stylebox.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.DrawCenter
member.summary: Toggels drawing of the inner part of the stylebox.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderWidthLeft
member.summary: Border width for the left border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderWidthTop
member.summary: Border width for the top border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderWidthRight
member.summary: Border width for the right border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderWidthBottom
member.summary: Border width for the bottom border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderColor
member.summary: Sets the color of the border.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.BorderBlend
member.summary: When set to true, the border will fade into the background color.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerRadiusTopLeft
member.summary: The corner radius of the top left corner. When set to 0 the corner is not rounded.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerRadiusTopRight
member.summary: The corner radius of the top right corner. When set to 0 the corner is not rounded.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerRadiusBottomRight
member.summary: The corner radius of the bottom right corner. When set to 0 the corner is not rounded.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerRadiusBottomLeft
member.summary: The corner radius of the bottom left corner. When set to 0 the corner is not rounded.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.CornerDetail
member.summary: This sets the amount of vertices used for each corner. Higher values result in rounder corners but take more processing power to compute. When choosing a value you should take the corner radius ([method set_corner_radius]) into account. For corner radius smaller than 10: 4-5 should be enough For corner radius smaller than 30: 8-12 should be enough ...

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ExpandMarginLeft
member.summary: Expands the stylebox outside of the control rect on the left edge. Useful in combination with border_width_left. To draw a border outside the control rect.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ExpandMarginRight
member.summary: Expands the stylebox outside of the control rect on the right edge. Useful in combination with border_width_right. To draw a border outside the control rect.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ExpandMarginTop
member.summary: Expands the stylebox outside of the control rect on the top edge. Useful in combination with border_width_top. To draw a border outside the control rect.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ExpandMarginBottom
member.summary: Expands the stylebox outside of the control rect on the bottom edge. Useful in combination with border_width_bottom. To draw a border outside the control rect.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ShadowColor
member.summary: The color of the shadow. (This has no effect when shadow_size < 1)

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.ShadowSize
member.summary: The shadow size in pixels.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.AntiAliasing
member.summary: Anti Aliasing draws a small ring around edges. This ring fades to transparent. As a result edges look much smoother. This is only noticeable when using rounded corners.

member.name: P:Godot.StyleBoxFlat.AntiAliasingSize
member.summary: This changes the size of the faded ring. Higher values can be used to achieve a "blurry" effect.

member.name: T:Godot.StyleBoxTexture
member.summary: Texture Based 3x3 scale style. This stylebox performs a 3x3 scaling of a texture, where only the center cell is fully stretched. This allows for the easy creation of bordered styles.

member.name: T:Godot.SurfaceTool
member.summary: The [code]SurfaceTool[/code] is used to construct a [Mesh] by specifying vertex attributes individually. It can be used to construct a [Mesh] from script. All properties except index need to be added before a call to [method add_vertex]. For example adding vertex colors and UVs looks like [codeblock] var st = SurfaceTool.new() st.begin(Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES) st.add_color(Color(1, 0, 0)) st.add_uv(Vector2(0, 0)) st.add_vertex(Vector3(0, 0, 0)) [/codeblock] The [code]SurfaceTool[/code] now contains one vertex of a triangle which has a UV coordinate and a specified [Color]. If another vertex were added without calls to [method add_uv] or [method add_color] then the last values would be used. It is very important that vertex attributes are passed [b]before[/b] the call to [method add_vertex], failure to do this will result in an error when committing the vertex information to a mesh.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.Begin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called before adding any Vertices. Takes the primitive type as an argument (e.g. Mesh.PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES).

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddVertex(Godot.Vector3)
member.summary: Specify position of current Vertex. Should be called after specifying other vertex properties (e.g. Color, UV).

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddColor(Godot.Color)
member.summary: Specify a [Color] for the next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Specify a normal for the next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Specify a Tangent for the next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Specify UV Coordinate for next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Specify an optional second set of UV coordinates for next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Add an array of bones for the next Vertex to use.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddWeights(System.Single[])
member.summary: Specify weight value for next Vertex to use.

member.summary: Specify whether current Vertex (if using only Vertex arrays) or current index (if also using index arrays) should utilize smooth normals for normal calculation.

member.name: M:Godot.SurfaceTool.AddTriangleFan(Godot.Vector3[],Godot.Vector2[],Godot.Color[],Godot.Vector2[],Godot.Vector3[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Insert a triangle fan made of array data into [Mesh] being constructed. <param name="uvs">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2[] {}</param> <param name="colors">If the param is null, then the default value is new Color[] {}</param> <param name="uv2s">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector2[] {}</param> <param name="normals">If the param is null, then the default value is new Vector3[] {}</param> <param name="tangents">If the param is null, then the default value is new object[] {}</param>

member.summary: Adds an index to index array if you are using indexed Vertices. Does not need to be called before adding Vertex.

member.name: T:Godot.TabContainer
member.summary: Sets the active tab's [code]visible[/code] property to the value [code]true[/code]. Sets all other children's to [code]false[/code]. Ignores non-[Control] children. Individual tabs are always visible unless you use [method set_tab_disabled] and [method set_tab_title] to hide it. To hide only a tab's content, nest the content inside a child [Control], so it receives the [code]TabContainer[/code]'s visibility setting instead.

member.name: P:Godot.TabContainer.TabAlign
member.summary: The alignment of all tabs in the tab container. See the [code]ALIGN_*[/code] constants for details.

member.name: P:Godot.TabContainer.CurrentTab

member.name: T:Godot.TCP_Server
member.summary: TCP Server class. Listens to connections on a port and returns a [StreamPeerTCP] when got a connection.

member.name: M:Godot.TCP_Server.Listen(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Listen on the "port" binding to "bind_address". If "bind_address" is set as "*" (default), the server will listen on all available addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6). If "bind_address" is set as "0.0.0.0" (for IPv4) or "::" (for IPv6), the server will listen on all available addresses matching that IP type. If "bind_address" is set to any valid address (e.g. "192.168.1.101", "::1", etc), the server will only listen on the interface with that addresses (or fail if no interface with the given address exists).

member.summary: If a connection is available, return a StreamPeerTCP with the connection/

member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the texture stretches to the edges of the node's bounding rectangle using the [member stretch_mode]. If [code]false[/code] the texture will not scale with the node. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureButton.StretchMode
member.summary: Controls the texture's behavior when you resize the node's bounding rectangle, [b]only if[/b] [member expand] is [code]true[/code]. Set it to one of the [code]STRETCH_*[/code] constants. See the constants to learn more.

member.name: T:Godot.TextureProgress
member.summary: TextureProgress works like [ProgressBar] but it uses up to 3 textures instead of Godot's [Theme] resource. Works horizontally, vertically, and radially.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FILL_LEFT_TO_RIGHT
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from left to right.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FILL_RIGHT_TO_LEFT
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from right to left.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FILL_TOP_TO_BOTTOM
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from top to bototm.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FILL_BOTTOM_TO_TOP
member.summary: The [member texture_progress] fills from bottom to top.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FILL_CLOCKWISE
member.summary: Turns the node into a radial bar. The [member texture_progress] fills clockwise. See [member radial_center_offset], [member radial_initial_angle] and [member radial_fill_degrees] to refine its behavior.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureProgress.FILL_COUNTER_CLOCKWISE
member.summary: Turns the node into a radial bar. The [member texture_progress] fills counter-clockwise. See [member radial_center_offset], [member radial_initial_angle] and [member radial_fill_degrees] to refine its behavior.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.TextureUnder
member.summary: [Texture] that draws under the progress bar. The bar's background.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.TextureOver
member.summary: [Texture] that draws over the progress bar. Use it to add highlights or an upper-frame that hides part of [member texture_progress].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.TextureProgress_
member.summary: [Texture] that clips based on the node's [code]value[/code] and [member fill_mode]. As [code]value[/code] increased, the texture fills up. It shows entirely when [code]value[/code] reaches [code]max_value[/code]. It doesn't show at all if [code]value[/code] is equal to [code]min_value[/code]. The [code]value[/code] property comes from [Range]. See [member Range.value], [member Range.min_value], [member Range.max_value].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.FillMode
member.summary: The fill direction. Uses FILL_* constants.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.RadialInitialAngle
member.summary: Starting angle for the fill of [member texture_progress] if [member fill_mode] is [code]FILL_CLOCKWISE[/code] or [code]FILL_COUNTER_CLOCKWISE[/code]. When the node's [code]value[/code] is equal to its [code]min_value[/code], the texture doesn't show up at all. When the [code]value[/code] increases, the texture fills and tends towards [member radial_fill_degrees].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.RadialFillDegrees
member.summary: Upper limit for the fill of [member texture_progress] if [member fill_mode] is [code]FILL_CLOCKWISE[/code] or [code]FILL_COUNTER_CLOCKWISE[/code]. When the node's [code]value[/code] is equal to its [code]max_value[/code], the texture fills up to this angle. See [member Range.value], [member Range.max_value].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.RadialCenterOffset
member.summary: Offsets [member texture_progress] if [member fill_mode] is [code]FILL_CLOCKWISE[/code] or [code]FILL_COUNTER_CLOCKWISE[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.NinePatchStretch
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] Godot treats the bar's textures like [NinePatchRect]. Use [code]stretch_margin_*[/code], like [member stretch_margin_bottom], to set up the nine patch's 3x3 grid. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.StretchMarginLeft
member.summary: The width of the 9-patch's left column.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.StretchMarginTop
member.summary: The height of the 9-patch's top row.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.StretchMarginRight
member.summary: The width of the 9-patch's right column.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureProgress.StretchMarginBottom
member.summary: The height of the 9-patch's bottom row. A margin of 16 means the 9-slice's bottom corners and side will have a height of 16 pixels. You can set all 4 margin values individually to create panels with non-uniform borders.

member.name: M:Godot.TextureProgress.SetStretchMargin(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set nine-patch texture offset for a given margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM).

member.name: M:Godot.TextureProgress.GetStretchMargin(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return nine-patch texture offset for a given margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM).

member.name: M:Godot.TextureProgress.SetNinePatchStretch(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set if textures should be stretched as nine-patches.

member.name: M:Godot.TextureProgress.GetNinePatchStretch
member.summary: Returns true if textures are stretched as nine-patches or false otherwise.

member.name: T:Godot.TextureRect
member.summary: Use TextureRect to draw icons and sprites in your User Interfaces. To create panels and menu boxes, take a look at [NinePatchFrame]. Its Stretch Mode property controls the texture's scale and placement. It can scale, tile and stay centered inside its bounding rectangle. TextureRect is one of the 5 most common nodes to create game UI.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.STRETCH_SCALE_ON_EXPAND
member.summary: Scale to fit the node's bounding rectangle, only if [code]expand[/code] is [code]true[/code]. Default [code]stretch_mode[/code], for backwards compatibility. Until you set [code]expand[/code] to [code]true[/code], the texture will behave like [code]STRETCH_KEEP[/code].

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.STRETCH_SCALE
member.summary: Scale to fit the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.STRETCH_TILE
member.summary: Tile inside the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.STRETCH_KEEP
member.summary: The texture keeps its original size and stays in the bounding rectangle's top-left corner.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.STRETCH_KEEP_CENTERED
member.summary: The texture keeps its original size and stays centered in the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.STRETCH_KEEP_ASPECT
member.summary: Scale the texture to fit the node's bounding rectangle, but maintain the texture's aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.STRETCH_KEEP_ASPECT_CENTERED
member.summary: Scale the texture to fit the node's bounding rectangle, center it and maintain its aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Godot.TextureRect.STRETCH_KEEP_ASPECT_COVERED
member.summary: Scale the texture so that the shorter side fits the bounding rectangle. The other side clips to the node's limits.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureRect.Texture
member.summary: The node's [Texture] resource.

member.name: P:Godot.TextureRect.Expand
member.summary: If [code]true[/code], the texture scales to fit its bounding rectangle. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TextureRect.StretchMode
member.summary: Controls the texture's behavior when you resize the node's bounding rectangle. Set it to one of the [code]STRETCH_*[/code] constants. See the constants to learn more.

member.name: T:Godot.Theme
member.summary: Theme for skinning controls. Controls can be skinned individually, but for complex applications it's more efficient to just create a global theme that defines everything. This theme can be applied to any [Control], and it and its children will automatically use it. Theme resources can be alternatively loaded by writing them in a .theme file, see docs for more info.

member.name: T:Godot.Thread
member.summary: A unit of execution in a process. Can run methods on [Object]s simultaneously. The use of synchronization via [Mutex], [Semaphore] is advised if working with shared objects.

member.name: M:Godot.Thread.Start(Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts a new [code]Thread[/code] that runs "method" on object "instance" with "userdata" passed as an argument. The "priority" of the [code]Thread[/code] can be changed by passing a PRIORITY_* enum. Returns OK on success, or ERR_CANT_CREATE on failure.

member.name: M:Godot.Thread.GetId
member.summary: Returns the current [code]Thread[/code]s id, uniquely identifying it among all threads.

member.name: M:Godot.Thread.IsActive
member.summary: Returns true if this [code]Thread[/code] is currently active. An active [code]Thread[/code] cannot start work on a new method but can be joined with [method wait_to_finish].

member.name: M:Godot.Thread.WaitToFinish
member.summary: Joins the [code]Thread[/code] and waits for it to finish. Returns what the method called returned.

member.name: T:Godot.TileMap
member.summary: Node for 2D tile-based maps. Tilemaps use a [TileSet] which contain a list of tiles (textures plus optional collision, navigation, and/or occluder shapes) which are used to create grid-based maps.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.INVALID_CELL
member.summary: Returned when a cell doesn't exist.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.MODE_SQUARE
member.summary: Orthogonal orientation mode.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.MODE_ISOMETRIC
member.summary: Isometric orientation mode.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.MODE_CUSTOM
member.summary: Custom orientation mode.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.HALF_OFFSET_X
member.summary: Half offset on the X coordinate.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.HALF_OFFSET_Y
member.summary: Half offset on the Y coordinate.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.HALF_OFFSET_DISABLED
member.summary: Half offset disabled.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.TILE_ORIGIN_TOP_LEFT
member.summary: Tile origin at its top-left corner.

member.name: F:Godot.TileMap.TILE_ORIGIN_CENTER
member.summary: Tile origin at its center.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.Mode
member.summary: The TileMap orientation mode. Uses MODE_* constants. Default value: MODE_SQUARE.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.TileSet
member.summary: The assigned [TileSet].

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellSize
member.summary: The TileMap's cell size.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellQuadrantSize
member.summary: The TileMap's quadrant size. Optimizes drawing by batching, using chunks of this size. Default value: 16.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellCustomTransform
member.summary: The custom [Transform2D] to be applied to the TileMap's cells.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellHalfOffset
member.summary: Amount to offset alternating tiles. Uses HALF_OFFSET_* constants. Default value: HALF_OFFSET_DISABLED.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellTileOrigin
member.summary: Position for tile origin. Uses TILE_ORIGIN_* constants. Default value: TILE_ORIGIN_TOP_LEFT.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CellYSort
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the TileMap's children will be drawn in order of their Y coordinate. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionUseKinematic
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] TileMap collisions will be handled as a kinematic body. If [code]false[/code] collisions will be handled as static body. Default value: [code]false[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionFriction
member.summary: Friction value for static body collisions (see [code]collision_use_kinematic[/code]). Default value: 1.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionBounce
member.summary: Bounce value for static body collisions (see [code]collision_use_kinematic[/code]). Default value: 0.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionLayer
member.summary: The collision layer(s) for all colliders in the TileMap.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.CollisionMask
member.summary: The collision mask(s) for all colliders in the TileMap.

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.OccluderLightMask
member.summary: The light mask assigned to all light occluders in the TileMap. The TileSet's light occluders will cast shadows only from Light2D(s) that have the same light mask(s).

member.name: P:Godot.TileMap.TileData
member.summary: A [PoolIntArray] containing

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetTileset(Godot.TileSet)
member.summary: Set the current tileset.

member.summary: Return the current tileset.

member.summary: Set the orientation mode as square, isometric or custom (use MODE_* constants as argument).

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetMode

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetHalfOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set a half offset on the X coordinate, Y coordinate, or none (use HALF_OFFSET_* constants as argument). Half offset sets every other tile off by a half tile size in the specified direction.

member.summary: Return the current half offset configuration.

member.summary: Set the cell size.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCellSize
member.summary: Return the cell size.

member.summary: Set the quadrant size, this optimizes drawing by batching chunks of map at draw/cull time. Allowed values are integers ranging from 1 to 128.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetQuadrantSize
member.summary: Return the quadrant size.

member.summary: Set the tile origin to the tile center or its top-left corner (use TILE_ORIGIN_* constants as argument).

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetTileOrigin
member.summary: Return the tile origin configuration.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetCenterX(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set tiles to be centered in x coordinate. (by default this is false and they are drawn from upper left cell corner).

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCenterX
member.summary: Return true if tiles are to be centered in x coordinate (by default this is false and they are drawn from upper left cell corner).

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetCenterY(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set tiles to be centered in y coordinate. (by default this is false and they are drawn from upper left cell corner).

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCenterY
member.summary: Return true if tiles are to be centered in y coordinate (by default this is false and they are drawn from upper left cell corner).

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetYSortMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the Y sort mode. Enabled Y sort mode means that children of the tilemap will be drawn in the order defined by their Y coordinate. A tile with a higher Y coordinate will therefore be drawn later, potentially covering up the tile(s) above it if its sprite is higher than its cell size.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.IsYSortModeEnabled
member.summary: Return the Y sort mode.

member.summary: Set the tilemap to handle collisions as a kinematic body (enabled) or a static body (disabled).

member.summary: Return whether the tilemap handles collisions as a kinematic body.

member.summary: Set the collision layer. Layers are referenced by binary indexes, so allowable values to describe the 20 available layers range from 0 to 2^20-1.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCollisionLayer
member.summary: Return the collision layer.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.SetCollisionMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the collision masks. Masks are referenced by binary indexes, so allowable values to describe the 20 available masks range from 0 to 2^20-1.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCollisionMask
member.summary: Return the collision mask.

member.summary: Set the collision friction parameter. Allowable values range from 0 to 1.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCollisionFriction
member.summary: Return the collision friction parameter.

member.summary: Set the collision bounce parameter. Allowable values range from 0 to 1.

member.name: M:Godot.TileMap.GetCollisionBounce
member.summary: Return the collision bounce parameter.

member.summary: Set the tile index for the cell referenced by its grid-based X and Y coordinates. A tile index of -1 clears the cell. Optionally, the tile can also be flipped over the X and Y coordinates or transposed.

member.summary: Set the tile index for the cell referenced by a Vector2 of grid-based coordinates. A tile index of -1 clears the cell. Optionally, the tile can also be flipped over the X and Y axes or transposed.

member.summary: Return the tile index of the referenced cell.

member.summary: Return whether the referenced cell is flipped over the Y axis.

member.summary: Return whether the referenced cell is transposed, i.e. the X and Y axes are swapped (mirroring with regard to the (1,1) vector).
